Job Title: Senior Systems Engineer – Project Engineer, Helicopters
Job Description:
QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Why don’t you join some of the world’s finest scientific and technical minds and help us make tomorrow work today?

Job description/Person specification
Senior Systems Engineer - Aerospace

Permanent, Salisbury

Within Systems Engineering we are looking for Senior Systems Engineers to fulfil the roles within the Air Engineering business, with excellent leadership skills and who is willing to work in a team environment, both civilian and military.

What will I be doing?

As a Systems Engineer you will operate at platform level and be the overarching technical lead for projects, accountable for the technical solution, its quality and assurance and delivery to schedule.

You will coordinate activities between the various disciplines, working in partnership with the Project Managers to ensure a consistent approach to the creation and delivery of our products and advice.

You will engage with our customers to elicit and understand their requirements, and manage the process of analysis and decomposition of the requirements.

You will also provide significant technical support to the Sales and Bid teams in terms of the creation of the Technical Delivery Plans and estimates, supported by Subject Matter Experts, to develop robust technical solutions.

What do I need?

A strong aerospace background

HNC/HND/Degree in a relevant subject, or other qualifications with suitable experience

Recent experience of delivering multi-disciplinary complex solutions

Knowledge and understanding of a Systems Engineering V-Model approach

A good knowledge of UK Military Aviation Authority regulatory publications, certification, Release to Service, and UK military trials activities and processes

The following would be desirable:
Chartered/Incorporated Engineer Status or the willingness to undertake the application for registration
Experience of aviation trials
Experience in the identification of hazards and subsequent risk assessment, combined with the ability to clearly articulate these in written and verbal communications.

Job Title: Claims Analyst
Start Date: As soon as possible
Contract Type: Permanent
Salary Range: up to £38,400 DOE
Location: Gloucester or Eastleigh (travel between sites will be required)

Claims Analyst: Our Ageas Claims department are looking to bring on board a dynamic and driven Claims Analyst to join either our Gloucester or Eastleigh team. Initially working from home until it is safe and appropriate to return to the office.
Working closely with the leadership team the Claims Analyst will play a leading role in the team as they will be responsible for helping to drive business success by developing, reviewing and analysing new data sources in claims. By continuously improving and developing Claims MI reporting the Claims Analyst will help feed innovative processes and change to help contribute to the development of our claims strategies. Experience working in Claims and an Insurance environment is desirable however not essential.

The Claims Analyst must have strong numerical and analytical skills to be able to analyse and review data to help create and deliver business change and to closely monitor these changes to help improve business processes and ultimately performance. Therefore, a proven track record of effectively reviewing data to help implement and lead change to drive business success is a must. Furthermore, strong communication and strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to lead and influence is also a must.

The Claims Analyst is a fantastic opportunity for someone who thrives working in a changing environment and who enjoys variety in their role and who would like to lead and work on a number of exciting projects where they will have the opportunity to directly influence business change.

Main responsibilities as the Claims Analyst:
Continuously respond, improve and develop Claims MI reporting and contribute to the development of claims strategies.
Help create and deliver effective and accurate reporting and help influence process improvements.
Review the management information produced within the departments to propose ways to improve the claims process.
To ensure that all regular jobs allocated run on schedule, including monthly reporting.
To work with claims operational areas to support and develop staff in delivering enhanced operational MI capabilities.
To help create and deliver effective and accurate reporting.
Skills and experience you need as the Claims Analysts:
High level of analytical and technical skills in turning data into understandable, concise and visually appealing information through manipulation and analysis.
A high level of problem-solving ability is required, along with an ability to engage in research.
Knowledge of the data stored in Claims systems and spreadsheets and a keen understanding of how to access the data.
Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence and drive business change.
Ability to manage workload and be self-motivated and able to work to deadlines without supervision, demonstrating the ability to plan and prioritise a wide range of activities.
Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy within the Claims Analyst role based in either Gloucester or Eastleigh:
A competitive pension for which Ageas will pay twice the amount.
Generous amount of holidays with the option to buy up to 10 additional days.
Annual Salary review.
Discretionary annual bonus based on personal and company performance.
Life assurance of 4 x salary with the option to flex up.
Return to work programme scheme.
Flexible benefits package (private medical insurance, health and dental plans, free life assurance policy, discounted gym membership, cycle to work scheme as well as discounts with a wide range of retailers through our partner Perkz.com).
Support groups- well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.

Coventry Building Society has grown into the second largest building society in the UK. Despite being a national Society, it keeps its local values and loyalty, and its caring family ethos.
The best way to judge a company is based on what the people who work there say. Our recent employee survey rated us Number 2 in the Sunday Times 25 Best Big Companies to Work For list. We offer not only fulfilling jobs and exciting career opportunities but a place where everyone can be long and feel proud to work. What makes us such a rich and progressive place to work is the huge variety of people that make up our workforce.
And of course, we don’t pretend that what you do for us is all there is to you. We want you to bring your whole self to work – parent, carer, artist, triathlete, introvert… whatever it is that makes you YOU. We offer the balance to make sure you have plenty of time to do the things you need or want to do alongside work, because we know that’s how you are able to be your best.
About You
We’re recruiting for a Senior Business Analyst with a proven delivery record, responsible for deciding the analysis approach and delivering to the business needs across multiple technology domains, on large complex projects.
You will be excited by change and have experience of all areas of business analysis including early design discussions, shaping and scoping the project right through the project lifecycle, including implementation support.
You will have experience of taking the lead for business analysis on projects or programmes, with responsibility for the approach, critical assessment and quality of delivery. Experience of analysis, facilitation and business readiness on a wide variety of projects and large complex programmes is essential.
You will be seen as a role model in leading and motivating a team, having significant experience of leading and directing other analysts or business staff, and forecasting resource needs for the analysis workstreams.
You will be able to build strong relationships with business stakeholders and other project delivery resources, with a clear focus on the successful delivery of the change objectives.
You understand the overarching business strategy and the impact that design decisions have on stakeholders. You’ll be able to articulate issues and design concepts clearly to stakeholders and project team members,
You will influence opinion at all levels of the organisation, listening, challenging and collaboratively solving to deliver both business and programme outcomes, and not afraid to challenge the status quo to find a better way of getting things done whilst influencing others to follow.
You will interpret and challenge business needs and work with technical teams and solution owners to understand how their solution can deliver against these requirements.
You will maintain a line of sight across multiple workstreams or projects, you will be able to look for contradictions and gaps in proposed changes and make recommendations for solutions.
Essential Experience:
Professional business analysis qualifications and/or agile practitioner
Telephony, Cloud Migration/backup, NFR’s, System Analysis,
A brilliant problem solver, with an innovative attitude and the ability to deal with complex issues when they arise.

About the business
It’s no secret that we are a rapidly expanding population and that we need to preserve our food production systems, whilst reducing our environmental impact. At Better Origin, we have developed insect rearing and processing systems to convert our organic waste into insect biomass, an alternative protein source that is highly nutritious yet has a low environmental impact. Feeding insects to livestock improves their health and welfare, resulting in happier and more sustainably farmed animals.
Job summary
We’re looking for hard-working, passionate individuals who love to drive change, want to drive positive impact, and thrive in a start-up environment to join us in Cambridge and help us deliver the best possible insect farming solutions. This specific role will be fundamental in the success of our flagship product, the Better Origin X1 modular insect mini-farm.
Better Origin is offering the right candidate a full-time role, focused predominantly on designing, managing and improving the control systems of our insect mini farms located throughout the UK. You will have the opportunity to take on a role within the Engineering Team, supporting and enabling the technical success of the Better Origin insect mini-farms. You will work with, and be supported by a highly innovative passionate team.
Candidate duties
You will take on ownership for the automated insect facility control system design, programming, and its maintenance
Instrumentation and Sensor selection that goes into X1s
Updating and developing design documentation, user support manuals, troubleshooting guides
Providing support to customers, mostly remotely but on-site visits will be required from time-to-time
Proactively identify and implement improvements to the control system
Innovate and drive simplification and improvement agenda
Work within the broader Engineering team in delivering enabling insect farming and processing technologies
Essential Experience/Skills/Qualifications:
Degree level qualification within a relevant engineering discipline
3-5 years experience in an automation or control systems engineering role
Experience of working with and programming PLC-based systems (Siemens, Allen Bradley, Eaton)
Knowledge of process instrumentation and sensor selection
Experience of working with HV/LV electrical systems, electrical system design
Knowledge and understanding of control system networking over protocols such as Modbus, Profinet, TCIP/IP
Knowledge and understanding of process safety system design using instrumentation and control, along with relevant standards such as IEC 61508 & 61511
Full driving license & access to a vehicle (occasional on-site visits)
Desirable Experience/Skills/Qualifications:
Hands on experience working with and programming Siemens S7 PLCs in the TIA Portal environment
Hands on practical experience with instrumentation, electrical and control system installation
Experience in agricultural, feed/food processing and/or manufacturing sectors
Experience of more general software programming (C, C++, Java, Python etc)
Experience in a role developing concepts into prototypes and working solutions is desirable
Food waste, animal welfare, food security, climate change – there are so many challenges facing our planet. But there is a solution; the solution is nature and using insects to fix the broken food system, and Better Origin is bringing that solution to market.
Better Origin is an innovative and exciting Cambridge-based SME working to improve our food chains.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Monday to Friday

Due to the nature of the role, off-site / home working will be a possibility for part of the week (if preferred over an office environment located in Cambridge's Future Business Centre).

control systems: 3 years (Required)

driving (Required)

Ordnance Survey (OS) provides national mapping services for Great Britain and is world-leading provider of geospatial solutions.
OS location data and expertise has helped governments make smarter decisions, businesses gain valuable data insight, and everyone experience the world outside for over 225 years.
Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.
Join us and you’ll have an opportunity to make an impact. To empower projects that deliver real-world benefits across Britain and internationally. To hear our customers say they couldn’t have done it without us. And to be central to OS’s vision: to be recognised as world leaders in geospatial services; creating location insight for positive impact.
About the role
We are looking for a proactive and technical Test Analyst to join our test community within the Engineering group. You will identify, manage and execute testing on agile projects for both, hosted and cloud-based solutions.
This is a unique opportunity for testing front-end customer facing websites, mobile applications, back-end APIs and the integration layers. A technical role requiring knowledge of test automation, cloud-based infrastructure testing, API testing, front-end web-based application testing including e-commerce sites and mobile applications, security testing, performance and load testing.
You will be responsible for delivering the test activities to meet the functional and non-functional requirements and ambitions of our stakeholders, whist contributing to effective agile delivery. Working closely with Software Engineers based at OS and also third-party vendors in conducting automation, exploratory and regression testing using a variety of development and test frameworks in a CI/CD environment.
You will regularly participate in estimation activities and are encouraged to identify opportunities to maximise test benefit within the team. You will report to, provide regular updates and provide support to the domain Test Lead. You will communicate test goals and issues between technical teams, leads, architects, delivery managers and stakeholders.
What we’re looking for
Business requirements with the ability to work with delivery teams and stakeholders to develop appropriate test approach and define acceptance criteria for successful delivery
Design appropriate automated and manual test suites to ensure adequate and effective test coverage and assurance
Analytical skills, designing and implementing tests around TDD/BDD feature files for functional and non-functional test activities
Technical skills in test automation frameworks and languages like Selenium and Rest Assured
Execute test suites to ensure full test coverage, quality and adherence to acceptance test criteria
Testing web applications, Ecommerce sites and mobile applications using manual and automation techniques
Maximise the benefits of appropriate test tools and practices to ensure efficient and successful delivery
Working in an agile methodology whilst engaging with engineers and third-party delivery teams
Experience or knowledge in the following areas would be advantageous:
Testing (component, integration, end-to-end, UAT), non-functional testing (techniques, tools) creating build and release pipelines for CI/CD, testing on a cloud platform and awareness of security policies (OWASP Top 10) and geospatial systems/technologies.
The rewards
We want you to love what you do. That’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:

37 hour working week (with flexible working options)
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Plus, a suite of excellent additional benefits

Vacancy Name Security Operations Analyst
Employment Type Full-Time
Location Milton Keynes - LWH
Job Role
As a member of the Information Security – Security Operations team (SecOps), you will maintain the confidentiality, availability and integrity of MIB’s information and information systems. This will primarily be achieved through identification and mitigation of risk through security systems management and incident management.
Delivery of the ‘run’ state for the security technical systems, services and defenses at MIB’
Rapid response, detection, isolation and remediation of information security incidents
Route-cause identification through forensic and security knowledge expertise
Research and within the security community informed to enable a rapid response to threats and alignment to industry trends
To provide a focal point within MIB for technical information security expertise

Key Outputs
Responsible for ‘Run’ state of all Information Security (technical) systems
Rapid response, detection, isolation and remediation of information security incidents
Working with problem management teams on mitigation and incident prevention activities
Maintaining forensics capabilities in the identification, route-cause, containment and eradication of security threats
To monitor cyber threats and media reports against MIB’s security profile to ensure that MIB technical controls are appropriate.
To deliver a vulnerability management service that aligns to GRC risk tolerances and business needs
To establish and maintain security technical standards, procedures and guidelines
To provide IS teams with security focused technical support, training and consultancy to ensure compliance with security standards, policies and legislation
Retain a working knowledge of related MIB services areas such as Cloud & end user computing to enable effective liaison with other technical groups and the coherent protection of MIB services
Produce performance metrics to demonstrate the efficiency and effectiveness of IS and Security Operations controls
Develop and operate procedures that counteract potential threats/vulnerabilities
Support of the IS Change Management Process ensuring that information security risks are identified and addressed
To provide a focal point within MIB for technical information security expertise
Assist in the rapid execution of information security initiatives by maintaining an appropriate level of prioritisation, focus and persistence in an environment of significant change and growth
Keep abreast of emerging trends, technologies and legislation
Establish mechanisms, behaviours and culture to encourage the protection of MIB information and information systems
Operating as a member of ‘one team’ within MIB working towards a common goal that supports a great business outcome
Future need to support On Call (Out of hours support) ensuring 24/7 security cover of MIB services

Relationships

Qualifications and Education

Skills and Knowledge
Significant exposure to Security incident response
Great technology experience and expertise across a wide range of security technical products and services
Think like a hacker – Understand the tools and skills used to attack systems to protect MIB against such threats
Thorough understanding of the Information security threat landscape, significant risks, technical developments and directions.
Strong interpersonal skills are essential, as the jobholder must be able to operate effectively at all levels within and outside of MIB
At least 3 years in IT Security/IT Operations, or equivalent position
A good understanding of threats and threat vectors
Proven experience in writing Information Security Standards, procedures and guidelines
Ability to conduct and direct research into threats and vulnerabilities and preventative capabilities
Due to Covid-19 we are currently working from home but this role is based in our offices in Linford Wood, Milton Keynes
Salary is circa £60,000 depending on experience

Benefits

Contract Type Permanent
Applications Close Date

We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Credit & Reporting Analyst to join our team in the Finance European Shared Service Centre based in Swindon. The SSC provides a centralised support service to Praxair Surface Technologies operations in the UK, Italy, France and Germany. The Senior Credit & Reporting Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the Credit & A.R reporting are completed accurately and on time, completing credit reviews, risk analysis & recommendations. They will manage the Accounts Receivable ledger for France, actively work/support to reduce bad debt across Europe. Provide reporting & analysis for all European countries. They will be system savvy and have an in-depth understanding of Oracle demonstrating the ability to troubleshoot and provide solutions.
Key responsibilities include:
Interpreting company financial reports, make assessments, complete risk analysis, interpret financial data in order to summarise company performance and credit limit recommendations highlighting any associated risks. Pulling data together in a format to present the request requiring director/VP review. This is required at a European level.
Reporting & reviewing across the SSC & Credit Control function and assess what information is needed, in what format, capturing key data elements and working towards getting them scheduled/automated. Streamlining, making recommendations & improving the amount of reports generated/used across the SSC to improve efficiency.
Working across the European countries to help team members understand and work through system issues & challenges. Leading new customer implementations with electronic invoicing and automated cash application.
Credit control responsibility for managing the French Accounts receivable ledger. Managing payment performance and proforma collection activities. Providing timely support & partnership to the local office and customers. Reducing the bad debt for the region.
Maintaining SSC KPI’s, recognising opportunities to improve performance & results.
Completing GL uploads & reconciliations.
Praxair Surface Technologies (PST) are 2,500 engineers, technologists and coating experts across more than 35 sites in 12 countries globally. A subsidiary the Linde Group, an Industrial Gas company, one of the largest in the world.
PST offers a comprehensive array of high-performance coatings and technologies to the aviation, energy and other industries. By continuously advancing coatings technologies, PST helps customers improve environmental performance, decrease energy consumption, extend component life, improve productivity, minimize downtime, reduce operating costs and produce high-quality products. Additional information can be found at www.praxairsurfacetechnologies.com.
About you:
We're looking for someone with strong analytical and quantitative skills. You will be naturally curious, digging deeper into financial statements and analysing credit risks. You will understand ratio analysis, be part or fully qualified (ACCA, CIMA) and be an Oracle subject matte expert.
It goes without saying that you have advanced excel skills and will be a strong communicator, ideally internationally. You'll have worked with credit management data for a number of years and will be able to interpret this, making recommendations for change.
The Benefits:
In return we provide a comprehensive benefits programme that supports employees and their families. We offer flexible hours and a generous holiday vacation schedule. Other benefits include competitive salaries, private health insurance, pension plans, life assurance, and more.

Job Description:
Application Support Analyst, Heathrow (West London)

Competitive Salary + Bonus + Benefits

We believe in a world more loyal, and a world more loyal starts with our people. Join us as a Application Support Analyst within our Tech department and make an impact within the team at tcc global, a hugely successful and internationally recognised leader in loyalty marketing.

About the Role

The Application Support Analyst will join an established internal IT team responsible for operational support of our global technology estate, with a specific focus on the applications and software that help run our business. You will be providing excellent customer service to our colleagues in resolving requests or issues, whilst having a strong focus on continuous improvement of the application landscape to both enhance the user experience and drive improved benefits to the organisation.

You'll make an impact to the team by:
Resolving user requests when they arise and prioritise them accordingly
Identifying, reacting to and resolve system issues/incidents
Using and maintaining our ticketing system. Using this recorded data to produce reports on trends and identify improvements.
Creating or updating relevant documentation and procedures for the benefit of the IT department or business users
Working with Senior colleagues to manage 3rd party vendors
Identifying opportunities for and delivering user training within the business, supported by training material.
Based between our offices at Heathrow House, and remotely from home, this is a varied and challenging permanent role with flexibility of how you work (currently, 2 days in the office and 3 days at home). You will be able to input and collaborate within a strong team of IT experts who are supporting the delivery of tcc solutions, so our clients can reach, reward and retain their loyalty customers across the digital and physical shopper journey.

About You

The ideal candidate for this role will be easily able to associate with the culture, entrepreneurial style and flat operating structure of tcc. You will be able to comfortably work in a fast paced, dynamic and driven environment that is non-hierarchical, and collaborative in its attitude.

With passion for customer service and tech support and previous experience in an application support role or as a Super User within the Supply Chain (e.g. where systems facilitate the end to end supply chain from the sourcing of physical product through to the end delivery to the customer), together with:
Understanding of common business processes in a product-based/Supply Chain business
Experience of supporting bespoke in-house developed systems as well as industry standard software packages
Can confidently communicate in both technical and non-technical terms with colleagues in the tech team, 3rd party software vendors and end users.
Experience with integration platforms for the movement/transformation of data
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills that are used across face to face and remote interactions, with staff at all levels of the business
Skilled in building and maintaining business relationships, including working with and managing 3rd party external software /expert development vendors
Strong documentation skills
Expert analytical skills to quickly acquire and understand a problem/situation and provide options/recommendations and take action
Ability to work independently and within a team and enjoys troubleshooting problems to establish a root cause
Service Management best practice e.g. ITIL highly desirable
Strong time management with an ability to work across multiple tasks at the same time without compromising timelines/commitments
About the Benefits & Culture

Our culture is professional, entrepreneurial and focused around our people. At the heart of our business are our core values, which we regard as fundamental to our way of working. We believe in Respect, Truth, Collaboration and Care while having fun!

A competitive base salary is on offer within an established and internationally recognised leader in loyalty marketing.

Some of our employee benefits include:
Bonus Scheme
Pension
Life Assurance
Health Care
Travel Insurance
Eye Care Vouchers & Annual Flu Jab Vaccination
Cycle to Work Scheme and Free Car Parking
tcc strives to be an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates. Information provided will be treated in strict confidence and will only be used for employment-related purpose.

Job Description:
Experienced Systems Engineer Vacancy
Semiconductor devices provide the foundations on which progress in the technology sector are enabled. From Smartphones to Artificial Intelligence, 5G communications to autonomous vehicles, all are made possible through advances in semiconductor processes. Scaling these processes requires sub-nanometer measurement of increasingly complex 3D structures to enable more powerful devices. At Infinitesima we have pioneered a revolutionary atomic precision 3D metrology technology which has been qualified by leading companies in the semiconductor industry and we believe is essential for continued progress. To quote Lord Kelvin, ‘If you can’t measure it you can’t improve it!’. Come and join our dynamic team to enable the semiconductors for tomorrow’s technological developments.
Do you have a passion for excellence and extensive experience in designing highly complex instruments? If so, we currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Systems Engineer to join our Engineering team
Location: Abingdon
Reporting to: Engineering Director
The Opportunity:
The successful candidate will receive hands on training on our current generation of Rapid Probe Metrology systems and given the responsibility to lead key design aspects of the next generation of Rapid Probe Metrology systems.
Key Responsibilities:
· Make the overall system design, defining the contributions from mechanics, optics, electronics and software and communicate to all contributors.
· Make and maintain system functionality breakdowns to mechanical, electronic, optical and software modules.
· Build an in-depth understanding of the machine operating characteristics.
· Make and maintain system performance budgets – understanding how each module contributes to the total system performance.
· Feed forward learning from integration testing into new designs
Personal Qualities:
· Able to work independently, setting priorities for own work based upon the company goals and targets.
· Engages with other member for the company to bring the best solutions to the problem recognise the value that fellow company members bring to enhance own abilities. Supports colleagues with their tasks when critical to the company goals.
· In own field establishes themselves as the knowledge centre.
· React and address both short and medium term issues and proactively take action to solve them.
· Focus on the company goal, avoid distraction, making timely decisions to achieve the target.
Education / Qualifications:
· Bachelor’s degree or higher coupled with industrial experience.
Professional Skills/ Abilities:
· Essential: Ability to diagnose and fault-find to component level
· Essential: >5 years’ experience in a Design Leadership role
· Essential: Experience working on complex instruments containing, for example, optics, electronics, software, motion systems.
· Ideally: Experience in micro/nano analysis or relevant fields.
· Ideally: Experience of Systems Engineering within leading-edge instrumentation, measurement or advanced process tools, for the Semiconductor or similar end-user industry
Benefits:
In addition to a competitive starting salary and a yearly bonus. Infinitesima offers flexible working hours, 25 days annual leave, personal pension contributions and EMI Share scheme.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Job Description:
Who we are?
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.
We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, support local communities and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help realize their goals.
So, we created the leading small business loan platform. Investors have lent £9.8 billion in 130,000 loans to 90,000 small business owners. In a single year, this lending unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed £6.5 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!
Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.
What you will be doing:
This is an opportunity to join a fast-paced team where you will be responsible for completing the daily client money reconciliations. You will be involved in ad-hoc project work and will need to ensure that operational queries from stakeholders are responded to in a timely manner.
Complete daily reconciliations of client money bank accounts in accordance with CASS rules.
Participate in month-end reconciliations.
Investigate discrepancies that arise within the client money reconciliations.
Liaise with the Payments and Back-Office teams on transactions within client accounts.
Be accountable for identifying and flagging risks to client money reconciliations as they arise.
Work closely with the Product & Data teams on any systems changes or enhancements, testing the changes and ensuring controls have been built to mitigate risks.
Be involved with ad-hoc project work.
It would be great if you also:
Have a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or other quantitative discipline and at least 12 months of experience, ideally in a similar position or have reconciliation process understanding.
Have strong attention to detail with a high level of numerical accuracy, as well as an investigative and problem-solving mindset and are passionate about continuous improvement.
Work with integrity and discretion when handling confidential financial information.
Can demonstrate exceptional organisational skills and are able to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines. On top of this, you are someone who is a team player, who can take responsibility and work with a high level of autonomy.
Please note that this role is a non-core financial role
Bonus points:
CASS knowledge.
Intermediate to advanced excel skills
VBA/Macro knowledge.
Technical aptitude and/or experience developing systems and processes
Are you?
An ambitious individual who is looking to continue their career with a Fintech company and are proactive with an appetite to improve processes and controls?
Do you thrive when challenged to come up with better ways to do things? Do you express yourself and have plenty of ideas, but interested to hear others’ too?
Do you work hard, learn fast, and do whatever it takes to get the job done?

Why should you join us?
We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by all of our Circlers.
We think of ourselves as the career launchpad. A place to develop yourself, fast. Real work. Real experience. Real opportunities to collect skills. Think big remits and huge ownership to make great things happen.
Yes, it’s target-driven and high-octane – but we like to play hard too. That’s what makes us, us. Our vibrant culture is built around potential and creating a place where you can really be you. We keep it agile and open. All voices heard. Because we believe great ideas come from everywhere.
If you show skill and are willing, we’ll back you all the way. This is the place for you to build something incredible.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better. We particularly encourage applications from applicants from underrepresented backgrounds. We welcome applicants who may want to work flexibly.
Want to Build The Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

Snapshot
We're hiring for a passionate quantitative analyst to work at the intersection of insights and engineering, improving DeepMind's internal decision making!
About Us
DeepMind's mission is to "Solve intelligence. Use it to make the world a better place."
The Data & Analytics team builds on this with an objective to "improve decision-making through relevant insights to achieve our mission". We work closely with partners across the company to:
Deliver insights and improve decision-making
Cultivate DeepMind's analytics culture & community
Contribute to our analytics infrastructure
Success across these areas will have a material impact on the company's operations and management, offering exciting opportunities to dive deeply into a wide array of technical analysis, collaborate closely with talented partners throughout the organisation, and apply/grow your skill set.
Some examples of the types of work you might encounter on a day-to-day basis:
Mine large-scale datasets to understand patterns in compute demand and help plan future capacity
Analyse our recruitment process, conducting statistical tests to validate experimental changes to interview funnels
Present insights to senior management, translating analysis into the 'so what?' and identifying possible actions to take as a result
Partner with teams company-wide to understand key indicators of progress, develop and validate accompanying metrics, and visualise via dashboards / other reporting tools
Engineer tested, robust ETL pipelines to improve the availability of key data sources internally
Develop and deliver training on SQL, Python, data visualisation practices, and more
The role
We're looking for someone who is skilled at and motivated by helping to make and enable sound organisational decisions using quantitative data.
'Making' in the sense that you'll often be tasked to conduct rigorous analysis, using a variety of tools, to deliver meaningful insights. 'Enabling' in the manner that you're excited to help mentor and coach others in their own analytics efforts, and possess the skills to help bring greater consistency and robustness to our data sources and analytical workflows.
This role is technical in that it requires use of a diverse array of techniques and technologies to extract and prepare high-quality analysis. At the same time, there is a great deal of flexibility in your ability to focus on a subset of our team's broad mission and grow your skill set accordingly, whether that's in rigorous project management, deep statistical analysis, or robust pipeline engineering.
As a group we want to enhance the way DeepMind as a whole makes decisions and takes action, so there are many different ways team members can further this aim.
A core set of the responsibilities this role encompasses:
Work with partners to identify relevant high-level business questions and propose relevant data-focused analysis
Write queries and conduct rigorous, verifiable analysis (SQL, Python) to answer those questions
Communicate via presentations and written reports to a wide variety of stakeholders (with varying levels of seniority, technical and domain familiarity) – following through to ensure impact
Identify work appropriate for regular tracking, building appropriate reports and dashboards for consistency and ease of access
Manage several projects simultaneously, exhibiting good project management skills (timelines, expectations, progress, etc.)
Recommend changes to product/engineering roadmaps to improve data quality in source systems
Submit tested code into source control for review
Coach and mentor others in their own use of analytical tools and technique
About you
What we are looking for in the ideal candidate:
You excel at analytical problem solving with a 'nose for data', knowing which questions to ask of it, how to go about answering those questions, and how to ensure that your answer is correct.
You enjoy using a variety of technical tools to answer the question at hand. You recognise that there are lots of potential ways to approach a problem, and enjoy choosing the right tool for the job. You enjoy learning new technologies and techniques when appropriate.
You consider yourself 'business savvy'. You have proven experience working with various internal partners, and an intuition for which questions are most important to hone in on in service of our mission.
You are passionate about 'storytelling' with data. You're great at translating deeply technical analysis into insights and conclusions that everyone can grasp, independent of prior context or expertise. You know how to optimally express uncertainty in your conclusions, and key assumptions that have gone into the analytical process.
Qualities that are an asset
You are comfortable extracting and manipulating data via SQL (especially BigQuery and Google's StandardSQL implementation) and Python and the PyData stack (e.g. Pandas, Scikit-learn, Scipy, NumPy, Jupyter)
You might be familiar with some other aspects of ETL management (e.g. Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Airflow, Luigi), data modelling (e.g. DBT, Snowflake), and data visualisation (e.g. Tableau, Data Studio, d3.js, Matplotlib, Vega, Altair, etc.), or are at least excited to learn more
You like to 'work quantitatively', and have at least a basic solid understanding of statistical concepts that let you express ambiguity in your analysis and assumptions
You've previously taught yourself new tools/techniques to expand your skillset
You have experience partnering with senior decision-makers in a professional setting
You consistently strive to see 'beyond the data' and understand what your analysis represents in terms of actual reality/experience
You enjoy collaborating widely, and partnering with others to empower action and change
If you don't think you embody all of the above criteria, please still seriously consider applying! This role (and therefore the requirements) is broad, and we'd be excited to discuss how you see yourself contributing across it!
What we offer
You will join a diverse and vibrant environment where you can influence and have impact on groundbreaking research results. You will enjoy a creative and stimulating work environment and direct access to world-class researchers!
We constantly iterate on our work environment. It has been crafted to help you lead a balanced life. This goes from providing you excellent facilities (healthy food, music rooms, gym, faith rooms, terraces, spacious desks, etc) to enabling your manager to make special work arrangements if you need them. Our managers are being supported by our People and Culture team ensure we do our best to suit your needs. We also provide baby bonding leaves for both parents. Our list of arrangements is pretty extensive, so please do discuss this throughout the process.

Opening date: 10th November 2020
Closing date: 8th December 2020
DeepMind welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, maternity or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.
Competitive salary applies.

Job Summary
We are looking for analysts with experience in forensic examinations of computer devices are their associated storage media to join our industry respected and growing digital forensic laboratory. The ideal candidate must have at least 1 years’ experience in the examination of computer devices and have the knowledge, enthusiasm and flexibility to be succeed as part of our established forensic team. They will be responsible for ensuring the highest standards are maintained whilst processing, examining and reporting at all levels within the criminal justice system and for our corporate partners.

Pro-actively acquiring forensic knowledge to maintain up to date processes within the laboratory

Qualifications and Skills

Finance Analyst (EMEA)
Wunderman Thompson
Department: Finance
Location: London, United Kingdom
Who we are:


At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience.

We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology.
What you’ll be doing:


Wunderman Thompson is seeking an EMEA Finance Analyst with strong commercial and analytical acumen to support the commercial, operational and financial reporting requirements of the agency driving continuous improvements. The Finance Analyst will work closely with the wider EMEA finance team and WT HQ to provide insight and analysis of the operational performance of the agency to senior management with data to drive the right business decisions and improve the agency performance.
Direct oversight of the group reporting of key EMEA markets (around 10-15 direct offices).
Ensure integrity of financial reporting and in accordance with WPP policies and IFRS. Liaise with the global finance team on reporting matters.
Review with the markets monthly, quarterly and annual submissions including budgets, forecasts and client profitability.
Support senior members of the team with specific areas of the EMEA reporting and compliance process for the whole region.
Support with the onboarding of market’s new finance staff.
Produce management reports for markets and senior members of the team.
Build in-depth knowledge of the markets including business issues and perform risk-based financial analysis
Support markets with their SOX compliance and ensure compliance at a regional level.
Adhoc projects for EMEA Controllers and Finance Managers
Who you are:


Part Qualified ACA / CIMA / ACCA with relevant experience.
Good accounting experience in IFRS, management accounting and analytical review, system & processes review
International experience and other European languages will be an advantage
Experience in a similar position
Audit background will be an advantage
Advanced Excel skills (ability to write macros will be strong advantage)
SOX experience
Use of a consolidation tool such as Cartesis / SAP BFC
Proven ability to form strong relationships with colleagues
Proven ability to learn quickly
Energetic and practical approach, with good attention to detail
Analytical, critical, organizational skills • Good team player, confident, with a sense of humour
Clear and effective communicator
Strong work ethics & highly committed to the success of the team, region and company
What we can offer you:


We don't settle for people who can just do the job, we look for people that go beyond that and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday. We believe that this is what makes our agency a great place to be – a space where you’re never far away from the best minds to learn from.

We want you to be comfortable and proud every day of the week and have created an open and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. We don’t want you to just fit into our culture, we want your uniqueness and diversity of background to add to it and make this an agency where we all have a real sense of belonging and purpose. We are a community.

We have a number of programmes and initiatives designed to support your career and wellbeing. There are exciting knowledge sharing programmes delivered through lunch and learn sessions, cultural opportunities through our exchange programme, and you can have an impact on the wider community through one of our charity initiatives. Your career development is important to us and should you ever choose to move on from Wunderman Thompson, we want you to be better than when you joined us. YOU Time will provide you with the framework and support needed to reach your career aspirations, supported by a range of learning options for every type of learning style. Your mind, body and soul are also taken care of through our varied wellness programmes but we like to have some fun here too, so you could get involved in our culture club, find love through Wunder Dating or if you’re the chosen one, take a spin on our Wheel of Wunder!

There really is no shortage of opportunities here for the right person that is prepared to roll their sleeves up, get involved and collaborate with those around them to deliver the best work for our clients and our agency.
Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency.  For more information, please visit our website and follow Wunderman Thompson on our social channels via Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.

We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

Location Head Office
Job Details
An exciting opportunity has arisen! JATO are seeking an Automotive Application Support Analyst to join the Automotive research team based at our Head Office in Uxbridge.

The core purpose of this position is to provide support to our Automotive Researchers across the globe. The researchers work with various internal and external IT applications.

We are looking for an individual with a keen interest to work in the Automotive industry and has ideally had previous experience working within the automotive sector or similar sectors.

Key Responsibilities - Monitoring our internal ticketing systems, JIRA and working through tickets raised by Researchers across the globe
Analysing automotive specifications data and providing relevant definitions based on the requests by our specifications department
Ensuring reports are sent out for any anomalies found in data to relevant technical and research departments
Working towards continuous service improvement to improve our tools and processes that support research department
Documenting processes, flows and functional aspects for internal and external use
Collaborating with technical teams to resolve issues raised by internal and external customers
Key Requirements - Educated at degree level or previous work experience gained within a similar role
Ideally have an interest in the automotive industry
Must have exceptional communication skills in English, verbal and written
Required to resolve non-technical issues users may face
Must be process oriented, have good analytical and Problem-solving skills
Culturally sensitive as you will be collaborating with colleagues across the globe
Welcome new challenges daily and can aid in offering ideas to improve services
The willingness to adopt IT tools prone to change
Proficient with MS Packages
Please note all CVs must be submitted in English in order to be considered for the role. You must have the right to work and live in the country you are applying for.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst you will be responsible for creating and executing end-to-end test plans for both back-end and front-end applications in order to ensure that they function as expected.
You will also be assessing their performance, reliability, stability, security, and compatibility with other external systems. You will interact with staff to understand business requirements and make sure that the applications you are testing meet them.
Your contribution to something big
Plan, develop and execute test plans for REST, gRPC and Kafka-based applications throughout the whole software development life cycle (incl. after going to production)
Help to identify/resolve issues, log incident and defects, and retest fixes
Review functional and design specifications to ensure full understanding of individual deliverables (incl. business requirements)
Identify test requirements from specifications, map test case requirements and design test coverage plans.
Test databases in SQL and No SQL environments including validating stored data, structure, indices, procedures, etc.
Test back-end and front-end applications for performance, reliability, stability, security and compatibility with other external systems.
Test front-end applications on multiple devices (PCs, laptops, tables, mobile phones for both Android & iOS)
Develop and maintain standards, tools, techniques and processes applicable to testing and documentation
Provide support to staff and other stakeholders during their preparation for and execution of UAT by staff and clients, as well as when going to production
Measure the effectiveness and seek to continually improve the quality of processes
Carrying out other adhoc duties as required
Our ideal teammate has experience with/knowledge in
Planning & executing test plans in terms of performance, reliability, stability, security, compatibility and etc.
REST/gRPC/Kafka testing tools (Postman, BloomRPC, Selenium, etc.)
Troubleshooting software applications, technical documentation & writing
You will get brownie points for
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and REST, gRPC, Kafka, SQL & NoSQL databases
Basic understanding of programming languages, databases, shell scripting, JIRA, Confluence, Office 365
An IT related degree qualification
An understanding of premium finance is an advantage
Your personality
Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written, are essential
Willingness to serve clients and be empathetic to their needs
High attention to detail and a keen emphasis on accuracy
Ability to work to deadlines, along with the flexibility to manage changing priorities and the ability to multi-task
Proven ability to sustain high level of performance under pressure and remain focused
Ability to self-motivate, self-manage and work both autonomously and as part of a team

Role Summary
Advent is looking for a Junior Systems Developer to join a new team, and help deliver exciting products to the London insurance market.
Key Responsibilities
· Create new Automation, Analytics, and other Solutions through software such as AutoMate that can be utilized to provide value to Advent’s current and future business model, or for potential clients. This will include preparing, running and maintaining manual test scripts within the AutoMate product.
· Aid the delivery of high quality, innovative and fully performing Advent solutions that comply with technical design expectations, mainly through Automation. Work closely with experts in the Insurance industry to understand the challenge and deliver functional Scripts that add value to Advent’s clients or services.
· Support and development of the organisation's existing IT applications and services.
· Depending on the candidate, the opportunity to branch out and use Low-code software development solutions such as OutSystems or Netcall’s Liberty Creates to develop systems to aid the London Insurance Market, or for internal use.
· Mentorship; Regular 1:1 sessions, Objectives and Appraisal processes, Team meetings.
Key Duties
· Creation, running and Maintenance of Automation scripts using the ‘AutoMate’ tool
· Liaise directly with Business Analysts, Clients and other Advent Colleagues to understand business requirements and refine scrips accordingly.
· Working as part of a team to deliver projects to clients and the market.
Skills, Capabilities and Experience required
· 1-3 years’ experience in an Automation role, such as Test automation. Ideally using the AutoMate software suite.
· Knowledge of coding is advantageous but not necessary. A programming/computing mindset is vital.
· Experience working as part of a team and/or directly with Clients will aid your application.
Any London Market Insurance, or back end Insurance Knowledge would be a benefit

QuantSpark is an innovative boutique strategic analytics consultancy based in London. Our hybrid team combines the best of strategy consulting, data analytics and product development to deliver creative and impactful solutions to public and private sector clients. We go beyond the remit of traditional strategy consultancies by deploying advanced data analytics and software engineering capabilities to build bespoke tools that deliver long-lasting value – the tools and solutions we create become embedded in our clients’ daily operations. Our ever-growing client base consists of FTSE 100 retailers, prestigious Private Equity houses and governments.

As a Senior Analyst at QuantSpark, you will be joining a team of driven, entrepreneurial, and intellectually-curious analysts who are laser-focused on providing commercial impact. We're a small but super-effective team so in particular we look out for Analysts who have entrepreneurial flair and an ability to understand what's important for our clients.

Our work spans a broad range of clients from the private and public sectors including one of the UK's largest supermarkets, a leading mens fashion retailer, a strategic communications agency, Google, Young Enterprise, and the United Nations.

While our approach to supporting smarter decisions is industry-agnostic, most of our work involves analysing large datasets and complex systems within the context of optimising customer behaviour for retailers and portfolio companies owned by private equity funds. The breadth of the support we provide our clients covers strategic planning, sales, marketing, and their own product development. Some recent questions we've been asked to tackle include:
"We want to maximise gross profit within 18 months, should we double our online marketing spend to £10m in order to achieve this?"
"How can we understand customer missions at each of our nationwide stores and adjust store space accordingly?"
"Where will Universal Credit rollout happen over the next 12 months and how will that affect rental arrears?"
Requirements

We welcome applications from anyone with a track-record of super-powering decisions with data and an ambition to have practical impact. We're looking for people with a creative and robust approach to solving problems with experience of managing small teams of Analysts.

Some of our recent modelling and development work includes:
Analysing 1bn+ annual transactions to build a tool for a UK supermarket to help them decide how much space to allocate to their 1,500+ stores
Developing an ROI system to understand effectiveness of £5m+ of social media advertising campaigns
Building an automated marketing segmentation model to nudge millions of customers
Developing terrorist content algorithms to detect propaganda and work with internet platforms to tackle this content
Creating automated dashboards to help a private equity fund understand the performance of its B2C portfolio companies
Developing a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns
So who are we looking for? You will have a range of analytical, commercial, and interpersonal qualities including:
Analytical ability - bringing to bear brainpower to analyse complex scenarios
Attention to detail - demanding the very highest standards of quality
Technical creativity - applying intellectual dexterity to unusual problems
Grit - encouraging others through your "can-do" attitude
Desire to learn - striving to learn and to teach others
Communication - articulating yourself with precision and nous
Confidence - showing leadership with teams and with clients
Essential:
Experience of managing small teams of Analysts and Data Scientists
Experience in strategy consultancy, or in an in-house strategy / analytics position within industry such as a retailer
Demonstrable proficiency in SQL and one of R or Python
Strong MS Excel skills, with VBA being a plus
Experience configuring BI tools (and ETL processes in general)
Understanding machine learning approaches
Writing client deliverables such as reports and presentations
Unfortunately we are not able to sponsor visas to work in the UK at this moment.

Benefits
Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
£40-55k salary (based on experience)
Monthly training & conference budget
25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
Pension contribution scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Top-notch kit with high-end Macs standard for everyone
Monthly socials and dinners

Description
Job Description:
Leidos are a growing company delivering innovative technology and solutions focused on safeguarding critical capabilities and transformation in frontline services, our work in the United Kingdom includes addressing some of the most complex problems in defence, healthcare, government, safety and security, and transportation.
https://www.leidos.com/company/global/uk-europe
We are now looking for an experienced Third Line Support / Systems Engineer to join an onsite team providing Operations and Maintenance (O&M) support to the UK Ministry of Defence (MOD). The candidate’s main role will be to provide server and systems administration support alongside the existing team.
Tasking will include onsite daily systems administration maintenance activities supporting users of the System. There is also potential for development work enhancing the system.
The role will involve working alongside the customer and within a team; The successful applicant will be required to coordinate with other team members and be able to prioritise and schedule their work.
Assisting with coordination and execution of Tier 3 / 4 support initiatives.
Out of hours support will be required as requested.
Competences/Skills:
Soft skills: The ability to work well with others and be of a helpful disposition.
Communication skills: The ability to communicate clearly with others, particularly technical concepts to non-technical users.
Technical experience, working knowledge of the following disciplines is required:
Microsoft Windows client/server system architectures and administration;
Microsoft Exchange Server; Microsoft SharePoint;
Virtualisation (VM WARE);
Storage solutions including Storage Area Network Arrays (SANs) and Backup Recovery Systems;
Education:
A firm grounding in a scientific, technical or engineering discipline (ideally at first degree level)
Experience:
The candidate will have some experience of delivering technical support to users.
Desirable Skills;
Public sector experience, ideally having worked with the Ministry of Defence and the Armed Forces
Microsoft® Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) or equivalent certification strongly recommended.
Some knowledge of LAN/WAN network architectures and Cisco IOS based routers/switches;
Must be willing to gain DV clearance
What do we do for you?
We offer meaningful and engaging careers, a collaborative culture, and support for your career goals, all while nurturing a healthy work-life balance.
We provide an employment package that attracts, develops and retains only the best in talent.
Our reward scheme includes:
Contributory Pension Scheme
Private Medical Insurance
33 days Annual Leave (including public and privilege holidays)
Access to Flexible benefits (including life assurance, health schemes, and cycle to work scheme)
External Referral Bonus:
Ineligible
Potential for Telework:
No
Clearance Level Required:
Other Clearance
Travel:
No
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
37.5
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional
Job Family:
Systems Engineering

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

RWE Supply & Trading GmbH, London, United Kingdom (GB)
To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent

RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we invest heavily in the expansion of our renewables´ capacities. Our broad portfolio includes flexible, conventional energies and helps us provide clean, reliable and affordable electricity. 120 years of experience in the energy world and our four operative segments – renewable energies, lignite and nuclear power, European electricity generation from gas, coal, hydropower and biomass as well as global energy trading – are the foundation for the innovations of tomorrow. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.

An exciting new opportunity arose for a Quantitative Analyst in the Quantitative Analytics team of Structuring & Valuation in London.

The Quantitative Analytics team is a cross-locational team, represented in Essen, London and Swindon. The team provide decision support to several desks and develop / support standardised pricing and optimisation tools / libraries for all desks in all locations.
Decision support for trading desks and CAO (Commercial Asset Optimisation) include valuations, risk assessments, development of methodologies, model prototyping, calibrations, and ad-hoc analysis for complex / new products and assets as well as trading strategies. With that all desks in the UK are covered, both in London (mainly Gas, LNG) and Swindon (mainly Freight, CAO UK).
Furthermore, standardised, often large-scale models are developed and supported in the team as global solutions, which include an extensive library providing tool sets with consistent valuation and risk management functionality that are globally available and used in all RWEST locations. In addition, various global solutions are based on stand-alone models that are applied for valuations and management of complex products / assets (e.g. swing / storage deals, generation assets, freight time charters) that are applied in all relevant locations, including all UK desks above as well as all relevant desks in Essen (mainly SBU Gas and CAO CE).
In addition to the desks Quantitative Analytics cooperate closely with other S&V teams as well as Risk and Embedded IT to deliver and integrate relevant solutions into the systems used by Risk (Endur) and the commercial functions.

Your tasks
Developing new and improving existing models and rolling applications into production
Development, enhancement and maintenance of an existing C++ based library
Work closely with the Front Office, Risk Control and IT to specify and implement model requirements, enhancing procedures and performance, ensuring effective data management and user interfaces
Model and application testing and documentation
Research new methodologies and areas of model applications and identify potential improvements to current models
Produce analysis based on relevant models and methodologies
Help to document, support and further develop other trading applications
Providing statistical and mathematical analyses of trading and market data to facilitate business decision-making, model development and calibration
Engaging with traders and other customers to understand problems and opportunities, formulation and implementation of solutions; presentation of findings, delivery and ongoing support of applications
Providing support to trading desks (in particular, in London) through support of trading tools / models, scenario analysis, explanations / resolutions of issues, analysis of valuations and hedging strategies (incl. backtesting)
Liaise with other departments (including outside RWEST) as required

Your profile
Advanced quantitative degree to Diploma / Masters / PhD level or equivalent
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills and attention to detail
Strong mathematical understanding with advanced knowledge of financial mathematics
A good knowledge of valuation and risk analysis methods for complex products / derivative instruments (preferably in the energy / commodity markets)
Be commercially oriented and have the ability to apply quantitative expertise to deliver added value for the trading desks / CAO
Experience with the development / design of valuation models / risk analysis systems (preferably in the energy / commodity markets)
Substantial experience with the implementation of numerical methods and an understanding on how to implement algorithms efficiently
Experience with Windows and the MS Excel integration technologies (VBA, XLA, XLL, COM, .net, Interop)
Development experience using C++ and C# (experience with other programming languages, e.g. Python, would be advantageous)
Good communication skills and the ability to translate complex real-world requirements into quantitative terms, analytic models and proper IT solutions
The ability to work effectively in the team as well as to use initiative in dealing with tasks autonomously
The ability to engage and communicate effectively with clients / stakeholders, particularly Traders and Risk
Some work experience in energy trading or financial organisations would be advantageous

What we offer
Modern company culture and flat hierarchies
Working within a highly motivated international team where continuous development and feedback culture are actively encouraged
Interesting and diversified area of responsibility which allows high level of self development
RWE stands for openness, real teamwork and development of individuals
Attractive compensation and company benefits including but not limited to attractive company pension, gym membership, private heathcare, extra holidays and more

Contact
rwe.com/career
Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code 22562, application deadline 30.09.2020.
Any questions? Steph Turi (Recruiting), E: stephanie.turi@rwe.com
We look forward to meeting you!

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity.
Of course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Xing, too.
