Job Details: Service Desk Analyst

Full details of the job.
Vacancy Name Service Desk Analyst
Employment Type Full Time
Location Country United Kingdom
Location Head Office
Job Details
JATO are hiring for a Service Desk Analyst to join our Service Desk team based at our Head Office in Uxbridge.

As a Service Desk Analyst, your focus will be to provide support to our users and resolve as many incidents as possible as the first point of contact, escalating where necessary to second line support teams.

You will be responsible for providing first/ second line support across all IT equipment and consumables that are supplied to staff for their business activities, including laptops, desktop PCs and tablets, in addition to supporting software installed on these devices.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual, who has a passion for technology, can adapt to a busy working environment and has exceptional communication skills! As you will be liaising with colleagues across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities - Monitor the Service Desk queue within ITSM tool, reassigning tickets where required.
Resolving a high percentage of incidents at the first point of contact, following knowledge base articles
Ensuring all SLA’s are met, prioritising support tickets and escalating as of when required
Develop and maintain team documentation, related to 1st line support activities, including the creation and updating of knowledge articles.
Troubleshoot, diagnose and fix faulty user equipment and operating systems.
Liaise with third party software and hardware suppliers
Key Requirements - Ideally have worked within a Service Desk role/environment before
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written as you will be liaising with colleagues across different regions
Working knowledge of desktop technologies, including Windows and Active Directory
Previously worked with fault ticket management systems
Can work within a team and independently
Thoroughly enjoys problem solving
Understanding of the Office 365 suite of applications such as Sharepoint and Microsoft Teams
Basic knowledge of Web Application management
Understanding of ITIL principles
Please note all CVs must be submitted in English in order to be considered for the role. You must have the right to work and live in the country you are applying for.

Business Systems Analyst
London, London
From £50,000 to £70,000 per annum
Business Systems Analyst
London
Permanent
Salary up to £80,000
My client is looking for an experienced Senior Business Systems Analyst to join their Reporting and Analytics Team to join in an exciting project around their TM1/Planning Analytics landscape. You will be required to work with regional partners world wide in order to fully understand the requirements necessary to improve the Planning Analytics solution. My client is looking for someone from a strong finance background with a good understanding of finance (such as FP&A, Audit, Management Accounting etc). Also previous experience of working in projects revolving around TM1 or comparable EPM systems is required.
This role is for a market leading company with a fantastic work culture so they are looking for candidates with who are keen to learn, positive with excellent analytical skills. Due to the structure of the business the ability to travel (when safe) is also preferable.
If you would like to know more about this role, please send your CV to chris@systemsaccountants.com and we can arrange a time to discuss it in more detail.

Technical Data Analyst - 6- month contract - Full remote working
Currently seeking an experienced Technical Data Analyst with strong experience working with/supporting Data Architects in a complex systems environment.
The successful Data Analyst will have a project focus to help the team deliver new systems, as well as build new and improved data flows for reporting and analysis in current existing systems.
Technical experience required;
Data analyst with excellent experience in detailed data profiling and data integration
Significant data migration
Strong Oracle or SQL or SQL postgres
ETL - SSIS or Pentaho
Reporting - Qlikview ideally but PowerBI will also be considered
Cloud - AWS and/or Azure
Previous experience working with/supporting data architects
Data flows/target mapping
If you are a technically focused Data Analyst with skills and experience in the above areas, please send your CV for immediate consideration.

Trainline is an innovative, tech business with a mission to bring together the world’s rail, coach and other travel services into one simple experience. We aim to make travel easier and more accessible, encouraging people to make more environmentally sustainable travel choices. We’re hugely proud to be the world’s leading independent rail and coach travel platform and rank among the highest-rated travel and ticketing apps globally. Today, we offer our customers travel to thousands of destinations in and across 45 countries in Europe and beyond. That’s more than £3.7 billion in ticket sales annually, and over 96 million visits to our apps and websites each month. In another major milestone, last summer Trainline listed on the London Stock Exchange and is now part of the FTSE 250.
Our culture is central to our success. We’re driven to sustain our phenomenal growth from recent years, and this means we’re always working closely and collaboratively to turn our ideas into reality. It’s this sense of pace, innovating and improving pretty much everything we do, that makes Trainline so exciting and unique - we truly believe our work has a genuine impact and will change travel for the better.

The Analytics team are central to supporting the business through this continued expansion. Headed up by Peter Wood (a Performance & Analytics leader in Digital & Technology), the team’s focused on embedding smarter, more sophisticated, data-driven decisions. Our comparative advantage is that we learn faster than the competition, and the Analytics team is key to driving this agenda.
As Product Analyst , you’ll provide insight analysis to support product development across Europe and beyond whilst telling the story behind performance across app and web. You will play a critical role in enabling a culture of high volume, high velocity hypothesis driven testing to optimize both commercial and technical objectives. In addition, you’ll have the unique opportunity of being part of shaping and developing our new BI toolkit, querying a relational database and management system using visualization tools, such as Tableau, to bring data to life.

Other key responsibilities include:
· Leading analysis for web and app to deliver growth by understanding customer behaviour and interaction through qualitative and quantitative analysis
· Managing all multivariate and A/B test analytics communicating results and making recommendations to key stakeholders
· Understanding drivers of overall business performance monitoring the health of our international app and web product and ensuring regular reporting needs are met
· Supporting company-wide improvements to timely insight through a stronger platform of data and the development of more sophisticated BI tools and content
· Supporting budgeting and goal-setting across key metrics, modelling the business impact of all proposed changes
We’re looking for an analyst with strong experience of advanced data techniques and analysis. It’s also vital that you bring an innate ability to distil and communicate results of complex analysis clearly and effectively to all levels of the business.

Other key experience required includes:
· Experience of database querying languages and relational databases such as SQL or BigQuery is essential as is your ability to extract insight and recommendations from data
· Proven knowledge and capabilities using Tableau or other BI tools such as Spotfire, Power BI or MicroStrategy
· A track record of running multivariate testing using Leanplum, Sitespect or other tools.
· Experience of Adobe Omniture or Google Analytics would be an advantage
· Experience working within an e-commerce or digital business that has data driven decision making at its heart
This is a truly career defining role for someone passionate about data and technology looking for an opportunity to play a part in disrupting and defining a product that will change the way people travel and impacting millions of people every day.
We value open expression at Trainline, we believe it’s the diversity of experience, backgrounds and perspectives of our employees that makes us who we are. We encourage everybody to play a part in changing the way people travel across the world.

*** this is a 4 day a week role, we work longer days ***

Job Title: Senior Systems Engineer – Project Engineer, Helicopters
Job Description:
QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Why don’t you join some of the world’s finest scientific and technical minds and help us make tomorrow work today?

Job description/Person specification
Senior Systems Engineer - Aerospace

Permanent, Salisbury

Within Systems Engineering we are looking for Senior Systems Engineers to fulfil the roles within the Air Engineering business, with excellent leadership skills and who is willing to work in a team environment, both civilian and military.

What will I be doing?

As a Systems Engineer you will operate at platform level and be the overarching technical lead for projects, accountable for the technical solution, its quality and assurance and delivery to schedule.

You will coordinate activities between the various disciplines, working in partnership with the Project Managers to ensure a consistent approach to the creation and delivery of our products and advice.

You will engage with our customers to elicit and understand their requirements, and manage the process of analysis and decomposition of the requirements.

You will also provide significant technical support to the Sales and Bid teams in terms of the creation of the Technical Delivery Plans and estimates, supported by Subject Matter Experts, to develop robust technical solutions.

What do I need?

A strong aerospace background

HNC/HND/Degree in a relevant subject, or other qualifications with suitable experience

Recent experience of delivering multi-disciplinary complex solutions

Knowledge and understanding of a Systems Engineering V-Model approach

A good knowledge of UK Military Aviation Authority regulatory publications, certification, Release to Service, and UK military trials activities and processes

The following would be desirable:
Chartered/Incorporated Engineer Status or the willingness to undertake the application for registration
Experience of aviation trials
Experience in the identification of hazards and subsequent risk assessment, combined with the ability to clearly articulate these in written and verbal communications.

Business Systems Analyst

Berlin, Germany ● Cologne, Germany ● Glasgow, UK ● Hamburg, Germany ● London, UK ● Manchester, UK ● Munich, Germany ● Stuttgart, Germany ● Virtual
Req #6413

Friday, October 30, 2020

Are you looking to work in an environment that produces agile and innovative cloud-based solutions to help customers solve workforce time and attendance, talent attraction, and talent management problems? Do you want a position that uses your skills to reinvent and challenge the industry’s perception of Human Capital Management solutions? Are you looking for an organisation that will help to grow and develop your career? If so, at Ceridian Europe you have the opportunity to build, implement or support products that follow a responsive design and gives our clients the ability to interact with their employees anywhere and on any device.

Ceridian Europe creates innovative technology that organisations around the world use to attract, develop, manage and pay their people.Our award-winning Dayforce solution helps our customers effectively manage compliance, track time and attendance, make better decisions, build great teams and drive engagement with their employees.

At Ceridian Europe it’s not just what we do, it’s how we do it to achieve our brand promise, Makes Work Life Better. Our culture fosters the Our Way values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism and Agility. Our dedicated employees work hard in a fun and vibrant environment.

We employ a diverse group of talented colleagues who are driven to excellence and innovation, and who are invested in their own career development. We look for colleagues who are willing to tackle the impossible and create technology solutions that help our customers engage their employees.

As an employer of choice, we offer a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive, flexible range of benefits, including pension, health & wellbeing options, and leisure & lifestyle programs. Our employees are able to personalize their benefits, tailoring them to meet their individual needs.

The opportunity:

R&D at Ceridian is a group of close-knit, cross-functional teams of Developers, QA Analysts, Product Owners, Business Analysts, and Test Engineers. Our Payroll team in Europe (primarily based in Glasgow) plays a vital part in our expansion, building, and implementing regionally-specific Dayforce solutions, one country at a time. We are excited to start work on the new modernisation of Dayforce built with the latest in cloud, microservices, and Microsoft technologies, introducing automation, increased flexibility, and responsiveness, and further capitalising on AI.

Reporting to the Payroll Product Owner, we have an opportunity for an English and German-speaking Business System Analyst to join our Payroll team (in-office or remotely) building and delivering a brand new product.

This is an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise as a Business Analyst, relationship builder, and innovative consultant to hit the ground running and play a critical role ensuring we step up to the needs and demands of our clients and successfully launch our new Payroll product. You will proactively identify risks, analyse requirements, create solutions, and produce design documents that describe new software features and enhancements within the Dayforce application suite of products with an emphasis on areas requiring technical expertise in Payroll systems.

Who you are:

You may be a Payroll Administrator or Manager and you are looking for a step in the door at a creative and innovative technology company where you can apply your hands-on knowledge to propose cutting edge solutions to complex payroll problems. Or, you are a Business Analyst or Implementation Consultant in HCM or ERP, and you are excited to be part of a brand new build right at the start of the process. Either way, you are fluent in English and German and passionate about bridging the technical with the practical, the design with the experience.

You have expertise working closely with internal stakeholders and end-users to identify business challenges and develop effective strategies to realize visions and increase adoption. You have a creative and process-oriented approach and can implement concepts, ideas, and plans while functioning in a flexible, constantly changing environment. A detailed-oriented collaborator, your focus is accomplishing every milestone while ensuring processes are followed and issues are proactively dealt with.You are ready to roll up your sleeves and work closely across the Agile team.

What's in it for you:

Impact. As part of a group building the next generation of Dayforce products, you will play a role in our trajectory and a key contributor as we design new modules in response to the market. We continuously challenge ourselves to innovate solutions to our customers' problems in ways that will delight them. You will be part of a team that loves to excite the users of their software as much as they love the creativity of coding. You will gain visibility and in-depth, hands-on expertise working on new builds, implementations, enhancements, and support, starting with our Payroll project for Europe with a focus on the user interface design and user experience.

Teamwork. Our inclusive, supportive workplace culture fosters an environment of continuous learning, professional development, collaboration, and a chance to blend in-office and remote working long before and after the COVID-19 crisis. You will be part of a high performing cross-functional team of collaborators driven to delivering high-quality software. We are continually working on moving our solution forward and improving our customer's experience.

Growth. We are a rapidly scaling company with a focus on promoting from within. This is a global organisation with more opportunities than people where we encourage you to express and pursue areas and projects that interest and inspire you. Through our training and mentoring program, you will develop deep technical expertise and gain valuable business and industry-related experience. You will have a chance to expand your hands-on scope of knowledge across multiple modules, work on growing the product to reach new audiences, and move into product or people management.

As our new Business System Analyst, you will:
Analyse and plan. You will assess impacts on the existing system as new functions are added and proactively identify technical or design flaws so that action can be taken. You will analyse market requirements and produce design documents that describe how new software features and enhancements should function within the Dayforce application suite of products, emphasizing areas requiring technical expertise.
Collaborate and influence. You will work closely with members of the Product Management and Development teams to translate market requirements into solutions and system designs that align with product development strategy. You will partner with clients, internal stakeholders, and development teams to understand varying user needs to shape the product and the user experience.
Innovate and lead. You will generate creative solutions, ideas, and approaches to improve on methods used and solve problems. You will ensure that issues and action items are identified, tracked, and resolved in a timely manner. You will lead user acceptance testing processes to ensure that product requirements are fully satisfied and deliver presentations to various internal/external users with varying levels of product knowledge.

What you bring:
The experience. You are a consultant and a collaborator. You have progressive experience in a BA role working with a range of internal and external stakeholders and end-users to gather requirements, develop a deep understanding of business and technical needs, and create plans, tools, processes, and documentation. You have a depth of knowledge from working directly in HCM, specifically the Payroll module, ideally HR and Workforce Management as well. You can take an idea from concept to reality, creatively using technology, capitalizing on data and insights, and leveraging relationships.
The technical skills. You have hands-on experience with a range of Payroll tools and processes as well as a product management tool. You have exposure across the full Microsoft Suite and you may have worked on teams building products for Azure Cloud Services.
The Agile approach. You have expertise following an Agile Scrum methodology. You have experience planning activities with complex dependencies within and across teams. A forward thinker, you continually strive to improve the tools, technologies, and approaches used to exceed customer expectations.
The interpersonal skills. You are fluent in English and German. You can influence teams and earn trust with your hands-on technical expertise and your willingness to roll up your sleeves to help solve challenging problems in a fast-paced environment. You can confidently build networks and nurture relationships within teams, with peers, clients, and senior leadership. You have outstanding communication, negotiation, and prioritisation skills. You can balance wants and requirements, generate consensus, pivot to respond to needs, and work through ambiguity.
The flexibility. You have a valid passport and are willing to travel in a limited capacity, once restrictions and circumstances around the Covid-19 pandemic change.

Our Culture, Our Values

At Ceridian, our values - Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility - are built on a robust framework, guided by an engaged leadership and brought to life by the innovative, enthusiastic people who make up our diverse teams. This is a place where you can commit, express your ideas through engagement surveys and forms, and gain recognition.
We make work life better for you.

At Ceridian, we foster a workplace where our people can thrive, grow, and reach new levels of success together. We give you the freedom and the technology to make the right scheduling choices to balance your life. In addition, we provide you with financial rewards including a stock purchase plan, talent development programs, comprehensive benefits, paid days off to volunteer, and an unlimited Time Away From Work Program.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Ceridian Europe is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. If selected for an interview, we will be happy to work with you to ensure your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. When your interview is being scheduled, please advise the Ceridian Europe Recruiter of how we might be able to support your participation.

Ceridian Europe is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, national origin, or religion.

Ordnance Survey (OS) provides national mapping services for Great Britain and is world-leading provider of geospatial solutions.
OS location data and expertise has helped governments make smarter decisions, businesses gain valuable data insight, and everyone experience the world outside for over 225 years.
Our growing Operations team play a key role in ensuring we deliver world-class geospatial data and services for our customers and they’re looking for people to join them. They’re experts at using remote-sensed and ground data capture technologies. And they’re leading the geospatial industry with an ‘automate-first’ approach which consumes and exploits data from multiple sources.
About the Role
Production Control sits at the hub of Operations activity. We support the department production areas to enable Operations to meet agreed customer requirements effectively and efficiently through specifying, analysing, shaping, controlling, and reporting on production activities. Whether they be internal or external, our support of programmes of work is critical to the coherent and timely delivery of data updates and improvements for internal and external customers.
It’s our job to understand the requirement from our customers, to get under the skin of the problem and deliver the solution: how and when we do it, and who does it. Whether scheduling our national rolling revision program or creating bespoke work packages to edit, we monitor production and provide in-flight solutions and analysis integral to successful completion against objectives.
We are a small team and we work at pace. Critical to our success is an understanding of how the many programs of work across Operations fit together and ensuring they all progress around each other effectively and efficiently.
We are in the unique position of working closely with consultants and production management across all Operations disciplines, in addition to the customer stakeholder groups across the organisation.
What we’re looking for:
We’re looking for individuals to join as Production Control Analysts at a time of growth and a need for new insight across OS’s full range of production departments. This is an excellent opportunity to broaden your knowledge and understanding of our operational capabilities, develop skills in technical analysis and problem solving, programme management support, and liaising directly with stakeholders.
With the arrival of a new geospatial production system and the Public Sector Geospatial Agreement, in addition to stretching new targets for imagery and topographic currency, you will have the opportunity to shape new ways of working and delivery of multiple services. You will need to be able to demonstrate evidence against the following criteria:
Secondary level education (NQF level 3, A Level, BTEC or equivalent)
Knowledge relating to geospatial data production
Ability to utilise GIS technology to solve problems and identify process improvements
Intermediate FME skills or a keen interest to learn
Understanding of end-to-end production lifecycles
Proven ability to work at pace and respond quickly to changing requirements
Experience of identifying and monitoring patterns in production activity
Ability to plan out jobs to minimise conflict and promote optimised production rates
Ability to work independently and manage own time effectively
Interest in future systems of working and developing information and support to colleagues and customers
Ability to work directly with stakeholders to support delivery of collaborative
The Rewards
We want you to love what you do. That’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:
Salary – £25,075 to £28,585
Performance related bonus
Competitive pension
37 hour working week (with flexible working options)
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Plus a suite of excellent additional benefits
We’re always happy to hear from you, so don’t forget to follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or find us on Facebook.
Location: This role will be based at our state of the art Headquarters in Southampton.
Closing date: 25 November 2020
We believe diversity and inclusion is about working together – in a supportive and respectful environment to reach our full potential. We think combining different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives will help us reach our vision and be trusted and admired across the globe for setting the standards and leading the way. We are looking for talented and experienced individuals from a range of backgrounds and welcome applications from any race, age, gender, background or religion.
We’re individually talented and collectively powerful and we give you the space to take your career in whichever direction you want.
We’re always happy to hear from you, so don’t forget to follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or find us on Facebook.

Job Title: Service Desk Analyst

Department: Technology

Reporting to: Service Desk Team Lead

Team: IT Ops and Service Delivery

The Department:

The Technology department comprises of Development and IT Operations. IT Operations handle Desktop, Infrastructure and Security support and maintenance. Using state of the art high-availability technologies, we ensure that we maintain a secure and uninterrupted service with an impeccable uptime record. Our online B2C gaming operations is one of the largest in the world and to support our teams we have adopted both Agile and ITIL methodologies which help us deliver the highest standards at all times.

Purpose of the role:

The Service Desk Analyst will provide 1st and 2nd line end user support across the business with a strong focus on customer services. They will work on and resolve Incidents and Service Requests within agreed Service Level Agreements as set by the business whilst following ITIL best practices and processes as defined by the IT Services Manager.

The successful candidate will have a technical background and will have a proven track record of providing outstanding customer service.

You will be responsible for:

The Service Desk Analyst position will involve the following areas of responsibility:
Acting as a single point of contact for all Incidents and Service Requests for the end-users within the business.
Answering all telephone calls, emails and walk-ups to the Service Desk.
Resolving and escalating Incidents and Service Requests within agreed SLAs.
Completing desktop builds and deploying software through SCCM.
Work autonomously using JIRA Service Desk.
Be part of an on-call out-of-hours support team.
This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of responsibilities. The job holder may be required to complete any other reasonable duties in order to achieve business objectives.

You will have:
Minimum of 1-year experience working in an end-user facing 1st and 2nd line support role.
Experience with an ITSM ticket management system to manage all incidents and requests.
Proficient in ticket triage and escalation processes to 3rd line resolution teams.
Experience with Exchange Administration (email accounts, distribution list, shared mailboxes, resource mailboxes, etc.).
Experience providing support to remote users over the phone.
Strong technical knowledge with: Windows 7, Windows 10, SCCM, O365, Active Directory, Antivirus and VPN.
It would be a bonus if you also had:
Experience with Office 365 Administration – preferably in a hybrid exchange environment.
Experience with Reporting and Trend Analysis.
Demonstrate proactive maintenance on desktop and laptop estate using SCCM.
Experience with Video Conferencing Units (e.g. Polycom).
Extensive experience creating, testing and deploying Group Policy Objects.
Experience with patch management in a corporate environment using SSCM or WSUS.
Experience with Mobile Device Management solutions.
Experience providing end user Mac OS support in a Windows Domain environment.
Experience with Skype for Business Administration (creating accounts, assigning DDIs, etc.).
Microsoft certified.
ITIL certified.
Person Specification:
A strong focus on customer services.
Excellent communication skills.
Self-starter with initiative.
Attention to detail.
Perseverance and the ability to drive projects to completion.
Patient and calm under pressure.
Enjoy working with a team.

Competitive package

Job description/Person specification
Within Systems Engineering we are looking for a Principal Systems Engineer to fulfill the role of Project Engineer within the Air Support Portfolio, with excellent leadership skills and who is willing to work in a team environment, both civilian and military. The location of the role will be predominantly MOD Boscombe Down; the ability and willingness to travel to other locations in the UK and abroad for detached duties may also be necessary.

What will I be doing?
Typically you will have responsibility for the technical management of all activities on projects relating to a specific air platform or capability, and as such you are the technical point of contact for our Customers, whether they be DE&S, military or commercial. You will engage with our Customers at a strategic level to understand their future aspirations with respect to capability, elicit and understand their requirements, and manage the process of analysis and decomposition of the requirements.

You will also provide significant technical support to the Sales and Bid teams in terms of the creation or approval of the Technical Delivery Plans and estimates, supported by Subject Matter Experts, to develop robust technical solutions.

Key Accountabilities:
Day-to-day leadership and management of engineering and technical teams to deliver integrated engineering outputs that meet the customer’s requirements, to contracted time, cost and quality
Ensuring that Systems Engineering gains and retains a ‘world class’ standard through continuous improvement
Collaboration with Resource Management as required to assign relevant technical work tasks to suitably qualified and experienced personnel
Effective capture and analysis of customer requirements
Creation and delivery of innovative and agile integrated solutions
Co-ordinating bids and estimates; generating technical solutions with an associated work breakdown structure to support project cost plans and bids
Ensuring the production of appropriate Technical Delivery Plans and adherence throughout the engineering project lifecycle
Identifying project technical risks and mitigations working with the Project Manager with their management and control
Mentoring of other Systems Engineering staff and activities as required.
Essential skills required
A strong aviation background, preferably in Air Support platforms
The ability to work closely with customers, Industry partners and all stakeholders
Knowledge and understanding of the principles of our delivery frameworks e.g. Engineering Delivery Partner
HNC/HND/Degree in a relevant subject, or other qualifications with suitable experience
At least 3 Years of recent experience of delivering multi-disciplinary complex solutions
Knowledge and understanding of a Systems Engineering V-Model approach
A good knowledge of UK Military Aviation Authority regulatory publications, certification, Release to Service, and UK military trials activities and processes
The following skills would be desirable:
Chartered/Incorporated Engineer Status or the willingness to undertake the application for registration
Knowledge and understanding of QinetiQ corporate templates, systems and processes
Experience of working with our Air Warfare Centre Partners e.g. 206 Sqn
Experience in the identification of hazards and subsequent risk assessment, combined with the ability to clearly articulate these in written and verbal communications.

Role Summary:
PayDock is a Fintech Scaleup in the payments space, offering a smart and sophisticated digital solution to online merchants globally.

PayDock is seeking a Business/Systems Analyst to join an energetic and global team focused on delivering on PayDock’s value proposition to market. The product opens new doors for merchants as we enable them to connect with and manage their customers.

You will work with global leaders, payment service providers and technology vendors both in Europe, Australia, Asia and other markets.

Role & Responsibilities:
As an emerging leader in the financial technology sector, you will be expected to work closely with established, distributed and highly skilled teams and vendors to ensure PayDock:
Implement, maintain and execute functional and unit tests
Deliver testing on commonly known security vectors
Assist with the creation of a high-ownership culture
Additional responsibilities may also include:
Assistance with documentation creation

You will work closely with the leadership team including Product Management and Engineers.

We expect the successful candidate to work closely with responsible parties within PayDock.

We expect the successful candidate to be able to gather information and speak intelligently to system design, test approaches and report to management in regards to the success/risks/opportunities of testing activities to continually improve our outcomes.

Duties include:
Functional testing
You will be required to verify that features comply with all the requirements listed in the functional specifications. This includes testing the program feature-by-feature to make sure the output is correct.
Non-Functional Testing
Performance Testing
Security Testing
Fuzz testing
Other non-functional testing
User Interface/User Experience Testing
Does it work in a way that is pleasing to use?
Does it achieve the objectives intended in a world-class way?

Customer support

UX/UI Testing
Other matters as they arise from time time to time

OOP

Personal Qualities

We expect the successful candidate to be highly self-motivated, enthusiastic, think creatively and outside the box.

Do you have in depth understanding of Cyber Security Methodologies? Are you familiar with the information security threats facing aerospace defence contractors or Government systems?
Northrop Grumman is seeking a Cyber Systems Engineer to provide solutions designed to enhance the overall security posture of our internal and customer systems.
This is a permanent position based in our Cheltenham office but with a requirement for overseas travel

Different thinking for a Different world
Northrop Grumman Information Security supporting the Mission Systems sector is seeking a Cyber Systems Engineer to support non US locations, providing Information Security engineering services.
This individual will join our team of qualified and diverse individuals to support digital transformation. Become part of a fully engaged high performance team providing Information Security for Northrop Grumman. The qualified applicant will serve as the Northrop Grumman’s Missions Sector InfoSec Engineer, providing Information Security engineering services.
Application of system security engineering principles is required to provide realistic solutions designed to enhance the overall security posture of internal and customer systems, to include identifying threats, developing appropriate protection measures, reviewing security implications of system changes, recommending solutions and providing support for resolution of complex technical challenges.
How you will make a difference
Key responsibilities
Collaborate with engineering teams and other information security professionals to ensure strong and effective controls are in place to detect and mitigate risks across on-prem and cloud environments to meet business needs and regulatory requirements
Perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, balancing cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analysis across total systems
Work collaboratively on multiple concurrent projects, ensuring project and BAU activities remain compliant with ISO20000 & ISO27001
Perform system security analysis activities including requirements analysis, gap analysis, and analysis of alternatives
Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of security requirements into systems solutions that best mitigate cyber risks within the acknowledged technical, schedule and cost constraints, including activities such as:
secure proxy engineering
firewall policy management
messaging security engineering
remote access engineering
intrusion prevention engineering
network access compliance engineering
public key technologies
Active Directory services
Analyse and provide recommendations for improvements to and enhancements of in-house and external platforms, systems and tools
Development of system design artefacts in accordance with established architecture frameworks
Support the global team in processing and mitigating cyber threat actor activity
Collaborate effectively with information security analysts to co-ordinate a multi-tiered approach to cyber threat mitigation to deny current and future adversary actions
Undertake analytical duties in a secondary role to include host- and network-based log analysis, correlation of network threat indicators and PCAP data, analytical triage, incident response and vulnerability scanning
Research and draft Cybersecurity white papers as required, presenting findings to both technical teams and management

Person Specification
Preferred Experience

In-depth understanding and substantial application of cyber security methodologies
Experience in consulting and or working in a complex Enterprise environment
Extensive experience working with customers to elaborate requirements in often complex/uncertain environments
A proven track record of designing and developing secure solutions that meet customer requirements
Experience performing risk assessments of both internally and externally hosted solutions
Experience with ISO20000, ISO 270001, GDPR, HMG Security Policy Framework, Cyber Essentials, MCSS, etc.
Experience with network architecture, OSI model, and networking protocols
Experience with network security and penetration testing
Experience in creating and deploying cloud infrastructure solutions
Knowledge of security operations and tools
Knowledge of compliance regulations in UK, France, Germany, Italy, and other European standards
Knowledge of risk management industry principles, including use of a risk-based approach
Hands on validation of security control implementation
Institute security engineering concepts that , balance cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analysis across total systems
Work collaboratively on multiple concurrent projects with various program and technical stakeholders
Perform system security analysis activities including requirements analysis, gap analysis, and analysis of alternatives
Strong presentation and written skills with experience in presenting findings to executive leadership and/or technical teams
Experience of conducting analysis of electronic media, log data, and network devices in support of intrusion analysis or enterprise level information security operations
Experience with analysis and forensic tools used in a SOC or similar investigative environment
Penetration testing experience
Knowledge and/or experience in one or more of the following technologies: AD/DNS, Patch Management, PKI, HBSS, ACAS, VMware products, Splunk
Familiarity in the Risk Management Framework (RMF) Cybersecurity Lifecycle
Experience of UK and European Government working practices and proposals

Preferred Qualifications

Hold one or more of the following technical certifications (or equivalent):

o International Council on Systems Engineering (INCOSE)
o Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
o GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED)
o GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)
o GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA)
o GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst (GCFA)
o GIAC Reverse Engineering Malware (GREM)
o Certified Forensic Computer Examiner (CFCE)
o OSCP Offensive Security Certified Professional
o CEH Certified Ethical Hacker
o Cloud Certifications


Competency/Skill requirements

Current and evolving familiarity with information security threats facing aerospace defence contractors or Government systems
Adept at two or more analysis and forensic tools used in a CSIRT or similar investigative environment
Able to exercise sound judgment when escalating issues
A creative thinker, particularly around remediation and countermeasures to challenging information security threats
Highly self-motivated and directed, able to effectively work autonomously and as part of a wider, virtual team
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to engage effectively with a wide range of stakeholders
Excellent PowerPoint skills, able to clearly present technical content to audiences of mixed technical backgrounds
Fluent in written and spoken English, fluency in other European languages advantageous – Italian, French, German.
Strong analytical skills, adept at trouble-shooting and problem-solving
Flexible and responsive attitude
Highly-organised and proficient at multi-tasking, working with and resolving competing priorities
Strong customer orientation
Excellent attention to detail
Advanced knowledge of technology capabilities and trends

Other requirements
Ability to travel up to 60 % within Europe, Middle East, Africa and occasional travel to US
Clearance requirements: Ability to hold and maintain relevant UK Government clearance

Business Analyst



Job description

Reports to: Professional Services Team Leader

As part of a project team, the business analyst’s role is to ensure that our solutions are aligned to our customers’ business objectives and that their needs are being met. They are involved with a project from beginning to end and are integral to project success. They challenge future process, based on a customer’s current state, and advise on potential change both to the 4C project team and to our customers where appropriate.

Key Responsibilities:
Document project objectives and success criteria
Identify, define and manage requirements for a project
Initial discovery
Sprint level requirements gathering
Quality Assurance - championing high standard of build meeting the requirements, epics and features.
Analyse the structure of the business, how it uses people/process/systems and data
Business information modelling
Data modelling
Process modelling
Customer journey mapping
Understand a business's goals
Senior stakeholder engagement to understand what they are trying to achieve
Work with the project team to define future state improvements
Work with project team on the business case for change
Documenting new projects
Objectives
User stories + acceptance criteria
User flows
Business requirements documents
Ongoing documentation version control
Internal sprint testing (advocacy of our customers needs)
Test script writing (working with customers project team)
Communicating impact to customers communications strategy
Communicating impact to customer change management strategy


Requirements

Required Skills:
Ability to communicate at all levels from C Suite to System Users
Questioning the Why not just the What to ensure full capabilities and issues are drawn out.
Exposure to many end-to-end projects of varying complexity
Can demonstrate how business issues were identified and recommendations that were made. This includes non software solutions
Quality assurance - understands and leads on QA within projects.
Can work to tight deadlines and communicates any deviation to timelines.

About the role

Here at Babcock International we are looking to recruit an experienced Data Analyst to support our partnership with the Metropolitan Police in delivering an exciting new programme for new police recruits. The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting end-to-end data analysis to support operational business requirements and improvement projects across the PEQF contracts.

You will be tasked with the development, production and distribution of statistical performance information to assist operational, accounts / contracts, finance and management teams to effectively manage performance. You’ll need to understand the customers’ requirements for data and analysis, develop reports and present this in a compelling way direct to the customer.

We are looking for a real high performer with a strong analytical mind; this is an excellent opportunity to showcase your capabilities within a large, complex high profile programme.

What do I need to do the role?

You’ll need experience conducting end-to-end analysis on large, raw and complex data sets, that includes data gathering from multiple sources, to support business decision making. This role requires you to have the ability to develop compelling visual displays of analytics for internal and external clients as well as providing recommendations on streamlining reporting / analytical processes.

Would also like you to have experience in all or some of these areas:

High level of competency in system administration including the use of non-standard IT systems, including: Help Desk applications, LMS, Business MI tools, web and database applications, VB.
Experienced and competent in the use of ERP Systems, SQL, SSRS, Microsoft Stack and databases to generate reports, analysis and visual representations of data.
Advanced skills in Excel (VBA Programming) and Business Intelligence tools.
Experience of designing, implementing and delivering data driven reports and analysis.

Lastly, you’ll need excellent verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to communicate and influence both internal and external stakeholders.

What else do I need to know?

The successful candidate must be able to achieve the appropriate security clearance level for this role.

About Babcock International

For more than a century, Babcock, the Aerospace and Defence company, has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly-skilled engineering services. We help customers in the UK and around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the four market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training.

We’re committed to providing a great employee experience in a supportive and engaging environment. The benefits you can expect to enjoy include a generous holiday entitlement, competitive money purchase pension scheme with life assurance and a share ownership scheme. You’ll benefit from excellent career and learning and development opportunities to ensure that you grow and achieve your full potential.

We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively-managed products. Role:

Support Analyst
Location:

London
Department:

Distribution and Corporate Technology, Global Technology

The department

The Global Technology department plays a crucial role in supporting the success of the business. We are responsible for developing and implementing state-of-the-art software and hardware maintenance to support our fund management, trading, distribution and operational areas with secure, stable and resilient technology platforms.

Overview of the role

You role will be focused on delivery and stability of our global Distribution, HR, Finance, Legal and Risk business areas. Responsibilities include supporting and identifying enhancements to all technologies / systems within the Distribution and Corporate Technology space. Your initial focus is Application Support. This includes supporting key business processes, monitoring of systems, troubleshooting and making recommendations to implement small-enhancements and integrations within the Distribution and Corporate Technology application stack to improve supportability. You will collaborate frequently with our business partners, management and other IT resources and/or vendors.

Duties and responsibilities

You will:
SLAs – provide support against service level agreements for all supported tier1, tier 2 and tier 3 Distribution and Corporate Technology applications
Be first point of contact for all incidents with production DT applications
Coordinate with other DT teams, Platform and Infrastructure teams to ensure that incidents are managed seamlessly against the SLA
Support JHI Incident Management team as required
Escalate issues as required knowing who to escalate to and when
Be able to apply data, configuration and minor code changes to address incidents
Ensure that all critical batch processes are documented and monitored e.g. middle office, TA data loads
Ensure that all daily, monthly and ad-hoc operational and underlying system processes run smoothly with support docs e.g. AUM & Flow, fund launch, client reporting, Salesforce daily batches and digital platform management, etc.
Develop SQL scripts to apply data fixes to resolve incidents
Debug errors in applications to get to the route of an incident
Ensure that acceptance environment operates to the same level as production
Build knowledge of all DT applications and their inter-dependencies
Log problem management tickets with DT teams to get root cause fixes applied / identify system weaknesses to be refactored
Support Ops working with TA and middle office suppliers
Carry out additional duties as assigned.
Supervisory responsibilities
No
Technical skills and qualifications
Strong problem-solving techniques to understand and resolve incidents
Well-developed SQL skills and knowledge of common database management systems
Business analysis concepts and techniques
Business requirements capturing

Job Description

We are looking to hire an excellent Business Systems Analyst to ensure the complete financial integrity of data used to generate information and analytical insight including business performance, inventory and product costing.

In this role, you will be part of a global team to support the Finance Business Partners and Operations management teams in the pursuit of continuous improvements in cost, quality & delivery performance. This is a unique position at our company as it combines the finance elements and technical IT requirements. This position is for you if you enjoy interacting with other cultures and you are capable to work along different time zones. We at Smiths Interconnect support various industries such as aviation, space, telecommunication and railway, so you will have a high exposure on various areas.

The position is based in Elstree and we provide a full-time, permanent contract.

Duties & Responsibilities

Assist in the efficient generation of monthly Operational results, annual budgets, forecasts,KPIs, weekly flash reports and reporting decks providing analytical insight and tools to support root cause analysis.
Accurately report opportunities to support site objectives in terms of cost, lead time, inventory and efficiency improvements ensuring financial impacts are validated and tracked in accordance with the company guidelines.
Provide support to ensure sound financial control procedures exist throughout the plants collaborating to revise procedures as required. Maintain knowledge of latest accounting policies, practices and procedures to ensure full integrity and compliance of financials.
Support the annual global cost roll process and calculation of burden rates to establish and ensure correct setup of product cost.
Determine suitable applications to translate and bridge ERP data into usable information that drives improved business performance.
Drive efficiencies and adopt robust platforms to enable timely, accurate and visual interpretation of key financial and operational data.
Support enhancement and development of business systems, reporting software and ERP including divisional roll outs sharing best practices across Interconnect and other Smiths divisions

Diversity & Inclusion

We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. We are proud to be an inclusive company with values grounded in equality and ethics, where we celebrate, support, and embrace diversity.

The Individual

You have a degree in Accounting/Finance from an accredited College or University and completed education and/or certification in a technical financial accounting discipline
You have experience working in a finance role in a manufacturing environment
You possess Strong financial/accounting skills and strong Business Systems experience
Proficient with Microsoft Office with strong Excel, analytical & visualization tools
You can be successful in this position if you can prioritise and work on own initiative, you can multitask and organize efficiently and interact with all levels within the organization

About Smiths

At Smiths we apply leading-edge technology to design, manufacture and deliver market-leading innovative solutions that meet our customers' evolving needs, and touch the lives of millions of people every day. We are a FTSE100, global business of around 23,000 colleagues, based in 55 countries. Our solutions have a real impact on lives across the planet, enabling industry, improving healthcare, enhancing security, advancing connectivity and supporting new homes. Our products and services are often critical to our customers’ operations, while our proprietary technology and high service levels help create competitive advantage. We welcome colleagues with a curious mind, who are happy with responsibility, enjoy a challenge and are attracted by the idea of working at a business with an almost 170 year history of innovation, and five global divisions, all experts in their field.

About Smiths Interconnect

Smiths Interconnect is a leading provider of technically differentiated electronic components, subsystems, microwave and radio frequency products that ensure high speed, secure connectivity of critical applications in the defence, aerospace, communications and industrial markets. Our microwave technology is used in radar, communication and surveillance systems that are mission-critical and operate in extreme environments in aerospace and defence. Our microwave components and connectors ensure optimal performance, durability and safety of space satellites. Our semi-conductor test products are used to test highly sophisticated semi-conductors and electronic circuits in communication systems, gaming products and computing devices. Our in-flight antenna systems give passengers internet connectivity gate-to-gate on planes around the world. Our connector and cable solutions ensure reliability of critical medical equipment, and safe operation of trains and transport systems.One of five divisions of Smiths Group, Smiths Interconnect employs over 2000 people. We have a global presence selling our products in over 50 countries with manufacturing facilities in nine countries and offices across North America, Europe and Asia.

Are you an experienced Linux Engineer who wants to join a leading cyber team within an evolving and dynamic organisation?
Due to the success of a number of strategic Gloucestershire based programmes, we are growing our team with creative and ambitious Linux engineers. With a primary focus on supporting large scale Linux deployments, your experience will cover a variety of technologies, working closely with development teams to understand complex problem sets and apply your skills to solve them.

Different thinking for a Different world
Northrop Grumman is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products and solutions to government and commercial customers worldwide. In Northrop Grumman’s rapidly growing UK Cyber and Intelligence business, we support our customers’ work to make the UK the safest place to live and do business, both physically and online.
Working with and alongside our customers, we use modern engineering methods (Scaled Agile, Dev Sec Ops, Site Reliability Engineering, micro-service architectures) and cutting edge techniques (data science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning) to tackle complex and challenging problems and deliver cost effective, reliable, supportable solutions.
Our solutions support complex analysis of substantial amounts of data, requiring state of the art ‘big data’, stream processing and cloud-based analytics, identifying and using ‘best of breed’ commercial and open source technologies and integrating them with our own software to meet customer needs quickly and efficiently.
At Northrop Grumman we pride ourselves on our ability to combine agile development with sound engineering and security practices to ensure that our solutions are robust and resilient; designed and built to start secure and stay secure against ever evolving cyber security threats. As well as designing for security, Information Assurance and legal / policy compliance, we actively assess products and services, identifying vulnerabilities and weaknesses that could be exploited by cyber attackers, and we create and run exercises to pit cyber security specialists against secure systems and each other.
We carry out research and innovation locally in the UK, with commercial and academic partners, and across our 85,000+ worldwide workforce.

How you will make a difference
For us, innovation is key and we have immediate opportunities for talented Linux engineers to join our team to help us develop, deploy, maintain and decommission a number of large scale clustered systems. We are in a phase of rapid growth and there are opportunities to develop your career with us to meet your aspirations.
You will be helping us to solve our customer’s problems within an agile team. You will have opportunities to take systems through their life cycle from requirements capture to R&D(Research & Development), implementation, automation and test in a wide range of technologies.
As a Lead Linux Systems Administrator you will have a number of key responsibilities, these are primarily around systems support and maintenance, deployment of custom software in line with release schedule, incident management, vendor escalation and supporting your software development team. Experience of working within Software Development teams, including DevOps practices would be advantageous.
Key criteria required...
Proven industry experience as a Linux engineer
Experience or knowledge of either Red Hat Enterprise Linux or CentOS 7 & 8
Experience of installing, upgrading and troubleshooting Java based applications
Experience of Linux server integration with Active Directory
Experience of building secure systems using corporate PKI solutions
Knowledge of core Networking Principals
Experience of technical leadership or team management
Also, we’d love it if you have experience of...
VMWare or Cloud-based architectures
Accumulo, Hadoop & ZooKeeper administration
Agile/Scrum methodologies using tools such as Confluence and Jira
DevOps approaches and associated tools such as BitBucket, Ansible, Jenkins & Docker
Messaging and Routing Technologies such as NiFi and Kafka
Different programming languages, such as: Bash, Perl or Python
Working with open source products
You will enjoy a growing career as we work collaboratively to innovate the world of cyber security.

Additional information for your consideration...
You must be able obtain and hold UK Government clearances
Opportunities exist across the UK to enhance your career progression
Looking for flexibility? Talk to us at the application stage about what may be possible.
Being a part of Northrop Grumman gives you the opportunity to use your skills to make a difference in our mission of enabling global security. Our company grows because of our employees' dedication and commitment to achieving our mission, something we always remember. In return for working for us you will have access to a benefits package that provides you with flexibility to balance your professional career with your personal life, health & well-being benefits, discount schemes, pension benefits and investment in your future development.
We are committed to equality and diversity in our workplace. Northrop Grumman provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s protected status, including race, ethnic origin, colour, nationality, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marriage/civil partnership, pregnancy/maternity, religion or belief, creed, age, disability, genetic information, or any other protected status or characteristic.

Your role at a glance
As a Systems Analyst, you will play an important role in the Group Finance IT function by utilising best-practice assessment, analysis and design techniques to solve business requirements, problems and significant incidents, in order to support the IT Portfolio of change.
You will work closely with product owners, delivery managers and developers across the IT engineering and delivery function, colleagues in the Group Change & Delivery, and our core partners such as TCS and IBM. You will understand our system landscape, interfaces, data and process, making recommendations for continuous improvement, automation, efficiency and effectiveness where appropriate.
What you'll be doing
Analyse business requirements, challenge and translate into viable technical system specifications that deliver scalable, robust and effective change. Ensure that functional, non-functional and security criteria are adequately addressed
Develop IT models and artefacts for defining the current and future state of our systems, identifying gaps, opportunities, risks and impacts. Provide options and support wider technical teams to achieve the most appropriate solution
Demonstrate the use of best-practice system analysis tools and techniques to assess fitness for purpose, feasibility and modes of failure through Root Cause Analysis
Gaining a sound and comprehensive understanding of the various business areas that GFIT supports, with a key focus on the systems, process and data that underpins them
Understand the systems development lifecycle, and follows defined process, ensuring the appropriate levels of quality are maintained. Understand the importance of thorough requirements gathering, and maintaining traceability throughout the lifetime of the project
Deliver effective, timely communication and management information as required
Identify inefficiencies and where the innovative use of technology can improve the effective running of business operations. Monitor external technical development in the sector and technology domain to maintain personal capability and improve our process
Ensure the quality of applications so that customers are provided with high quality service and a good customer experience, in alignment with L&G’s commitment to Treating Customers Fairly (TCF).
What we're looking for
Degree level education or demonstrable relevant experience in relevant field
Strong knowledge of SDLC, waterfall and agile approaches
Outstanding systems analysis experience in a technically challenging and diverse environment
Good experience of specific systems analysis techniques such as UML, Activity diagrams and Swim Lanes
Good knowledge of systems analysis methodologies and approaches, such as Gap / options Analysis, Feasibility Studies, Prototyping, problem Identification, Process Mapping and Requirements elicitation
British Computer Society – Diploma in Systems Analysis and Design, ITIL Foundation certificate and Background in Finance and Actuarial Systems would be an advantage
Comfortable engaging with business users, eliciting requirements and exploring functionality to ensure positive outcomes
Supporting development of Business Case and testing across the SDLC
Running technically focused workshops to understand systems and usability requirements. Being able to engage with people across a broad range of levels, and ability to translate complex technical information into a common language

Benefits
Whatever your role, we reward ability, performance and attitude with a package that looks after all the things that are important to you. Our employees have a wide range of benefits including a generous pension scheme, life assurance, 25 days’ holiday, private medical insurance, discretionary performance related bonuses, paid overtime, a variety of share schemes, discounts at both a huge range of high street stores and our own great products. Your hard work will be rewarded when you join us.

As a company, to be one of the world's largest Asset Managers, homebuilders, pension providers and insurances brands, we are diverse by our very nature. And we're a company that wants to use our diversity and influence to make society better in the long term - for everyone. From HR and Digital teams through to Group Finance, Risk and Corporate Comms – our Group function support our businesses across the UK and abroad. An exciting opportunity to be part of an expanded Finance Systems team within an innovative multibillion pound business, bridging the gap between Finance and IT to help deliver effective, robust and efficient financial systems and processes.

The role combines responsibility for regular operational processes as well as the opportunity to support and/or lead on small to medium sized change projects. We’re looking for someone with strong accounting skills combined with a systems mindset, who is keen to develop their career in the finance systems specialism.

The role reports to the Finance Systems & Projects Manager within the wider Financial Control & Operations team, but will interact with all of the teams in the wider Finance division and with several Technology teams.

A Place To Be You

We want to create games that appeal to people from all walks of life and we need a rich and diverse blend of people to make that happen. We hire exclusively on talent and we want our employees to feel like they can bring their whole self to work every day.

We have continued recruiting throughout COVID-19 and have been successfully conducting interviews and onboarding new starters virtually since March. This has meant that we have been able to keep our people as safe as possible.

How you'll make a difference

Ownership of BAU processes, with responsibility for executing, improving and documenting as required:
Access control management and review for SAP and other Finance systems.
Maintenance and review of delegation of authority rules.
Period end system tasks.
Chart of accounts management, including GL, cost centre and project codes.
Support with ad-hoc BAU tasks:
First line of support for queries and issues raised by the Finance user community, escalating as required.
Support Finance users in making best use of systems and identifying opportunities for improvement and efficiencies.
Assist with internal or external audit queries relating to SAP and other Finance systems data/processes.
Monitoring of escalation of IT support tickets with relevant support teams.
Changes and small/medium projects: (focus on specific areas, depending on experience e.g. P2P, BPC)
Gathering and specifying requirements, liaising with Finance users and relevant Technology teams.
First line testing of system changes, and coordinating with end users for user acceptance testing and defects.
Training (depending on experience/skills, again likely focussed on specific areas):
Prepare and/or deliver systems related training to Finance users - SAP, BPC, Excel, etc.
What you'll bring to the table
At least part qualified or QBE.
Advanced level user of an ERP, ideally (but not necessarily) SAP.
Excellent communication skills and confidence to provide constructive challenge where necessary.
Problem solving skills, with a curiosity and drive to understand how things work.
Attention to detail: being able to spot what doesn’t look right, and think through systems and processes looking for gaps.
Self-motivated and self starting with ability to multi-task and effectively manage own workload.
Prior involvement in process and/or system improvement projects
Nice to haves:
Subject matter expertise in one or more system/process areas, e.g. procure to pay, record to report, fixed assets...
Experience of OLAP/cube based reporting tools
Experience of designing and/or delivering training
What we’ll give you

We look after our people. There’s a competitive bonus and benefits scheme, 26 days of annual leave and a rather generous pension scheme. Thinking about your health? No probs - we’ll give you access to remote health and wellbeing support - including access to a free digital GP and virtual counselling. We’ll give you all of the kit and tools needed to succeed.

Why work at Camelot?

Who we are
Canada Life UK looks after the retirement, investment and protection needs of individuals, families and companies. We help to build better futures for our customers, our intermediaries and our employees by operating as a modern, agile and welcoming organisation.

Part of our parent company Great-West Lifeco, Canada Life UK has operated in the United Kingdom since 1903. We have hundreds of respected and supported employees committed to doing the right thing for our customers and colleagues.

Canada Life UK is transforming to create a more customer-focused business by providing our customers with expertise on financial and tax planning, offering home finance and annuities propositions, and providing collective fund solutions to third party customers.

What we’re building
We now need a Application Support Analyst to support the transformation and the future growth of the business within the IT and Business Change function, so it can simplify our IT architecture by removing our legacy systems and investing in modernised, lower-cost technology systems, and deliver a digital platform that provides a single view of our customers.


Job summary
Provide bespoke IT application support and analytical services for a set of web-based software applications. The primary focus will be on data integrity and ensuring the systems operate as expected.

What you’ll do
Log and analyse incoming application support tickets from business users. This will involve investigating cases within our bespoke developed web applications, tracing user journeys by analysing input and output data, and attempt to reproduce issues in test systems.
Once root cause analysis is complete, define and execute corrections to data using SQL amendments to rectify issues.
Work alongside business project teams to define and set up data scripts to support product changes, by modifying and adding data to core data tables in the systems.
Support business user and regression testing of new products and data, by setting up data scripts, producing outputs for business users to test.
Create and maintain reports and SQL queries to assist business users.
Create documentation, flow charts and process notes on systems functionality and processes
Liaise with external developers and internal project teams on issues that require escalation to development change.
Assist the business change teams with significant project work, including functional testing of new features, and supporting/monitoring the release of changes to the systems.
Who you are
Problem solving – excellent analytical ability to understand issues, determine the underlying root cause, and define a solution with an appropriate level of consideration around risks.
Analysis of web-based applications – experienced in handling the analysis and support for web applications.
Databases & SQL – skilled with defining INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE queries that can resolve issues within a database, retaining the integrity of relational data.
Reporting & SQL – adept at building database queries and reports based on relational databases, including usage of various join operations.
Excel, and Windows software – good knowledge of desktop software and the usage of Outlook, Excel, Word.
Jira/Confluence/Sharepoint – experienced in using change management/support ticketing systems to control and manage changes.
Testing/QA experience – experienced in testing web applications, managing and classifying issues and identifying related problems.
Internal customer service skills – must have a friendly, practical and approachable mindset to assist internal business users to understand problems and communicate on an ongoing basis.
Logical and organized - confident or capable of understanding and working with a complex system.
Language and documentation skills – capable of producing well-written, clear and concise documentation.
Logic and diagrams – capable of using tools such as Visio to produce clear flow charts/swim lane process diagrams.
Programming experience – not essential, but will help the candidate (languages other than SQL).
Qualifications
Degree in IT or computing-related subject.
What you’ll like about working here
As a Canada Life UK colleague, you’ll receive a competitive salary and comprehensive reward package including income protection, private medical insurance and life assurance, along with a generous pension and bonus scheme. You’ll also receive the support you need with your personal and professional development.

Our focus is to have an engaged, committed and motivated work force, operating in a high performing and collaborative culture. We want to create an organisation that offers opportunities for all our people to develop their skills and talent, and build rewarding careers with us.

Diversity and inclusion

Canada Life is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our role as an employer of choice is to provide the right environment for talented people to do their best work, by respecting, understanding and valuing individual differences.
