About us

LendInvest (www.lendinvest.com) is the UK’s leading marketplace for property finance and one of the country’s largest non-bank mortgage lenders. Since launching in 2008, LendInvest has lent over £2.8 billion ($3.6 billion) and raised over £1.8 billion ($2.3 billion) of debt and equity from investors.

LendInvest uses technology to provide borrowers with short-term property finance and buy-to-let mortgages, and makes it possible for investors - from individuals to global financial institutions including HSBC, Citigroup and NAB - to invest in the loans it originates in return for a stable income secured against property.

LendInvest is on a mission to make property finance simple – creating products that make it easy to lend and invest in property. We are on track to becoming the largest non-bank mortgage lender in the UK, by building an automated, scalable platform that seamlessly connects investors with borrowers.

About the Team

Our operations, commercial, technology and data teams work closely together to create the best quality products, systems and tools to improve business growth and efficiency. Our operations team is split into three main product streams; long-term, bridging and development finance. Our technology team is also split into three cross-functional teams, led by product managers, that are delivering along specific value streams. The commercial sales and marketing teams work cross-functionally focusing on all products. We are looking for a talented business analyst with strong analytical skills and attention to detail to assist the business with product analysis.

About the Role

As a Mortgage Pricing and Systems Analyst, you will be part of our operations team, reporting to the Operational Systems & Change Manager. You will work closely with the commercial teams, as well as the operations and technology teams when required. Your main focus will be to maintain our product sets on the various sourcing systems on the back of product committee changes. You will also be responsible for analysing the product data gathered from the sourcing system providers to create actionable insights and recommendations for the product committees. This will help the business maintain and improve our product set, as well as find opportunities to research new products and sub-products.

We understand that sourcing systems are unique to our area of business, so training will be provided for each sourcing system, and there is no requirement to have previous experience working with these systems.

In particular, the role requires experience in the gathering and analysis of relatively small data sets, maintaining KPI and Performance packs, and project management to coordinate multiple projects and associated workstreams. The role will suit a self-starter, high performing individual with a broad skill-set working across operations, data and technology functions.

Duties & Responsibilities / What Will My Day Look Like?
Establish and maintain a deep understanding of our lending products
Take part in daily stand-ups
Gain a deep understanding of each sourcing system
Maintain Lendinvest product sets on various sourcing systems
First-line support relating to sourcing system issues, i.e. products not sourcing correctly
Collate product data from the various sourcing system providers
Use Excel or similar tools to create performance and KPI packs based on product data
Perform gap analysis and impact assessment on product data
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on the results of KPI/Performance and gap analysis
Assist various product management teams to collate relevant product data and create KPI/Performance packs for mature operational products developed by the technology team
Coordinate work with other business analysts and Product Managers, including managing dependencies across workstreams
Lead, motivate and influence a broad range of personalities
Present information in a professional and effective style, whilst responding to questions from all levels of management
Skills & Experience / What We’d Like You To Have
Be proficient in the use of Excel VBA and similar suitable data analysis tools
Be able to produce well-structured documents/presentations as a result of data analysis
Be able to present in a clear and confident manner
Have a high level of prioritisation skills, knowing what to note and what to ignore
Have good business and commercial awareness
Have strong written and verbal communication skills
Be able to identify any critical issues that threaten projects and handle them resolutely
Exhibit solid stakeholder management skills
Is able to juggle multiple initiatives of varying sizes and play different roles to get the job done
Enjoy operating and thriving in a fast-paced and challenging environment
Ideally has knowledge and experience within the property and lending sector
Perks of working with LendInvest include:
25 days’ holiday
Matched pension contributions up to 4%
Discretionary share-option scheme
Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
Private healthcare (Vitality)
Mental health initiatives
A selection of breakfast cereals, fresh fruit, and snacks each day (including an open bar from 5.30pm)
Free lunch on Fridays (when back to the office) while listening to company presentations
Discounts via Perkbox
Due to current public health protections, the location for this role is currently remote, however we do believe in building face-to face relationships and look forward to welcoming you to our central London office in Fitzrovia when we return. However, we are open to flexibility with working from home.

About the role
PwC Operate is an established business which provides skilled staff members to clients, supporting their business as usual (BAU) and / or exceptional projects. Our staff predominately work from client office locations, focusing on supporting clients to implement and execute their specific projects. We are a growing business with continued expansion plans following widespread success and demand. Formally documenting functions

Facilitating workshops

What is in it for you?
As we’re responsive to client demands, your role will be varied and challenging, providing you with an opportunity to work with a wide variety of high profile clients. We’re also exceptionally passionate about providing you with the necessary skills, experience and training to help you develop both personally and professionally. You’ll therefore be included on our specific Operate training framework, tailored to match your skills, needs and career aspirations. Fully funded by us, you’ll complete externally accredited qualifications that will benefit you in the roles you are working in. Our training programme is further enhanced through a variety of softer skills training sessions focusing on your relationships and leadership skills.

In addition to the client projects and training, our employees are also rewarded with various other benefits offered as part of your employment
Our dedicated internal Careers Service.
Competitive salary plus a potential discretionary bonus (performance related)
25 days standard holiday pro rata, with options to increase this through your benefits package
A flexible benefits scheme that be tailored to suit your (and your family’s) needs. Provision of a group pension plan with additional funding provided by PwC
Where will you be based?
The role will be based in London however as a result of the wide variety of clients and projects, you may be asked to work in other locations within the UK and beyond, sometimes at short notice and sometimes over lengthy periods of time. Your desire and ability to do this will be discussed as part of the recruitment process. Candidates who are unable or do not wish to work on projects in other locations will still be considered.

Job Title: Business Analysis (Web)
Reports To: Head of Web Delivery
Department: IT
Location: Head Office, Cottons Centre, London
Role Summary:
At Charles Tyrwhitt our purpose is to “Make it easy for men to dress well”. The primary purpose of the Business Analysis (Web) is to identify, document current web based processes to enable review and improvement, identify opportunities for improving business processes through streamlining and automation, Interact between Web Trading and Web Development teams to capture functional and non-functional requirements and document them in detailed user stories to enable accurate effort estimation, deliver projects to time and to achieve agreed objectives.
Scope of the role:
This role will interact primarily between the Web Trading and Web Development teams within CT but may also cross over into finance etc. where they are impacted by changes or 3rd parties as required for new process or systems.
Its purpose is to twofold:
Determine and document existing processes that interact with CT’s website and its supporting systems so they can be improved or replaced accordingly. This will include determining what replacements should entail and creating the required specifications and involvement in the design of them, particularly with internally developed applications.
Act as a translator between Web Trading and Web Development to capture functional and non-functional requirements for new web features and functionality and then document them as user stories allowing developers to easily estimate effort and QA team to translate tests from. Involvement in the overall development lifecycle working closely with the Web Project Manager to ensure that the requirements are met.
The individual should have solid web/on-line background and skills, coming ideally from a multi-channel retailer with hand-on experience and working knowledge of Salesforce Commerce Cloud Digital (previously known as Demandware). Someone who has worked with trading, architect, development and testing teams and understands the entire project lifecycle ensuring that they are able to understand a breadth of issues and design and support suitable solutions, with solid agile experience.
Key Responsibilities:
Business Systems/Analysis
Effective extraction of information from users to ensure all requirements are captured and mapped
Determine / translate requirements and document design specifications
Define detailed user stories from design specifications that are written in clear, unambiguous language, to enable the development team to provide accurate estimates and that result in testable, measurable and traceable outcomes
Consult on the analysis of business opportunities or applications and interface with users to determine system needs and requirements
Define new system requirements and review impact of system modifications on existing systems
Determine operating characteristics and requirements; develop or modify and document general system design; conduct "walkthroughs" for proposed solutions to system problems
Map business processes out and map them to relevant technology
Ensure all aspects of applications meet the needs of the user
Ensure delivered solution is fit for process and deployable
Document new and modified systems and programs
Document any relevant procedures or configurations to the required standard
Support projects through from initial stages of development to testing, training and implementation, encompassing the full systems development life cycle
Communication
Liaise with users of all levels inside and out of the IT department
Act as liaison between CT and any 3rd party suppliers when required
Update and produce progress reports as required
Answer ad hoc questions and provide clarification / direction to development and support teams regarding user stories and functions
Attend internal and external business meetings
Production and contribution towards proposals for new systems
Maintain awareness of developments within the business systems arena

Project Management
Effectively manage both small and contribute to large scale projects in-line with structure processes and procedures within CT
Work with the relevant teams to identify requirements and understand constraints and risks
Propose solutions that are cost-effective and adhere to IT strategy
Follow standard and structured approaches
Provide support to the Software Development and Service Delivery Teams as appropriate
Ensure Project Risks are fully evaluated and documented and contingency plans put in place as appropriate.
Project Management
Assisting other departments in their use of applications
The recruitment of new members of the team and assist recruitment for other IT teams

Experience Required
At least five years’ experience within e-Commerce Business Analysis focused roles
Strong retail / online exposure / multi-site experience
Ability to multi-task whilst under pressure
Degree level educated
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Natural problem solver with excellent analytical ability
Methodical approach
Comfortable with managing expectations

Technical Skills
Functional
Developing user stories, grooming, prioritising and sizing
Hands on experience working in Scrum software development environment

Product & Price Management
Order Management and Payments
Online Marketing (Promotions, Coupons etc.)
3rd Party Integrations
New site launches

User experience
Customer data understanding
Stock / supply chain understanding

Who we are
Once upon a shirt, Nicholas Charles Tyrwhitt Wheeler (whilst studying Geography at Bristol University – we might add) had the notion that he could make a better shirt at better value than anyone else in the world!
He believed that all men; no matter their shape or size, where they may be in the world or indeed their budget; should be able to own a Jermyn Street quality shirt. A proper shirt. A CT shirt.
That was over 3 decades ago and whilst Charles Tyrwhitt (it rhymes with spirit by the way) is still famous for proper shirts, these days we are about so much more than collars and cuffs. Our purpose is to “make it easy for men to dress well”. We take care of a chap’s entire wardrobe, providing stylish solutions for every occasion. We make sure he gets what he wants, when and how he wants it.
Charles Tyrwhitt’s spiritual home and flagship store is located on London’s Jermyn Street. Our Global Head Office (Tyrwhitt Towers as it’s affectionately known) is in London Bridge. We have two Contact Centres in the UK serving customers worldwide. Our USA Head Office is in Manhattan (naturally) and we have retail and/or online presence across North America, Europe and Australia. Pretty impressive hey?
Tyrwhitteers (our people) are a diverse, passionate and entrepreneurial bunch. We enjoy a fun, engaging and rewarding culture, where everyone is empowered by our 3 BE-liefs which are; “BE the BOSS”, “BE the CUSTOMER” and “BE the BEST”. Together we celebrate, innovate and strive to achieve greatness in all things. Three cheers for the Tyrwhitteers!
Our future is exciting: expansion, growth, creativity… global domination! In truth; the Tale of Tyrwhitt has only just begun.

Job Title: Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst - Patient Preference
Job Description:
Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst–Patient Preference
*We are looking to fill this role in our Bethesda, MD or London, UK offices; we will consider other locations based on the candidates’ experience and qualifications
Position Summary
This exciting and challenging cross-functional position provides statistical and econometric analysis as well as data management support across multiple projects within the Patient Preference group of the Patient-Centered Research team. The role requires a unique blend of technical excellence in addition to the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks with competing deadlines. The Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the organization and works closely with a variety of stakeholders; technical and research, to drive the delivery and quality of required programming and results tables. The position offers opportunities for professional skills development and growth.
You would be joining a fast growing, successful team, operating at the cutting edge of the science of incorporating stakeholder preferences into health care decision making. We have developed an innovative, collaborative culture, aimed at developing and sharing good practice in preference research, both internally and externally. We are looking for someone who will thrive in this environment.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: (other duties may be assigned)
Prepare and manage research data from diverse sources (e.g. discrete choice experiments), using statistical packages such as STATA and R.
Statistical or econometric analyses of preference data (e.g. discrete choice models)
Contribute to quality assurance, such as validation and peer review of statistical software code.
Contribute to the development of final study reports, statistical analysis plans, presentations and manuscripts for the publication in peer-reviewed journals.
Review project related documentations such as case report forms, and proposals, and provide feedback to project team.
Act as expert consultant to other staff within Evidera.
Mentoring of junior colleagues
Requirements
Minimum of 2 years of statistical or econometric experience required
Excellent understanding of and generous experience with R or STATA as required by the specific job position.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Desired Skills
Knowledge of choice-based preference elicitation method, such as discrete choice experiment.
Experience/knowledge of health-related research (health economics, biostatistics, epidemiology, outcomes research).
Experience with micro-econometric analysis (e.g. limited dependent variable models).
Education and Experience
Master's degree (preferred) or equivalent degree with 2-3 years’ experience, BA/BS degree with 4-5 years’ work experience as a data analyst.
About Evidera:
Evidera is a business within in Pharmaceutical Product Development, LLC (PPD) a leading global contract research organization (CRO), and a is a preeminent provider of evidence-based solutions. We provide integrated scientific expertise and global operational capabilities to help clients generate the evidence needed to optimize the market access and commercial potential of products.

Perks:
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, with clear opportunities for growth and career progression. You will have the opportunity to work on multiple projects with some of the industry’s leading researchers. Our offices boast a fun and collaborative working environment, frequent social events and a robust support system. We are committed to providing training and professional development, with ample opportunity to advance, for all our staff.
Evidera’s Core Competencies:
Customer Focus
Initiative
Teamwork
Problem Solving/Judgment
Accountability
If you resonate with our core competencies and want to contribute to research and consulting services driven by world-class science and thought leadership, then please submit your application – we’d love to hear from you.

AEVI is looking for a Business Analyst.
The role
The Business Analyst will undertake requirements gathering, system analysis, and specification for product development and project-related activities.
The role will also undertake a range of activities related to business process change (including supporting IT systems), including facilitating user workshops and user meetings to gather requirements, determining solution options, defining and documenting business requirements. Additionally, the Business Analyst will support systems analysis, development, and testing activities.
Some of the responsibilities will include
To undertake the required work utilizing the Company’s processes in order to assess the effort required for the business analysis and produce estimates of the time to be spent on work
To gain a detailed personal understanding of the customer’s current business processes, solutions, and supporting IT environment, including drivers for change
To undertake data gathering activities to determine new business requirements, including facilitating user meetings and workshops
To ensure all ‘stakeholders’ are identified and sufficiently involved during all stages of data gathering activities. To ensure each individual ‘stakeholder’ provides high levels of personal and public support to data gathering activities
To challenge, shape, and clarify business requirements, particularly highlighting commercial, financial, and IT systems implications of requirements
To analyze the confirmed business requirements and any additional or alternative business requirements
To define and document confirmed business requirements, including business process mapping, data modeling, and financial analysis
To support the client to build a business case to justify business and IT change
To assist with systems analysis, design, and testing activities, as required and define the solution
To ensure appropriate, comprehensive, and timely reporting of work and early escalation of any issue that may impact on the quality or delivery timescales analysis
To support the ‘hand over’ to systems analysis and development, including knowledge transfer and personal assistance during the transition and early development phase
To complete ad hoc duties and tasks allocated through the line management chain from time to time
Facilitating the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders
Helping the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future
Ideally, we are looking for someone with the following skills
Proven experience of working as a business analyst operating in a complex business and technical environment
Experience of working in a technology supplier organization (ideally Payment services)
A track record in at least two of the following:
Application development
Project Management – Agile framework
Enterprise/Technology Architecture
Testing or related QA Activities
System Analysis
Demonstrable ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Demonstrable analysis and problem-solving skills with an ability to critically review data/information
Proven experience in functional analysis and design in the domain of business process modeling
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Understand Global Payments Business and Trends
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle

Your chance
Working at AEVI is like life, and life is not always smooth sailing. It’s more like a rollercoaster – incredibly enjoyable, scary at times… but always worth the ride!
Jump into your new career and be a part of an international work family, with great perks like flexible ways to work and self-development at your own pace.

At Improbable, we’re bringing together technology and games to create new opportunities and experiences. In order to achieve this, we need unique perspectives from diverse people, empowered to revolutionise how online games are made, delivered and paid for.

We believe one of the biggest, most impactful changes to the way we live our lives is going to come from the medium of games. Realising new communities, societies and vocations through virtual worlds is what drives our people and gives them purpose.

Your Mission:

As part of a dedicated IT Support team in London, you will have a unique opportunity to build a career in a cutting edge IT department. You will join a team of experienced IT support staff and will be tasked with supporting a large team of experienced game developers and system engineers.

As an IT Support Analyst at Improbable you will be primarily responsible for helping support our development teams with a focus on high-level desktop and laptop hardware builds. You will need to use your experience in troubleshooting technical hardware, fixing system issues, maintaining onboarding processes, managing access control and will often be assisting in the deployment of global IT initiatives across our international office locations.

We’re working to leverage the latest hardware systems and cloud hosting technologies in order to manage, build and support our organisation. Our common goal is to enable Improbable to meet our development goals by accelerating IT systems and services worldwide.
Areas of Impact:
Accelerating development through IT support
Fine tuning our hardware specifications to tailor for the role
Advancing the user experience in our onboarding process
Supporting the deployment of our hybrid cloud games hosting service to the user
We'd like to hear from you if you identify with the following:
You enjoy building machines from scratch
Are up to speed with the very latest in desktop hardware technologies
Enjoy a fast paced team focussed support environment
Are an established high performer within the desktop support IT space
Love games and game development
Active and social within your working team
Are familiar with Google Services including Google Cloud
Worked extensively with Windows OS

AEVI is looking for a Business Analyst.
The role
The Business Analyst will undertake requirements gathering, system analysis, and specification for product development and project-related activities.
The role will also undertake a range of activities related to business process change (including supporting IT systems), including facilitating user workshops and user meetings to gather requirements, determining solution options, defining and documenting business requirements. Additionally, the Business Analyst will support systems analysis, development, and testing activities.
Some of the responsibilities will include
To undertake the required work utilizing the Company’s processes in order to assess the effort required for the business analysis and produce estimates of the time to be spent on work
To gain a detailed personal understanding of the customer’s current business processes, solutions, and supporting IT environment, including drivers for change
To undertake data gathering activities to determine new business requirements, including facilitating user meetings and workshops
To ensure all ‘stakeholders’ are identified and sufficiently involved during all stages of data gathering activities. To ensure each individual ‘stakeholder’ provides high levels of personal and public support to data gathering activities
To challenge, shape, and clarify business requirements, particularly highlighting commercial, financial, and IT systems implications of requirements
To analyze the confirmed business requirements and any additional or alternative business requirements
To define and document confirmed business requirements, including business process mapping, data modeling, and financial analysis
To support the client to build a business case to justify business and IT change
To assist with systems analysis, design, and testing activities, as required and define the solution
To ensure appropriate, comprehensive, and timely reporting of work and early escalation of any issue that may impact on the quality or delivery timescales analysis
To support the ‘hand over’ to systems analysis and development, including knowledge transfer and personal assistance during the transition and early development phase
To complete ad hoc duties and tasks allocated through the line management chain from time to time
Facilitating the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders
Helping the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future
Ideally, we are looking for someone with the following skills
Proven experience of working as a business analyst operating in a complex business and technical environment
Experience of working in a technology supplier organization (ideally Payment services)
A track record in at least two of the following:
Application development
Project Management – Agile framework
Enterprise/Technology Architecture
Testing or related QA Activities
System Analysis
Demonstrable ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Demonstrable analysis and problem-solving skills with an ability to critically review data/information
Proven experience in functional analysis and design in the domain of business process modeling
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Understand Global Payments Business and Trends
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle

Your chance
Working at AEVI is like life, and life is not always smooth sailing. It’s more like a rollercoaster – incredibly enjoyable, scary at times… but always worth the ride!
Jump into your new career and be a part of an international work family, with great perks like flexible ways to work and self-development at your own pace.

Interested in joining an organisation that is being recognised for the evolution of its products and the impact this has on clinical trial recruitment? Here at Antidote, we dare to change the status quo when it comes to helping match patients to clinical trials. We aim to accelerate the breakthroughs of new treatments by bridging the gap between medical research and the people who need them.

We are a team of ~ 40 people, with dramatic growth plans and exciting projects to deliver in 2021.

This is a newly created role and we are looking for an experienced, ambitious, collaborative individual to join us on our journey.

The Role

As part of the Antidote product team (with 2 Product Managers and a Head of Design), the Business Analyst will be responsible for business need analysis and process mapping, and then developing technical specifications for proposed software solutions. This role works closely with other Product Managers, Engineering Leads, system users and stakeholders (internal and external).

Responsibilities
Responsible for gathering and producing business systems requirements and supporting the delivery of projects.
Conduct interviews with stakeholders to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods
Research, review, and analyse the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements & identify ways to improve
Help support projects across the digital, data and tech departments across the entire lifecycle from start to finish ensuring any business requirements that need to be developed are done so.
Partner with product manager(s) to manage the backlog of development requests with key stakeholders and facilitate the prioritisation of requests based on the value case.
Define the end to end flow of any requirement identifying stakeholder departments and the user journey, including associated process mapping to drive clarity of current vs. future state.
Support the QA process by assisting in creating acceptance criteria, facilitating the UAT process etc.
Analysis of business processes and systems, with recommendations for their improvement with the use of modelling, measurement and statistical application.
Requirements
Minimum of 3+ years experience as a BA, supporting full agile software development lifecycle
Strong analytical skills and ability to deal with detail, and to extract and present relevant information concisely
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) across multiple constituents including stakeholders, users, product and engineering
Demonstrable self-starter, able to investigate and lead
Demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst in an IT department (understanding and awareness of systems, software and cloud-based solutions)
Experience in all stages of the SDLC - requirements analysis, design, development and deployment
Experience with agile development documentation tools such as Atlassian Jira and Confluence, as well as other best practice tools, is highly beneficial
Experience working within a fast-moving startup or scaleup environment would be beneficial
Preferable healthcare experience with background in medical informatics and analytics
Benefits

Salary range: £45K-£50K

Full benefits package including:
Pension
Optional private medical insurance
Life Assurance
Monthly wellbeing subsidy
Remote working stipend and home setup allowance
Stock options
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Your birthday off
Discretionary performance related bonus

We bring together a modern edit of over 700 established and new generation designers. Founded over 30 years ago as a brick and mortar store, we transitioned online in 2012. In 2017, APAX Partners acquired a majority stake in MATCHESFASHION, fueling our expansion. We now ship to 176 countries, have millions of site visits monthly and 98% of our sales are online with the majority of sales made internationally.

We have a global website, mobile apps, retail stores, private shopping, VIP events and 24/7 customer care and MyStylist teams. We have offices in the UK and Hong Kong. In London, our head office is based in The Shard, our brand-new creative hub is in Here East.

We lead the way, moving our industry forward, and we are always looking for talented individuals to come in and inspire the world with us.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity and Inclusion is a priority for MATCHESFASHION – we delight customers around the world and so it’s important that our team represents our customers.

We want to attract the very best talent and create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people and enables them to do the best work of their careers. We recognise the world is not a perfect place and that bias exists, which is why we take a focused approach in this area and are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status or disability status.

The Opportunity

Our central London team is looking for talented and enthusiastic Analysts to perform weapon system assessments for our UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) customer. The role will suit either recent STEM graduates, postgraduates, or those with relevant industry experience of systems engineering who wish to apply their abilities in a technical analysis and systems assessment environment.

What Type of Project Will You Be Working On?

Customer Integration: You will be a member of a weapons project team within our larger Defence Studies Group working in Central London. The group is integrated into a joint unit with government employees, members of the armed forces, and other contractors.
The Challenge: To conduct analysis to assess the performance and capability of threat weapon systems. Complex problems are solved through the application of scientific methods, physical principles and analytics to intractable data sets, a process which may involve new techniques and their encapsulation in improved tools.
Collaboration: You will be working in close liaison with teams within the UK and partner nations, with the opportunity to contribute, influence, challenge and improve joint ways of working and knowledge.
Breadth: You will be working in an environment where both the complexity and capabilities of the threats are continually evolving throughout the world.

What You'll Get

Impact: You will help ensure that MOD's weapon threat assessments are robust and delivered in a timely manner to UK Defence partners and front-line forces.
Opportunity: To play a key role in MOD weapon threat assessment which is a critical input to MOD's equipment procurement programs.
Knowledge: You will develop a detailed understanding of weapon systems and how they operate.
Skills: You will develop a range of analytical, software and interpersonal skills.
Insights: Working within a Leonardo team that is fully integrated with its MoD customer will provide an excellent opportunity to see up-close how the MOD operates.
Teamwork: You will work with a diverse technical team in a highly collaborative environment.
Delegation: It is expected that you will be able to steer tasks, processes and improvement initiatives.

What you will do

In conjunction with the project team conduct regular liaison with both MOD and the wider customer base to keep them informed of recent developments and to determine future analysis requirements.
Conduct analysis through the application of physical principles to real world problems. This will be facilitated through the suite of in-house software tools and the development of ad-hoc software, primarily in Python.
Production of reports and presentations of your work and presentation of them to local MOD customers and the wider community both within the UK and partner nations.
Provide ad hoc advice and support to MOD customers, often at short notice.
Use your developing experience and knowledge to propose and implement improvements to tools and processes.
Seek co-operative and collaborative approaches with our UK and multi-national partners, identifying best practice.
Take opportunities to travel for technical exchanges with our partners, in the UK and abroad.

How Will We Support You?

We want to support you and encourage you to fulfill your potential through:

Learning: You'll be supported in your ongoing development though extensive training and mentoring with the opportunity to obtain professional chartership.
Flex-leave schemes: We offer our employees the time and flexibility they need to enjoy a balanced life
Annual leave: We offer 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays
Supportive relocation package: To make your move to London even more attractive
Award-winning pension scheme: Our multi-award-winning pension scheme includes generous employer contribution
Employee discount schemes: We offer you and your family an attractive range of discounts from retail and cinema to hotel bookings and vehicles benefits
Reserve Forces: We provide positive support to the Reserve Forces and allow employees who are Reservists to take additional time off
Career break: Where appropriate, we support our employees in pursuing other interests outside the workplace

What we are looking for

A good understanding of scientific methods and their use through the application of fundamental physical principles.
A degree, or equivalent, in a STEM subject and strong numerical and analytical skills, with the ability to apply these to real world problems.
Although not essential, an appreciation of aerospace technologies, such as aerodynamics, propulsion, guidance & control, weapon systems sensors would be an advantage.
Experience of Python and C# would be beneficial.
Good Interpersonal skills which allow you to work collaboratively and effectively within an inter-disciplinary team.
Ability to problem solve and self-steer work to deadlines as necessary, sometimes at short notice.
Ability to communicate, both in writing and verbally, with audiences of differing technical backgrounds and seniority.
You will have, or be able to obtain, UK national security clearances appropriate for sensitive assessment work (see https://www.gov.uk/guidance/security-vetting-and-clearance).

INSTANDA is an insurance software provider, that is challenging the status quo. We have built an exciting software solution which fundamentally changes how companies in the insurance industry can design and deliver products to the market. We work directly with carriers, managing general agents (MGAs), and brokers. Using leading-edge technologies, INSTANDA insurance software is entirely configurable from the ground up. It is not a one-size-fits-all model, which allows our clients to use our software in the way they want to. We have many global clients using INSTANDA who confirm the game-changing benefits of the product; significant speed coupled with time and cost savings for the insurance sector.

Founded in 2012, we spent several years designing and building our platform which is now being used globally by some of the world’s largest insurance companies. Amongst our many achievements, we were recently chosen by Microsoft UK as a disruptive technology that their ventures program sponsored. With just 20 employees in the company in January 2017, INSTANDA now has over 100 employees based in the UK, the US and Australia. We continue to expand globally and look forward to hiring employees to join our team.

Learn more about us at www.instanda.com and watch an overview of our business by clicking here.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Reporting to our Senior Systems Analyst, we are looking to hire a smart and technically savvy Business Analyst to join our team based in London. The position is perfect for someone who wants to experience working for a scaling tech company and be instrumental in helping the business thrive.

The year 2020 has been an exciting one for our organization. We raised a $19.5M USD Series A fundraise and while we work from home because of Covid, our dynamic, high growth nature has not been impacted. Our team has continued growing through Covid and now we are looking for a Business Analyst. This person would be responsible for gathering requirements, documentation, some configuration and client support of the INSTANDA platform. Our clients face technology and resource constraints which mean that new insurance products and/or offerings could take a very long time to launch and be very costly. With INSTANDA however, insurers can build their products, set their distribution networks, test and launch their products in unprecedented timescales – all without writing a single line of code. No prior experience of the INSTANDA platform is required but experience in the insurance industry is needed. This is a customer facing role, the ideal candidate should have an analytical mindset and excellent communication skills, to ensure the smooth delivery of our solution to our clients. We are seeking candidates who are not only self-motivated, they embrace a fast-paced commercial environment and enjoy working with people to create a positive customer experience to increase our client base into 2021.

If this sounds like you, we look forward to reviewing your application!

Responsibilities:
Conduct interviews and workshops with our clients and stakeholders to clarify requirements
Effectively capture, understand, define and document functional and non-functional business requirements that gather the clients' key criteria and technical requirements, and align these to our commercial and technical considerations

Partner with our service delivery and engineering teams to support design and sign off potential new functionalities
Support the UAT process of the INSTANDA configuration and of new functionalities
Take a hands-on approach to troubleshooting
Once it’s safe, this role will require travel to client sites in London and the surrounding area with occasional travel to other parts of the UK and overseas
Requirements
3 + years’ experience as a Business Analyst of which at least 2 years in the insurance industry
Experience of the end-to-end software delivery lifecycle
Experience working with development teams
You will have experience of process and systems analysis and be able to translate technical principles into business objectives
We want to understand the depth and breadth of your stakeholder relationship management approach and skills as we need you to consult with our clients and partners on product configuration, development, QA and business and technology integration
We need you to be confident in presenting to clients, partner organisations and within INSTANDA and have experience of converting business requirements into configuration, development and technical needs underpinned by commercially viable business outcomes
Experience of SaaS or platform technology solutions will be a distinct advantage
You’ll have an ability to multi-task and handle competing deadlines in our fast-paced dynamic environment
Benefits
You have the opportunity to be part of one of the world’s best insurtech brands, where you get to make big contributions
We offer 25 vacation days but recognize that some people like more personal time! We offer the option of buying up to 5 additional vacation days per year. We also offer additional vacation days for each year of service up to 30 days
We offer a wellness allowance of 100 GBP per month. We would like our employees to use this towards private medical health, a gym membership, or health and wellness related expenses.

Proactively manage and resolve any risks and issues that arise during project delivery
Build Bond pricing and analytics tool that can contribute and analyse our own pricing data & skew electronic pricing based on various parameters eg RFQ flows, axe/positioning & benchmark indicators.
Build tolerances and thresholds for firm/magenta pricing on retail platform to capture more flow
Flexibility to rollout pricer/analyser to new markets eg DM IG/HY as well as local market bonds/FX/rates
Familiarity with Bloomberg/TOMS, MarketAxess/Trax & Tradeweb GUIs/APIs, Murex and interconnectivity between all platforms
Build CDS and Repo STP functionality between TOMS/Murex
Assisting technical teams to ensure appropriate project progress

Experienced individual that can demonstrate sound software engineering principles and have a combination of the following technical skills:
Excellent knowledge of Core Java, SQL, Agile, Fix Protocol, HTML, Matlab and Python (Essential)
Strong server-side Java development skills. Solid understanding of multi-threaded programming, low latency trading knowledge, performance tuning, data structures and memory management. Other skills of note include Linux, Familiarity with FIX order flows
Experience in machine learning development

Experience in high volume, low latency development in FX and Bonds (Essential)
Solid knowledge around FX and Bonds and experience developing electronic trade solutions for FX and Bond products
Experience with low latency data systems ie KDB, One Tick
Experience of developing Oracle based connectivity and reporting
Prior experience implementing latency sensitive electronic trading applications
Experience integrating with financial exchanges and venues using the FIX protocol
Detailed understanding of market connectivity, internal order management, trade algorithm logic and trade routing components

Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
Experience working in a fast-paced environment. Experience working directly with a trading desk highly desirable
Strong analytical skills. Ability to work directly with traders and business heads and presenting/developing solutions to stakeholders, IT and other internal teams

Global mindset
Resilience
Client mindset

High level of integrity

Able to navigate complexity
Can work in ambiguity

The Application Support Analyst is the day to day Technical Owner of the Enterprise Systems that they support. They are responsible for troubleshooting Application layer issues, initiating and coordinating with various teams across the business to resolve issues. They will also lead any root cause analysis activities and remain responsible for managing systems to ensure that they are maintained to avoid issues and remain validated. The job holder is responsible for maintaining GxP Systems/Applications which are used by the Development and Quality functions within the approved Software Development Management Lifecycle.

The job holder will be responsible for day to day management of their systems to ensure that they are:
Managing issues as they arise and providing resolutions or workarounds that maintain the validated state of the system.
Leading root cause analysis investigations to prevent reoccurrence of incidents and problems.
Management and production of system reporting to support Service agreements and proactive system management.
Supplier Management:
Work with suppliers,
Supporting annual reviews
Ensure appropriate technical knowledge transfer is completed
Issue resolution activities are complete appropriately to maintain system compliance
Maintain system availability/performance.
Active management of software licences.
Managing routine maintenance activities such as server restarts, and general system housekeeping activities including knowledge of application logs.
Managing the full lifecycle of changes on allocated systems to ensure change requests are fulfilled according to standard operating procedures
Leading / Participating in upgrade projects as appropriate.
Risk/Impact assessment of any application patches or upgrades provided by the Vendor to manage end-of-life risk and wider implications of required changes/updates.
Management of technology dependency roadmap to ensure that Operating systems, databases and any 3rd party technical applications do not pose a risk to the system by going end of life / unsupported.
Internal
Vendor
Adhering to the Disaster Recovery Schedule to ensure the overall system can be recovered/restored to support defined RPO and RTO. Note: this activity also requires the job holder to proactively manage the improvement of both of these measures to provide improved service.
Testing of the applications to ensure system works correctly following critical server patching.
Assisting with Periodic reviews of GxP Systems.
Provide comprehensive support and end user documentation for all systems and project implementations to improve support team knowledge and the end user experience.
Fulfilling the role of Subject Matter Expert for all assigned technologies.
Out of hours working will be required as part of this role.
Some travel may be required as part of this role.
Quality Documentation including but not limited to:
Deviation
Change Control (including emergency)
Periodic Review
System Descriptions
SOPs/WI’s
Managing and maintaining the system inventory including but not limited to:
DR RAG status
Vendor Information
License information
Technology Roadmap
System responsibilities
Requirements
Demonstrable IT Enterprise Application support experience
Good understanding of IT technologies such as Servers, desktops/laptop PCs and adhoc application support.
Knowledge and experience of working in cross-functional, international project environments in matrix management structure.
Knowledge and experience of working within GxP principles is an advantage.
Excellent customer service attitude.
Must possess a “can do” attitude and be enthusiastic with a positive outlook.
Excellent planning, organisational and prioritising skills
Exceptional attention to detail, with good literacy and numerical skills.
A self-starter with a high degree of initiative, ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Good Communication and documentation skills.
Solution/Results-orientated.

Systems Analyst

Working as part of a close-knit team, you will be working to drive the core systems and engaging with all departments to ensure processes are embedded. With Dynamics 365 being recently implemented, we are looking for someone with Microsoft Dynamics 365.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Systems Analyst with commercial experience in a role of a similar nature. You will be responsible for working cross-functionally with the wider business, boasting skills with a large ERP system, Dynamics 365 is essential.

Key experience and skills needed for the Systems Analyst:
Broad knowledge in Microsoft Dynamics 365
Previously worked collaboratively, and can communicate successfully with the wider business
Extensive experience working commercially with a large ERP system
Commercial experience in a role of a similar nature
Systems Analyst - ERP, Dynamics, Dynamics 365, analysis, systems, analyst.

G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.

The role

We are looking for a Cyber Investigation and Response Analyst to work as part of our CSIRT (Cyber Security Investigation and Response Team). This is a fantastic opportunity to work on multiple different aspects of security, with responsibilities ranging from alert triage to threat intelligence.

The successful candidate will be working with a whole host of different technologies across a combination of on-premise, hybrid cloud, and cloud native environments. This is a unique opportunity for someone with a strong grounding in a Security Operations Centre (SOC) environment to move into a new phase of their career, with growth and diversification opportunities into Incident Response, Threat Intelligence or even Security Engineering.

Key responsibilities of the role include:
Investigating and responding to malicious and suspicious activity in the G-Research network
Monitoring, triaging, and responding to security alerts
Developing, deploying, and documenting new detection techniques
Configuring security monitoring tools
Assessing threats and providing data collection and monitoring recommendations for new systems and applications within the environment
Advancing CSIRT capabilities by providing input and feedback to Security Engineering, Security Data Engineering, and Security Data Science teams
Who are we looking for?

This role will suit someone with drive, energy and a passion for Cyber Security. A part of this role will also include mentoring and coaching across the team.

The ideal candidate will have:
Previous SOC experience and mature understanding of security incident response and investigation
Azure Sentinel stack experience
Strong alert triage and detection engineering experience
Experience with threat intelligence
Experience monitoring for insider threats and working in a Cloud computing environment
The ability to document and articulate impact, timeline, and outcome of an incident to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong attention to detail and an inquisitive mind-set
The following skills/experience would also be beneficial:
Hybrid cloud experience
Python knowledge
Knowledge of cutting-edge big data technologies and how to work with them (HDFS, Spark, Jupyter notebooks, Kibana) would be beneficial.

Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday

Cycle-to-work scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Monthly company events
Central London office close to 5 tube 5 stations and 6 tube lines

Job Title: SENIOR SAP BUSINESS AND SYSTEMS ANALYST – FINANCE PLANNING AND ANALYTICS
Job Description:
IT & DELIVERY

LONDON

PERMANENT
About us GAZPROM Germania GmbH is a subsidiary of the world’s largest natural gas producer, Gazprom. Since its establishment in 1990, GAZPROM Germania has developed into an internationally operating group of 44 companies in 15 countries in Europe and Asia. Its main business activities include the storage and trading of natural gas. It employs approximately
ABOUT US
GAZPROM Germania GmbH is a subsidiary of the world’s largest natural gas producer, Gazprom. Since its establishment in 1990, GAZPROM Germania has developed into an internationally operating group of 44 companies in 15 countries in Europe and Asia. Its main business activities include the storage and trading of natural gas. It employs approximately 1,800 employees, around 200 of whom work at its Berlin headquarters. Together with its strategic partners, GAZPROM Germania Group helps ensure a reliable, environmentally-friendly, and sustainable energy supply for Europe.
Gazprom Marketing & Trading (GM&T) is an integral part of the GAZPROM Germania Group. Headquartered in London, GM&T operates to provide a global marketing reach, round the clock operational coverage and excellent customer service. Established in 1999, GM&T has grown from a single office in London into a truly global organisation, with around 1000 employees worldwide. With offices in Europe, Asia and the USA, GM&T trades energy commodities including gas, power, oil, LPG, helium, emissions, LNG and FX.
Our culture is defined by our people. Through living our values every day we continue to create a culture that enables us all to succeed. We work as one team with our customers, our parent company and each other in order to understand each other’s needs. With an unstoppable passion for excellence, growth and learning, we’re committed to creating an environment that fosters the development of knowledge, skills and experience, so that our people can thrive and prosper in their careers with us. We believe that we have the best team in the industry which makes us a trusted partner across international capital and energy markets. Our diverse employee base, with a wealth of expertise, knowledge and experience makes GM&T a truly exciting place to work. We encourage new ideas and initiatives as innovative thinking is central to how we do business. Most importantly, we are a growing and developing business where inspired individuals can make a difference and help shape our future.

ROLE OBJECTIVES
The Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics (London) is required to support the annual operating plan of the Enterprise Performance Management and Analytics team. This role is a leading member of the EPM team and aligned to the Finance business stakeholders in London.
This role will advise the business how, within the context of business processes, requirements can best be met within the SAP environment. This role is a delivery role that is expected to work on projects, small enhancements, tactical solutions and BAU to enable the SAP Finance roadmap.
In addition, it is expected that the Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics will collaborate with the Corporate Services architect and EPM Capability Manager to identify and propose improvements in both business processes and the system, and work with the business stakeholders to convert improvement proposals into business requirements.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics will be involved in the delivery of Projects, Enhancements and Support to our SAP Business Intelligence, Planning and Consolidation systems.
Analyse the business requirements, business processes, business case and/or technical architectures and develop blueprint and/or designs as per best practises.
Elicit and Document Requirements and preparation of Functional Specification Documents, Process Design Documents, Technical Specification Documents, Test Script and User Manuals.
Participate in the development of prototypes and implementation of data model, reporting, analytics and planning system enhancements in SAP BW, SAP BPC, SAP BW-IP, Business Objects and SAP Analytics Cloud.
Working closely with the London Finance team to identify areas of improvement, propose and implement enhancements in an agile delivery environment.
Manage, guide and work with inhouse/onshore, near shore and offshore teams.
Work with Business analysts, end users and partners in multiple locations to deliver a usable solution.
SKILLS & COMPETENCIES
Modelling: Extensive knowledge of data warehouse concepts and experience in SAP BW Architecture on SQL Server, Extended Star-Schema, Multi-Dimensional Modelling, Data Flow Strategy and BW Objects.
Reporting: Use of BW tools i.e. Queries, Workbooks, BEx Analyzer, and Analysis for Office.
Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud would be an advantage.
ABAP: Good knowledge in Reading / Writing Routines, Enhancements (CMOD), Users Exit.
Training: Able to provide Training on the BW Reports to Expert Users and End Users.
Knowledge and hands-on experience implementing SAP planning solutions using SAP BW Integrated Planning or BPC (NW).
BPC consolidation experience would be advantageous.
Good Functional knowledge of the following SAP ECC modules:
FI (New GL, AR, AP)
CO
FSCM (Treasury)
Good business process knowledge of the following processes would be useful:
P2P
Order to cash
Record to report
Self-starter/able to work with limited guidance.
Able to understand business issues and specify IT solutions.
Team-player with ability to achieve results through shared initiatives.
Able to meet tight deadlines and work under pressure.
Excellent communication skills e.g. written, verbal and presentation.
Motivated, tenacious and pro-active in achieving results.
Diligent and dependable with strong integrity.
Proposes technical solutions that meet or exceed client needs and expectations.
Designs and validates a complex architecture and ensures its successful implementation.
MS Office tools like Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
EXPERIENCE
Accounting background (CIMA) or equivalent experience
Preferably from a Big 4 / Tier 1 consulting background at a manager level
Demonstrate credibility with working with business colleagues including the ability to provide appropriate challenge and review to requirements
Functional Specification and configuration of SAP BW 7.3 or later (non-HANA)
Experience in trading / integrated supply and trading would be an advantage
Experience working with offshore teams
Experience with implementing global processes and solutions a plus
Experienced with waterfall and Agile delivery methodology
Hands on experience developing, testing and delivering SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or equivalent components.
Full life-cycles hands on experience in engaging and leading large Datawarehouse, Analytics or Financial Planning projects or implementations.
EDUCATION
Degree (or equivalent ideally in an accounting, financial management or mathematics)
CIMA or equivalent qualification would be an advantage.
SAP or IT Professional certifications in desired skill areas an advantage, but genuine experience implementing SAP BW solutions is most important.

Business Analyst
A permanent opportunity to join our team in Rugby with some flexibility to work from home. The ideal candidate will need to attend our Rugby office at least 2 to 3 days per week.
About the role
At OpusVL we develop and customise open source Business Management Software.
Our customers operate in a variety of different industries, such as Healthcare, Retail (physical, web, and omni-channel), Manufacturing & Assembly.
All our projects start off with a Discovery and Design phase to ensure we are building an appropriate solution to meet a real business need.
As a Business Analyst, you will lead the Discovery;
Hold workshops and meetings with clients to discover their business requirements.
Analyse requirements in detail with a view to how they can be met using software.
Produce written documentation for the client and for our internal technical teams to use when designing the solution.
About you
You understand business processes, workflow, and the potential for automation.
You have a grasp of business accounting principles.
You know how to drill-down, find edge cases, and really get into the detail of business requirements. You can then write accurate documentation with enough information for Solution Architects and Developers to build a system from.
You’re organised (because you have a system).
You have good interpersonal skills, and are comfortable leading meetings and managing group dynamics.
You can help clients to figure out what their problems actually are, challenging their thinking, working collaboratively to arrive at a solution.
Nice to haves
It would be great (but not essential) if you can bring any of the following experience and skills to the role:
Experience and understanding of a variety of different industries
Have been involved in requirements gathering for software development or ERP implementation
Can help clients to work out the business benefit of systemising or automating a process (i.e. will they get a positive ROI?)
Have used an ERP system (such as Odoo, SAP, Netsuite, or Microsoft Dynamics)
What we offer:
A casual dress code
Flexible working
Social events
Company pension scheme
£30 Gift Voucher for employee birthdays
Free weekly fruit delivery (currently on hold due to Covid-19)
Other employee benefits (currently being revised & improved)
Working at OpusVL
At OpusVL we strive to provide a relaxed, highly supportive working environment.
We understand that to be creative and produce high quality work, our staff need a comfortable environment that suits them individually.
We’ll support your training and development, and give you paid time to attend conferences and other events relevant to your role.
The OpusVL office is in a convenient central UK location right in the heart of Rugby, about two minutes walk from the shops, cafes and coffee shops. There’s no dress code for technical people and working hours are flexible.
So if you want to make a difference, and support open source while working on interesting projects then we’d love to hear from you!
To apply, please follow the link.
**We do not use or accept offers from agencies.
**We do not offer Right to Work Sponsorships.

Job Details
Finance Systems Analyst Reporting Developer | Leading Law Firm | Central London | Permanent | Up to £60,000

Working with a leading law firm looking for a Finance Systems Analyst/Report Developer to join the Finance department in London and report into the Finance Systems Manager. This is a newly created position following the recent upgrade to their new practice management system Elite 3E.

The ideal candidate must have extensive report design and development experience. Someone that has worked with Power BI is preferable but not essential, but the candidate must have some experience and understanding of an equivalent system. They must have experience using SQL to interrogate databases and advanced use of Excel, preferably including VBA skills.

The chosen candidate should be confident and capable in their ability but must also be able to present findings to non-technical users. This role is mid – senior level and coming from a legal or financial background is preferable.

Working hours are 9:30am to 5:30pm, Monday to Friday. Salary is up to £60,000 depending on experience.

They will be managing and designing new cloud strategies as well as documentation on how systems and networks work. They must have previous experience as an architect working with Microsoft stack such as Windows Server, Exchange, SharePoint, SQL and IIS. Proven experience of working with Microsoft Azure IaaS, SaaS and PaaS services is essential. Lastly, they must have design experience using Azure SQL, VM's, Containers, VNETs, Resource Groups, Traffic Manager etc

If interested or know anyone that would be, please get in contact immediately on; Isaac@dvfrecruitment.com or 0207 382 4288 / 07780 539944

G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.

The role

The Windows Operations group is responsible for the company’s technical infrastructure. The group has a broad scope of responsibilities, including managing and upgrading the current applications as well as researching and implementing new technologies. This is a fantastic opportunity to work for a vibrant and stimulating company in a diverse infrastructure role.

We’re looking for an experienced Windows Operations Analyst to join the Windows Software Delivery sub-group. This role will involve dealing with a large range of technologies and will be responsible for automation projects. The successful candidate will also be responsible for deploying new applications, upgrading existing systems, ensuring consistent estate performance improvements, and supporting/maintaining such changes. This will include:
Software rollouts to 1000’s of Windows machines
Managing a consistent estate-wide baseline
Automating software packaging and deployments
Supporting in-house and 3rd party monitoring and alerting tools
Co-ordinating large software upgrades across the company
Benchmarking performance and tuning applications
Scripting to automate problems and daily tasks
Coordinating consultants/support engineers for 3rd party support where required
Who are we looking for?

The role requires a skilled engineer with a strong track record of successfully delivering, supporting and improving the overall performance of a Microsoft Windows environment.

The ideal candidate will have at least 4-5 years’ experience working in an operational support role. Advantageous experience and skills also include:
Windows Server 2012 – 2019
Desired State Configuration (DSC)
PowerShell and/or other scripting languages such as Python and Ansible
Azure Cloud Stack
Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager
Visual Studio, Rider and other development toolsets
Splunk
Chocolatey
Notions of security and architecture (clustering, load balancing, DMZ)
Experience of working in a similar, high availability environment (conscious and focused on the controls required to assure the required service levels)
Problem solving and lateral thinking skills

Whilst we navigate the ongoing pandemic, a lot eCommerce brands are seeing a huge increase in customer demand. This well known omnichannel cycling brand are one of these. The business are very well-known in the cycling space and are looking for a Business Analyst to join their Central London based technology team to work across a variety of software systems.
As well as digital platforms, they have a physical presence so this role will have the chance to influence a variety of systems and platforms. 2020 is an exciting time for them to build best in class technology platforms to build upon.

Redefining their core eCommerce solution delivering a headless storefront
Improving stock control through enhancing the processes in their ERP system
Replacing POS systems

eCommerce experience is essential
Ideally you’ll have worked on SAP Hybris or Commerce Cloud platforms
Experience of agile software development methodologies
A passion for cycling is beneficial
Worked with cross functional teams as well as third parties
Able to work autonomously and ability to prioritise tasks
Great communicator
Big picture thinker who can take a holistic view of their software systems

Job Title Business Analyst
Position Full Time - Permanent
Role Business Services
Location London
Practice Area/Department IT
Description
Before you meet us, get to know us

RPC is a modern, progressive and commercially-oriented City legal
services business. From our offices in the UK, Hong Kong and Singapore
we provide advice to both UK and international clients.

What we do

Our legal practice spans a wide range of industry sectors and is
broadly split into two discrete areas: insurance and corporates.
Working on both contentious and non-contentious matters, our clients
range from large multinationals to growth UK corporate firms and other
professional practices, and include many household names.

Why we're different

We have a confident, accessible and enterprising approach that sets
performance, service and value at the top of the agenda. Our goal is
to do the usual things unusually well, make the complex simple and
help our internal and external clients build better, stronger businesses.

Business Services at RPC

Working at RPC means being part of a collaborative and
creative environment, which is flexible, transparent and friendly.
We value our business services teams and recognise that individual
contributions at all levels are essential to the success of RPC as a whole.

RPC's business services teams include:
Brand Marketing & Sales
Client Services
Executive Office
Facilities
Finance
Legal Project Management
Information Technology
People & Talent Development
Risk & Compliance
Secretarial Support
Role Overview

You will be part of a new programme delivery function, who will be
tasked with ensuring an ambitious portfolio of business change and
technology projects are delivered on time and in line with the firm's
objectives and strategy. You'll be responsible for eliciting and
documenting our business requirements, and ensuring solutions are
designed and delivered in line with them.

Reports to

Head of Programme Management

Duties and Responsibilities include but not are limited to the following:
Helping to establish the project delivery function, which will
involve designing and implementing our internal processes and
governance arrangements, and working with other business services
colleagues to define the scope and remit of the team and its
position in the firm
Undertaking consultation, interviews and workshops with diverse
stakeholder groups, at all levels of seniority across both
fee-earning and business services divisions, and with our clients
Analysing requirements, providing clear, concise and objective analysis
Documenting requirements and process flows (current and planned)
Liaising and translating between technical and non-technical stakeholders
Helping to develop business cases and project plans, and measuring
progress and success against them
Assisting with developing and running test and acceptance programmes
Knowledge, skills and experience
3+ years' experience as a Business Analyst with a proven track
record of successful project delivery in a law firm or other
professional services firm
Working knowledge of different analysis techniques and methods,
including defining and documenting requirements and specifications
Good knowledge of testing approaches and methods, and experience
of devising and running testing procedures
Understanding of different software development life cycles and methods
Ability to learn and understand complex business processes and
help to model new systems and procedures
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong commercial awareness, and experience of managing third
party suppliers
Keen attention to detail and numeracy skills
Ability to deal with difficult or demanding situations
Self-motivated and directed
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Analytical skills
Solid organisational skills including attention to detail and
multi-tasking skills
Well-developed interpersonal skills
Diplomacy
The ability to motivate people

Our client facing Business Analyst team are at the forefront defining and analysing all aspects of our client's project expectations, including owning software delivery, testing, QA, and UAT support across our software as a service (Saas) and data as a service (DaaS) environments.

As a BA team member you will be tasked with fleshing out the technical requirements of requests, suggestions and faults directly with our clients. You will then relate these requests to our internal delivery standards and define what the success criteria looks like for each change request.

The role

You will be tasked with developing both business and technical requirements from our clients, defining the success criteria between what the client wants and how we are going to deliver it. As such you will provide a critical link between our client and our delivery success, guiding development and data teams as they look to refine a technical solution which fits the clients need based on your assessment, analysis and guidance.

You will responsible for monitoring the end-to-end process for each piece of work, ensuring our delivery and releases meets expectations in terms of functionality and timescales, working hand-in-hand with the client throughout this process.

You will produce accurate evaluations and help to translate complex business requirements into solution design documentation and provide these to our software development and data services teams in order to make the changes required.

You will also clearly identify and, in conjunction with the development team, coordinate the execution of agreed testing plans, referencing back to the original business driver for the required change.

Required experience & skills
You must have at least 3+ years of specific experience in a similar software production or at least a client software deployment Business Analyst role.
You must have intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills.
You must have a strong intermediate level, and more importantly, commercial experience, in SQL - especially writing scripts querying data-sets and data models.
You will need to be able to show some evidence of structured analysis - using GAP and As Is / To Be analysis in your previous role.
You must definitely have experience of working within a structured methodology - meaning you have experience in using structured tools from requirement gathering right through to testing and release, i.e. business requirement documentation, functional and nonfunctional requirements, process flows diagrams, UML and use cases.
You have the ability to gather requirements and translate these business discussions into a road-map for technical teams (developers, UX/UI and data analysts) to execute on.
You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
You will have excellent client / stakeholder relationship skills, with prior experience in a "service delivery" focused role, preferably at a software house, systems vendor or management consultancy.
You are able to present ideas, concepts and projects reports with impact, using a variety of tools - MS PowerPoint, Visio, etc.
You will be experienced in working to tight timeframes and on delivery dependent projects.
What we offer
Competitive "software house" / FinTech salary with annual reviews, plus private health and pension.
A growing organisation where you will get recognised for the impact you make and fast-tracked with more responsibilities and more opportunities to learn.
An opportunity to work within an innovative start-up environment for a leading software house in the compliance automation / RegTech / FinTech space.
A work from home and come into the office only when really needed working model.
Your privacy is important to us, please see our Privacy Policy for details on how we handle your personal data. For any queries relating to your data please contact our Data Protection Committee at data.protection@icx4.com.

NO AGENCIES APPROACHES PLEASE - WE DO ALL OF OUR RECRUITING IN-HOUSE AND DIRECTLY

CNW Capital Service Ltd. is an advisory firm facilitating China-Europe cross-border asset management and direct investment. Our clients include leading fund managers, PE firms, banks, insurance firms, family offices and corporate both in China and Europe. We are recruiting a business analyst to the team.
Job Responsibilities:
1, Research on various sectors of asset management in both China and European market, including Mutual funds/long-only funds, hedges funds, PEs.
2, Research on various asset management themes. Examples: trend of a certain investment strategy; allocation procedure of a certain type of asset owners; the update on China’s capital outflow policies, etc.

4, Monitor various investment news coverage and proactively collect relevant messages and expand them into writing pieces after further research.

Job Requirements:
1, Degree in finance and investment related courses will be preferred
2, 1 year previous working or intern experience expected;
3, Excellent oral and written communication and reporting skill with clients in both China and UK;
4, Familiar with UK and China financial market and regulatory system;
5, Chinese language skill is a must.
