SuccessFactors & VBA HR Systems Analyst/Consultant
If you are a SuccessFactors expert with some VBA skills, this is great opportunity to work on an exciting time with a small HRIS team who are responsible for automating many HR related processes for a large and prestigious organisation!
In particular, there is a SuccessFactors integration project involving compensation and bonus modelling amongst other things. This is just the tip of the iceberg, so to speak, as there many other interesting bits of work to be done as well!
The role will involve:
Being one of 1 of the major HRIS resources within a large HR/HRIS team
To support the delivery and design of the annual salary and bonus review by integrating group companies onto the SuccessFactors platform used by the constituent entities
Analytical support on an evaluation of all personnel costs
Support both the HR team and the wider business to create reports using SuccessFactors Reporting tools.
Capture, validate and manage functional and non-functional business requirements to support process change.
Support the testing phases of various SuccessFactors projects and facilitate User Acceptance Testing
Hep in the production of project documentation including rollout communications and user guides
Participate in system admin training, act as system SME and provide User support during the rollout and post-live phases.
Support modelling tools written in Excel and Access VBA.
Actively encourage process change across a wide range of stakeholders
Do integration work with the SuccessFactors compensation module
Develop and implement data validation tools to automate the validation and reconciliation of data from a variety of sources eg Oracle HR to the bonus modelling tool.
Report building from a variety of sources including SuccessFactors
Data quality checking and improvement
Stakeholder management
Create and/or support automation solutions and processes for other HR processes eg redundancy calculator, AWR related processes, etc using VBA (mainly), Excel and to a very limited extent Access. HR analytics and reporting
You will need the following to be considered for the role
At the very least some experience of working with HR, HRIS and/or compensation review systems (your CV must show this in detail)
SuccessFactors - strong understanding of SAP SuccessFactors, including Role Based Permissions, Reporting and Administrative Tasks. Experience of the Compensation module would be particularly desirable.
Experience working with teams to accurately document manual processes and translate into visual models.
Good experience of working on HR projects, preferably partnering with IT teams possessing an understanding of basic project life cycle and methodology.
Strong stakeholder management skills
Experience with Excel and Access VBA.
Good and current VBA and Excel (VBA) skills

Contract: Fixed
Hours: Full time
Reports to: Project Manager
Location: Mansell Street E1 8AN
Member of: CRM Project Team
Accountabilities: CRM project deliverables
Salary: c.£35,000

London's Air Ambulance Charity
Every second of every day, London’s Air Ambulance delivers rapid response and cutting-edge medical care to save lives in the city.
Critical injury can happen to anyone, at any time. It is the biggest killer of people under 40.
We bring the hospital emergency department to the scene, delivering life-saving treatment to the 10 million people who live and work in London.
The service was established by a group of committed, determined and pioneering medics.
They saw that people were dying before they could get to hospital. They understood that every second counts.
Today, treating patients before they get to hospital has been transformed into an established medical discipline. We have a reputation as a world leader of rapid response medical care.
We have provided support to the capital in times of great need such as London Bridge, the Grenfell Tower fire and 7/7 bombings.
We are proud to count a number of “firsts” during our time:
The first survivor of open-heart surgery at the roadside;
The first to use life-saving REBOA procedure at the roadside;
The first to carry out blood transfusions at the roadside.
Our pioneering spirit continues to drive us to understand what more we can do to save lives.
Our Vision is to end preventable deaths in London from severe injury.
Our Mission is to save more lives in London through rapid response and cutting-edge care.
Our Values are:
Compassionate
We care about people and put them at the heart of everything we do. We are kind, respectful and always keen to listen to feedback.
Courageous
We are prepared to achieve our mission in challenging environments. We are authentic, honest and not afraid to challenge and take calculated risks.
Pioneering
We embrace and lead change through our innovation and creativity. We are constantly learning, both from our successes and from our failures to make sure we are always striving to improve.
Context
The Charity has decided to move to a new CRM system, the successful delivery of which is key to us delivering on our ambitious and innovative organisational objectives.
The CRM provides a platform for stewarding supporters appropriately and delivering charity business process, including, event, communications, prospecting, gift aid, direct debit, volunteer and major donor management. The new CRM will also form the foundation for sophisticated data analysis, segmentation and the delivery of London’s Air Ambulance Charity’s strategic marketing and fundraising goals.
The cross functional CRM Project Team will identify and document requirements in the form of epics and detailed user stories from across the charity and assist with the delivery of user stories by ensuring that the new CRMs functionality and features are leveraged as fully as possible. This role will identify and document source data to be migrated to the new CRM and formulate business rules for migrating data to the target CRM. The role also ensures that business processes are optimised to deliver user stories as effectively and efficiently as possible.
Team purpose
To formulate a project plan for the delivery and implementation of a new CRM for managing supporter data including personal, financial and consent data.
Role Purpose
The role of Business Analyst is to support the CRM Project Manager and the wider project team in the implementation of a new customer relationship management (CRM) system, ensuring that the new CRM’s functionality is leveraged to the full to deliver business requirements and project goals.
Application Details
We have partnered with Understanding Recruitment for the recruitment of this role. For more information on the role and how apply, please see their website here - https://www.understandingrecruitment.co.uk/job/business-analyst-104/
Closing date for the role is 15/11/2020 and we intend to interview week commencing 16/11/2020.
Our intention is for someone to start in the role in December 2020 if possible. The role will be temporarily based at home as is the case for our entire charity team and in line with Government advice about the ongoing situation.
London's Air Ambulance Limited is committed to eliminating any discrimination and promoting diversity and equality of opportunity in all it does. It is therefore London's Air Ambulance Limited's commitment to provide equal opportunities in employment and we will not unlawfully discriminate against job applicants, employees of the Company, volunteers, workers or contract workers on the grounds of their age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, race (which includes colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation (unless, as in the case of pilots or fire crew physical fitness is essential to the performance of their duties).

Do you have an IT / Engineer / Science / Mathematic / Finance diploma and a genuine passion for technology and top-notch communication skills?
At MThree we help you turn your degree into a career in financial markets – and we’re on the hunt for tomorrow's top production support analysts.

Our 24-month graduate programme pairs people just like you with our global banking clients, fast-tracking your development and turning your degree into a career.
Beginning with 4-8 weeks of intensive, market leading training and career coaching by industry recognised subject matter experts at our London Canary Wharf Training Academy, the MThree Alumni Programme gives you everything you need to kick start a career in technology.

Modern banking trends

Production support is a vital role in enterprise technology. Working with a global team, you’ll help support systems including algorithmic trading engines and regulatory reporting by:
Monitoring system health
Resolving incidents
Investigating past incidents
Managing the release process for new versions of software
Automating and enhancing workflows
Working closely with business stakeholders to resolve issues with technical systems and applications. Work is tracked using ‘tickets’.

About MThree Alumni
MThree arms global banks and enterprises with the skills and expertise they need to meet their most complex business and technology challenges.
Since 2010, we’ve helped organisations deliver key technology projects with expert consultancy across risk and compliance, application support and software development, vendor products and cyber and information security.
This is underpinned by our 24-month Alumni Graduate Programme, which bridges the gap between academic life and corporate culture by helping talented graduates build on formal qualifications with technology training and career coaching that prepares them for a fast-paced start to their career with our client base.
Today, with over 500 consultants deployed on client sites globally and presence in London, New York, Paris, Singapore, Johannesburg, Montreal and Hong Kong, we’re a trusted partner to global organisations committed to upscaling their tech teams and deliver innovative technology services.

MThree supports graduate development at all levels irrespective of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation. MThree is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and runs regular diversity events and initiatives to attract the best graduate talent spanning all backgrounds.

MThree arms global banks and enterprises with the skills and expertise they need to meet their most complex business and technology challenges.
Since 2010, we’ve helped organisations deliver key technology projects with expert consultancy across risk and compliance, application support and software development, vendor products and cyber and information security.
This is underpinned by our 24-month Alumni Graduate Programme, which bridges the gap between academic life and corporate culture by helping talented graduates build on formal qualifications with technology training and career coaching that prepares them for a fast-paced start to their career with our client base.
Today, with over 500 consultants deployed on client sites globally and presence in London, New York, Paris, Singapore, Johannesburg, Montreal and Hong Kong, we’re a trusted partner to global organisations committed to upscaling their tech teams and deliver innovative technology services.

MThree supports graduate development at all levels irrespective of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation. MThree is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and runs regular diversity events and initiatives to attract the best graduate talent spanning all backgrounds.

Job Title: Risk Business Systems and Projects - Analyst (6 Month FTC)
Job Description:
Role Summary -- 6 MONTH FTC

Responsible for the successful implementation and delivery of strategic projects that are vital for the Chief Risk Office.

Accountabilities

• Working closely with Risk Managers and Risk Controllers to ensure smooth delivery of complex projects and workstreams. Ensure the highest level of data quality and integrity which feeds the risk systems.

• Delivering on allocated projects and system development items as well as proactively engaging on risk or control improvement ideas with the wider team.

• Articulate and present commercial effectiveness of requirement proposals within a project or initiative.

• Face off to one or many business areas and stakeholders understanding high level requirements and challenging where necessary.

• Work independently to elicit, validate and document systems requirements act as a key point of contact for the risk system development teams.

• Participation in the design process coordinated by the Risk Management team, participate in systems functionality approval and ensure the functionality/benefits envisaged are delivered.

• Support the Testing Strategy and input into the coverage of Test scenarios and conditions ensuring all requirements in scope are tested.

• Experience of the risk system development lifecycle, the roles and responsibilities on large projects and the motivations of the various stakeholders involved

The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time

Skills and Experience Required

• A strong quantitative background gained in education and/ or in a professional setting with particular focus on options pricing & hedging as well as exposure to risk management concepts.

• Risk domain and clearing business knowledge E.g. Initial/Variation Margin, Position Limits, Probability and Loss Given Default, VaR, Stress Testing & option greeks and concepts

• A good understanding of financial markets gained in a Brokerage or Banking institution from either the Risk Management or Trading sides. Experience of risk managing Exchange Traded Futures & Options.

• Capable of exposure regression analysis and explaining differences between production systems and UAT. Breakdown of variables driving the differences.

• University graduate in Finance, computer science or numerate related disciplines

• Experience in documenting requirements, validating functional specifications, drafting testing approach plans and user acceptance test cases

• Understanding of how projects are delivered, including project lifecycle. Ability to understand and document processes using data flow diagrams

• Experience in risk system development cycles and working with Risk Technology departments.

• Strong ability to understand and use complex systems and take a logical and constructive approach to investigating and communicating system problems

• Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships across all areas of the firm and communicate effectively across all levels.

• Strong Microsoft Office skills, high level VBA skills within Excel

We have been awarded Feefo's top rating, the Trusted Merchant Gold Award, for our outstanding customer service. We will give you all the expertise and support so you can be outstanding in what you do.

At Neilson we do more, we try harder, we go further. We believe in investing in our people and using the latest technology to give us a competitive edge in our journey to becoming the leading global provider in direct life insurance.
Join our team to become a Neilsoner, and we will help you strive for excellence and be the best in everything that you do.

Job Description:
See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!


Who we are


At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day.

Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.


The role


As a Trading Support Analyst your primary objective will be to provide Tier 2 support for Iress trading products and initiatives primarily across order routing, connectivity and trading solutions. You will be accountable for seeking a successful outcome on behalf of the trading client, completing and managing tactical processes and initiatives required to resolve issues that are raised.


What you will be doing
As a Support Analyst, you will diagnose and troubleshoot trading related issues on behalf of clients either in UAT or production.
For issues that require additional support, you will triage and escalate to one of a number of teams either in the UK or abroad seeking further information to resolve the clients' issue
You will document the required changes and liaise with the relevant product and development teams seeking swift resolution via a hot fix process.
Diagnose and troubleshoot complex trading related issues reported by clients.
Provide analysis towards creating development items relating to client issues or new functionality required by clients.

What you will need
Prior experience with Iress products and solutions is not essential but would be desirable
Similarly, if you have any experience with any order management and trading systems this would be an advantage
An understanding of listed financial markets and products
You will have the ability to run SQL queries and scripts
Ability to prioritise, delegate, respond to and follow-up issues in a timely and appropriate manner
Knowledge of FIX protocol would be highly beneficial

Why work with us
Competitive remuneration
Global opportunities
Casual dress, flexible work policy
Access to learning and development programs
Health Benefits including Private Medical Insurance

3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives
Global 36-hour hackathon

25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays
Profit Share Plan
Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work

Job Description:
Introduction to your Job
Gather & document requirements using tools like interviews, workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, etc.
Define product vision, road map, and growth opportunities, outlining the vision and direction for the product offering
Develop appropriately detailed specifications for product features from business requirements
Prioritize features based on the overall strategy & business objectives and lead product release plan creation
Create conceptual prototypes and hold client walkthroughs & demos
Analyze the practicality of development requirements of new systems and upgradations to existing systems
Participate in user acceptance testing
Ideally, you should have:
2+ years of experience in a similar role for web/mobile projects

Application Support Analyst Job
EV Cargo Technology
Permanent
Full Time
Gerrards Cross
£30,000
Here at EV Cargo Technology, we are proud that some of the biggest names in retail trust our products to give them the control, visibility and intelligence they need to keep goods flowing across the world and into stores. As an Application Support Analyst, you will be the first person they contact and put their trust in when they need our help.
Naturally, you will you love getting your hands dirty in code (SQL mostly, perhaps with a smattering of C#) to find answers and help the customer within SLA. Equally, you will be keen to work closely alongside the customer, understand their world, and help them get the best out of the product. You’ll have a proactive outlook, thinking about how we can make things run more smoothly for our customers. And as we transition our products to new technologies, you’ll relish the chance to learn new technical skills.
Application Support at EV Cargo Technology is the front line of engaging with our users. We do this through a mixture of proactive measures – such as actively monitoring system performance and attending regular service reviews to better understand our customers’ needs – as well as through more traditional, reactive approaches, providing a professional, timely and reliable service to customers when they need our help.
The main objectives of the team are:
Supporting and maintaining software products for EV Cargo
Supporting and maintaining software products for non-EV Cargo retail customers
Increasing lifetime customer value through proactive support.
Roles & Responsibilities
The following reflects EV Cargo Technology’s definition of essential deliverables and activities for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. EV Cargo Technology may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons:
Provide 2nd Line support to EV Cargo Technology customers that adds further value to the customer relationship and helps build trust and confidence with the customer.
Respond to, rectify and resolve incidents within specified SLA targets, which indicates the support team are offering an efficient service at all times.
Diagnosis and resolution of application support incidents and problems in a range of customer critical software applications.
Deployment of application enhancements where appropriate and within scope/support remit.
Test EV Cargo Technology software components to ensure that they meet the needs of customers and are functioning as intended.
Provide configuration assistance to customers and partners building EV Cargo Technology-based solutions.
Systems management and monitoring of back-office server processes in order to proactively identify issues before they occur.
Person Specification
Skills
Knowledge of SQL (preferably Microsoft SQL Server).
Ability to solve problems using logic, analysis and past experiences, with a consideration of old and new solutions.
Demonstrates excellent listening skills, considering other people’s views and responding appropriately.
Communicates ideas and solutions clearly and concisely in both verbal and written dialogue, relaying complex information simply with the ability to tailor style where needed.
Can operate in ambiguous situations with the ability to suggest a plan of action and ask the right questions when limited information is available.
Fluency in English.
Knowledge
Has knowledge of what makes good customer service.
An appreciation for working to targets and deadlines in the form of SLAs.
An interest in strengthening SQL skills and learning new skills, e.g. C# and Azure.
Able to display commercial awareness and understand the impact of solutions.
Behaviours
Have a strong customer-centred ethic with a focus on improving customer experience and taking pride in customer satisfaction.
Considers impact on wider business when problem-solving, searching for mutually advantageous solutions.
Builds professional relationships based on trust and professional credibility, fulfilling promises and commitments consistently.
Demonstrates a motivated attitude towards achieving commitments with the ability to offer a definition of what success looks like in the role.
Keen to learn and grow, enjoying the challenge of new and unfamiliar tasks.
Desirable
Applied knowledge of SAAS applications in a global environment.
Knowledge of ITIL concepts and best practices.
Knowledge of C#.
Knowledge of Azure.
Has theoretical understanding of retail industry.
Flexibility to work non-scheduled hours.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: Up to £30,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Yes, temporarily due to COVID-19

We are recruiting for additional Business Analysts to join new agile development teams working for a Central Government customer. The programme of work is very high profile, and is focussed on developing a new digital platform of services to help keep the UK border secure. Due to Covid-19, these roles will initially be undertaken from home, but once lockdown is lifted, it is expected that there will be regular travel to client site in Croydon.

On this programme of work, the role of the Business Analysts is to work closely with the client to investigate business situations, and then identify and evaluate options for improvements to systems and operations. The business analyst should apply appropriate techniques (requirements management, process improvement, functional analysis, etc) to define, manage and support implementation of effective solutions to business issues.

Skills required:
Ability to perform stakeholder analysis, mapping influence, impact and commitment of each stakeholder
Leads the client engagement for specific areas of work
Take ownership of one or more areas of work including planning, identifying risks and regular reports to the project manager
Ability to plan and facilitate effective workshops
Applies Applied Intelligence standard approaches on client engagements with assistance / direction, and takes the lead in specific areas
Investigates operational requirements, problems, and opportunities, seeking effective business solutions through improvements in automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes
Effectively plan and manage the requirements process from capture through to change control
Assists in the analysis of stakeholder objectives, and the underlying issues arising from investigations into business requirements and problems, and identifies options for consideration
Identifies potential benefits, and available options for consideration
Works with clients/users in defining acceptance tests
Requirements Management:
Facilitates scoping and business priority-setting for change initiatives of medium size and complexity
Selects appropriate techniques for the elicitation of detailed requirements taking into account the nature of the required changes, established practice and the characteristics and culture of those providing the requirements
Discovers and analyses requirements for fitness for purpose as well as adherence to business objectives and consistency, challenging positively as appropriate
Obtains formal agreement by stakeholders and recipients to scope and requirements and establishes a base-line on which delivery of a solution can commence
Manages requests for and the application of changes to baselined requirements
Identifies the impact on business requirements of interim (e.g. migration) scenarios as well as the required end position
Drives the requirements elicitation process where necessary, identifying what stakeholder input is required
Takes responsibility for the investigation and application of changes to programme scope.
Assesses, analyses, develops, documents and implements changes based on requests for change
You must already hold Security Clearance (SC) to be considered for this role.

About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence

We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals.

Division overview: Capabilities

At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Applied Intelligence, containing our Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make us a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working.

Our values are at the heart of everything we do. We are looking for people who also believe in these drivers as we work together to achieve success for both our colleagues and our clients alike. As a business we believe we are stronger together. We share knowledge, ask for help and empower each other to achieve more collectively. We are open minded and value everyone’s contribution, embracing our differences and fostering a culture of trust and inclusion. We look for people who adapt quickly to change, finding smart ways to deliver the best results and remain one step ahead. Does that sound like you?

What we offer

Blick Rothenberg offers nurturing and collaborative working culture that is caring and protecting of our people alongside an environment where they can develop and flourish. In addition to a competitive remuneration package, we offer a range of flexible benefits and flexible hours of work. There are also opportunities to become involved in collaborative working groups to help shape our strategy.

Job Description

As an IT Support Analyst, you will provide first line support, answering phone calls and monitoring help desk system, dealing with basic issues and escalating other calls to the appropriate person. Your other key duties include setting up new starters and following leavers procedures and installing Windows 10 and Office 365 on machines from an image and testing.

Blick Rothenberg and Azets

Blick Rothenberg is part of Azets, an international business services group supporting entrepreneurial businesses, their owners and managers in achieving long term, sustainable success through the provision of critical business support and advisory services.

This allows Blick Rothenberg to continue to deliver the high quality, partner-led service we have always provided, but with greater resource and the additional coverage that being part of a larger organisation provides.

Requirements

You are not expected to have experience in every application; however, a solid understanding of Microsoft technologies along with a desire and motivation to quickly learn new skills and have a logical thinking is essential. Some basic knowledge of coding/scripting is beneficial. Personal coaching will also be available as your journey continues beyond formal qualifications tailored to your own individual aspirations.

Benefits
25 days annual leave
Contributory pension scheme – the company pays in 5% of your salary if you pay in 2%, increasing after five years to 8.5% if you pay 3.5%
Life Assurance (x4 pensionable salary)
Payment of one professional subscription per annum
Season ticket loan up to a maximum of £6,000
Flexible holiday – where you can buy or sell up to 5 days per annum
Flexible hours of work (upon completion of probation period)
Childcare voucher scheme
Client referral scheme
Colleague referral bonus
Cycle to work scheme
Eyecare vouchers

ABOUT Relief International.

Relief International (RI) is a leading nonprofit organization working in 16 countries to relieve poverty, ensure well-being and advance dignity. We specialize in fragile settings, responding to natural disasters, humanitarian crises and chronic poverty.

Relief International combines humanitarian and development approaches to provide immediate services while laying the groundwork for long-term impact. Our signature approach — which we call the RI Way—emphasizes local participation, an integration of services, strategic partnerships and a focus on civic skills. In this way, we empower communities to find, design and implement the solutions that work best for them.

RI includes the four corporate members of the RI Alliance: RI-US, RI-UK, MRCA/RI-France and RI-Europe. Under our alliance agreement, we operate as a single, shared management structure.

Position Summary.

The ERP (NetSuite) Analyst provides data management and end-user support for an organization-wide ERP system and related programs. Supporting staff, end-users, and the Financial Systems Director on data imports, user assistance, training, and software/configuration changes.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
Manage all field requests for support from end users and resolve or escalate appropriately and timely.
Work with staff of organizational units to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, and understand specific requirements such as forms of data input, how data will be summarized and used, formats for reports, etc.
Work with technical resources to develop, test, and document software in order to implement and maintain an operational system.
Coordinate and collaborate with functional users and IT/Finance staff to find solutions to problems identified in testing, ensure that requirements documentation is easily understood, and that proper testing of all systems functionality is completed.
Prepare workflow charts and diagrams to specify in detail business process supported by enterprise systems.
Ensure pertinent system, user guide, and training documentation are complete, current, and stored appropriately
Performs other information technology and business analysis duties as required to support assigned enterprise systems.
Uphold and promote RI’s commitment to ensuring the safeguarding and safety of the vulnerable communities we serve.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS

This position will require a demonstrated ability to achieve results in a demanding and fast paced environment.
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business/operations analysis, MIS, Accounting or a related field
Previous experience in related positions or equivalent work and education experience will be considered
Advanced Excel and spreadsheet skills
Familiarity with ERP systems, specifically NetSuite, is highly desired
Comfort with basic principles of accounting
Strong communication skills in English including speaking, reading and writing
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, deadlines, tasks efficiently
Excellent time management skills and resourcefulness with strong attention to detail
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Ability to think critically and creatively
Excellent interpersonal skills, including patience, diplomacy, willingness to listen and respect for colleagues.
Ability to work strategically and practically across multi-cultural teams
Must be capable of working both individually and as part of a team.
RI Values:

We uphold the Humanitarian Principles: humanity, neutrality, impartiality and operational independence. We affirmatively engage the most vulnerable communities.

We value:
Inclusiveness
Transparency and accountability
Agility and innovation
Collaboration
Sustainability
How to apply.
To apply for this post, click on the “Apply” button in the job advert page
You will be asked to upload a CV and Cover Letter. The cover letter should be no more than 2 pages long and explain why you are interested in this post with Relief International and how your skills and experience make you a good fit.
Closing date. Please apply immediately we will be reviewing applicants on a rolling basis, therefore may withdraw the position for the job board closing date.

Please apply by uploading your cover letter and up-to-date CV on our website.

Due to limited resources, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Note to external agencies, we will not be accepting CVs from third parties.

Relief International is committed to protecting our staff and the communities we work with from abuse and harm including sexual exploitation, sexual abuse and sexual harassment.

All staff are expected to abide by our Code of Conduct.

Recruitment to all roles in Relief International include a criminal records self-declaration, references and other pre-employment checks, which may include police and qualifications checks.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Relief International is committed to diversity and gender equality, we strongly encourage applicants from the global south and female candidates to apply.

Across the globe, Small World help keep family and friends closer together with a low-cost, secure and easy way to transfer money abroad. Since 2005, we are one of the few brands that continue to shine brightly through the world’s greatest challenges.
Represented in 20+ countries and with over 40 languages spoken within our teams, Small World offers the unique opportunity to be part of a truly global and multicultural family!
Context
Increasing customer loyalty is at the heart of the future success of Small World. As we look to scale our business over the next 5 years, there is a need to create even stronger relationships with our customers, and leverage our insight on our growing global customer base.
This team deliver highly personalised CRM campaigns, analysis and reporting with helps refine customer targeting approach and allows stakeholders to compete in the market.
The business is currently implementing a new off the shelf CRM tool (Blue Venn) which will form the backbone of our future segmentation and loyalty needs. Operating across four channels, this is a unique opportunity to develop a more sophisticated and professional customer operating model by driving increased levels of loyalty through segmentation and customer insight.
Role Remit
You will support the CRM Manager and will focus on the planning, campaign execution, and analysis of CRM programmes as well as consumer insights.
The CRM Analyst role is key in developing our understanding of online and offline customer behaviour patterns and to measure the effectiveness of marketing activities.
You'll focus on the sharing of CRM data, consumer insights, trends, and best practices with the wider business to drive innovative, effective, consumer-inspired strategies.
You will support CRM activities and develop relevant results, reports & dashboards which leads to insights on customer lifetime values across all channels. This is an incredible opportunity to take our offering to the next level, making a difference by helping CRM and Marketing teams.
You'll be joining a team passionate about managing the delivery of the CRM campaign and insight strategy, working with agencies to manage the campaign lifecycle process, deliver customer insight and reporting to shape strategic decisions.
What are we looking for?
Degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or related field
1-3 years in Consumer Analytics and Insights (with a proven track record of driving actionable insights)
Experience in a commercial role with a focus on customer insight, customer loyalty, and marketing data for multiple regions.
Using insights to help businesses better understand the customer lifecycle and how they can use insights to optimise their marketing focus.
Experience of creating performance and operational dashboards and reports
Experience in planning and managing projects involving multiple stakeholders from across the organisation
Technically adept, with experience using MS Office suite and CRM applications.
Worked with a leading CRM system e.g. salesforce, adobe, MS CRM or Blue Venn.
Experience with Reporting tools (such as Tableau, Google Analytics) required.
Excellent numerical and analytical skills combined with solid people skills.
Good understanding of online and in-store CRM system.
Have a passion for great customer service.
Highly organised with excellent attention to detail.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Casual dress
Flexible schedule
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work remotely:
Yes, always

Job Description:
What's the role about?

As part of our IT department, you'll be joining our Business Applications team who are responsible for maintaining and supporting a range of business applications from small, niche and bespoke solutions to large cross-function applications such as Retail/Merchandising/Reporting systems, as well as supporting and maintaining the integrations between such applications.

Who you are
Experience of working in retail with an understanding of a multi-channel business
Experience working in an IT business application support function
You'll have a background in technology
Knowledge of PCs and Microsoft applications
Previous exposure of retail POS, ERP, Digital as well as Merchandising and Warehouse solutions
Highly organised with strong time management skills
Attention to detail and strong communication skills- both verbal and written
What you'll be doing
Provide daily application support ensuring that application behaviour, integration and data integrity are current and correct
Provide reactive multi-level application support ensuring that appropriate support and resources are available to respond to issues in the timescales required by the business
Develop strong working knowledge of all business application functions, associated interfaces and task schedules
Ensure application, integration and support documentation is current and correct and available to all appropriate functions
Manage the end to end lifecycle of assigned tickets within the helpdesk
Participate in ad-hoc support operations as needed, including on site store openings, relocations, closures and other projects
Assist in the acceptance of new business applications into the support function, working with project teams to ensure requirements and criteria are defined and appropriate testing is undertaken
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the overall IT function by identifying what can be improved upon and promoting efficiencies
What we'll do for you
Provide you with a competitive salary
Company pension

Plus many more

Overview:
Lead point of contact for management accounts system (SAP BPC) to support preparation of timely and relevant financial information at a Group Level. This includes acting as a key interface with local users who are submitting management reporting data to the system in line with the Company’s process and timelines
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the development of SAP BPC and associated processes to maximise its full potential and ensure it is fit for purpose for users. Work with key Stakeholders (including IT) to continue to develop, test and deploy enhanced reporting capabilities
Supporting the successful integration of new acquisitions from a reporting, systems and processes perspective
Coordination of monthly and quarterly SOX related tasks for Group FP&A and acting as systems administrator for key FP&A users
Support FP&A Manager with ad hoc analysis as needed
Planning and Forecasting
Oversight for submission of financial forecast (quarterly and annually) into SAP BPC ensuring integrity and completeness of information is assured
Review submissions for accuracy and proactively work with users to address anomalies in the submission where noted helping to ensure timeliness are met
Ensure management accounts system successfully absorb newly acquired entities
Ensure forecast is complete and any overlays are tracked and captured
Monthly/Annual Reporting
Responsible for running month end process to consolidate country management accounts in preparation for Senior Management presentations
Support variance analysis to understand performance
Reconcile management reports to Financial Accounts
Coordination for monthly SOX related tasks
Other
Identify opportunities for process improvements via automation and standardisation and support or manage the implementation of any changes
Ad-hoc queries from business Stakeholders
Coordinate training and support on BPC
Qualifications:
Essential
A graduate, qualified Accountant
BPC experience (or similar system) including building & maintaining reports and process flows
Previous FP&A experience
Consolidation and reporting experience on systems such as SAP BPC
Able to work under time pressure and able to manage multiple priorities
Excellent planning and organisational skills
Strong excel skills and a wider interest in systems
Strong debugging and problem solving skills
Knowledge of commercial, financial and operational reporting
Motivated self-starter - able to identify improvement ideas (challenge the status quo) and follow up on delivering these
The ability to communicate with people at all levels in both financial and non-financial management, distilling detailed information down into key clear messages
A persuasive manner and the ability to exert influence to drive impact across the function
Ability to build relationships across multiple user sites
Desirable
Previous FMCG experience
SOX or other control environment experience
SAP ECC (FI–CO) experience or similar
Basic modelling skills

Job Description:
Western Sussex Hospitals is a leading acute hospital trust, with rewarding career opportunities for caring, committed and innovative people, who wish to be valued for their work and empowered to improve the services we provide. Here are few reasons to join us:
Outstanding – we are the first acute hospital trust to have received the health watchdog’s highest rating in all key inspection areas. CQC October 2019
Top 10 – Western Sussex Hospitals is one the best hospital trusts to work for, according to the NHS Staff Survey, and among the top ten trusts in England where staff are most likely to recommend the care their colleagues provide. (NHS Staff Survey 2018)
Leading organisation – Western Sussex Hospitals is led by NHS Chief Executive of the Year Dame Marianne Griffiths (HSJ Awards 2016 | No.1 HSJ Top CEO 2018 & 2019) and is renowned for outstanding care, excellent staff engagement, innovation and learning.
Location – our hospitals in Chichester, Worthing and Shoreham-by-Sea are on the beautiful Sussex coast, between the beach and South Downs National Park. West Sussex has wonderful countryside, picturesque villages, vibrant towns, excellent schools and cultural amenities, as well as quick transport links to Brighton, London and beyond.
More about us - Western Sussex is an acute trust with three hospitals; Worthing Hospital and St Richard’s in Chichester provide emergency, inpatient and outpatient care; and Southlands in Shoreham-by-Sea provides outpatient care and day surgery. Since April 2017, the senior leadership team has also managed neighbouring trust Brighton and Sussex University Hospitals.
Patient First - in 2015 the trust’s Patient First programme was launched to empower colleagues to make lasting changes that benefit patients and to ensure we continue to improve patient care with lean management best practice at every level of the trust. Improvement huddles are just one example of extensive and ongoing cultural change that makes Western Sussex an exciting place to work.
To assist in providing an effective, accurate, timely and consistent systems configuration, error identification and correction advice service to the WSHT and other Users (local NHS Trusts, Hospice). Liaising with all levels of staff to ensure appropriate system requirements and standards are followed.
We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, methodical, has an eye for detail and can work to tight schedules.

For further details / informal visits contact:
NameJulie LeeJob titleSenior IT Applications SupervisorEmail addressjulie.lee30@nhs.netTelephone number07825145882



IMPORTANT
If we receive a high volume of applications, we may close adverts prior to the published closing date. Therefore, we advise you to complete and submit your application as soon as possible.
Candidates shortlisted for interview will be informed via the email address registered with NHS Jobs.
The Trust is a Disability Confident Employer. All applicants who have a disability can opt to be considered under the guaranteed interview scheme which means that providing they meet the minimum essential criteria for the post, they will be offered an interview.
Applications from candidates requiring Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcomed and will be considered alongside all other applications. It is unlikely that the Trust will be able to satisfy the Resident Labour Market Test where there is a suitably qualified and skilled EU/EEA candidate available for work and in these circumstances, an overseas candidate will not be offered the post. A self-assessment for the likelihood of obtaining a Certificate of Sponsorship for the post applied for is available on the UKBA website.
PRIVACY NOTICE
All applications submitted via NHS Jobs will be imported into Trac, the applicant management/recruitment system used by Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust. All subsequent information regarding your application will be generated from apps.trac.jobs. You will not be able to track your application or receive messages through the NHS Jobs website. We will be unable to respond to any messages sent to the Trust via the NHS Jobs website. If you are successful in being offered a position at the Trust, your information will be transferred into the national NHS Electronic Staff Record database and a local file will be created and retained on site at the Trust. For further information about how we use your data, please refer to our privacy notice.

Job Description:
Pathology Systems Applications Analyst
Berkshire and Surrey Pathology Services (BSPS) is a joint venture between Ashford and St. Peter’s Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust, Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust and the Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust delivering pathology services to both acute and primary care patients across the network area. Currently the team is split across 3 sites, Frimley Park, Wexham Park and the Royal Berkshire Hospital and you may be asked to work at any of the sites so that services can be maintained.
The Pathology IT department is a highly professional and dedicated team with a strong emphasis on ongoing training and career development. We need a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to help us support our clinical colleagues with their IT requirements. We believe in investing in our staff and understand that staff satisfaction is inextricably linked to patient satisfaction. We also believe that it is important that we recruit staff who subscribe to our values as they are at the heart of everything we do. These are committed to excellence, working together and facing the future. The values reflect the commitment we make to the people who use our services and to each other.
As the Trusts are committed to 24/7 working so Pathology IT moving forward will need to support this and the needs of the clinical staff across all the Trusts..
The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate an understanding of IT System administration with good interpersonal skills and the ability to work as part of a team or to join the project teams when required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential, as dealing with a wide range of clinical staff and associated professionals is a significant aspect of this role.
The successful candidate will be expected to support the Pathology IT Senior team and other colleagues as we move forward in the growth of BSPS.
For further details / informal visits contact:
Lesley Adams
BSPS IT Manager
Email addresslesley.adams8@nhs.net



There’s never been a more exciting time to build your career at Frimley Health, one of the country’s largest and most respected hospital trusts. We have three main hospitals: Frimley Park in Frimley near Camberley, Heatherwood in Ascot and Wexham Park near Slough.
As well as delivering excellent general hospital services to local people, we provide specialist heart attack, vascular, stroke, spinal, cystic fibrosis and plastic surgery services across a much wider area. We also run outpatient clinics and diagnostic services from Aldershot, Farnham, Fleet, Windsor, Maidenhead, Bracknell and Chalfont St Peter.
Recently we have invested £150m in new facilities to create the best environments for our patients and staff. Our projects include new state-of-the-art Emergency Assessment Centre at Wexham Park and a newly planned care hospital in Ascot.
Our three core values, and the behaviours that support them, guide everything we do and set out what we expect of our staff in the way they treat patients, visitors, service users and each other. So whether you use our services or are just visiting you can expect us to be Committed to Excellence, Working Together and Facing the Future.
If you have a passion for clinical excellence, patient care and your own career development, you’ll feel at home at Frimley Health. Whether you want to broaden your expertise, strengthen your skills or make the move into management. It’s one of the reasons our staff consistently rate us among the best places to work in the NHS.

Technical Analyst
Location: Bournemouth

Salary: £Competitive + Bonus + Benefits

Closing Date: Friday 27 November 2020

Division: IT
Vitality is an award winning, dynamic and vibrant financial services provider, with a ground-breaking vision for the future, where individuals are enabled to succeed and are rewarded and recognised for their contribution to our business. We’re the UK insurer and investment provider that rewards people for positive lifestyle choices. With 1.25m+ UK members and more than 25m globally, we’re out to make the world a healthier, happier place. This applies as much to our people as it does to our members.

Our CORE PURPOSE is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. From people to products and processes, we aspire to deliver on our purpose in everything we do.

Our VISION is to be the BEST financial services provider in the UK

We are looking for talented individuals who are committed to living our values and delivering an award winning service to our customers.

Overall Job Purpose

The Technical Analyst is responsible for the production of Analysis artefacts, utilising a range of techniques and methods to elicit requirements, verify, and trace delivery through the lifecycle of a project. The Technical Analyst will work on highly complex projects, often supporting dependency requirements across a range of delivery teams. The Technical Analyst will be required to implement and maintain procedural and management documentation, included but not limited to technical procedures, capacity and technical standard documentation. The Technical Analyst will be required from time to time to analyse and document system configuration and work with process analysts to map out support processes.

Accountabilities
Responsible for the delivery of analysis artefacts (using either Waterfall or Agile methodology) through any channel.
Analyse and create system technical documentation, system procedural documentation and technology standards
Adheres to agreed Change Management protocols & processes
Proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyses information, functional requirements and technical impact
Documents the system requirements and process flows (as-is and to-be) in the agreed format. Identifies organisational impact of proposed change initiatives
Works with Enterprise and Solution Architects to ensure designs meet function and no functional requirements
Raises Project risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies to the Project Manager / Portfolio in a timely manner, offering mitigating actions and taking ownership of individual items where appropriate
Estimates deliverables applicable to self and/or others robustly and realistically for planning purposes
Responsible for ensuring the traceability of requirements to solutions at a Project / initiative level and for any delegated assignments (i.e. to a Trainee BA)
Skills Required

Qualifications

Essential
Has experience working in Agile, Small Change & Strategic Project environments
Expert in MS Visio
Expert in Jira
Desirable
Experience working in the UK Financial Services industry is desirable but not essential
Experience
Has a close link to wider industry practices
Has coached others in the proficient use of 'as is' & 'to be' process models using BPMN 2.0 standards
Experience working within a complex matrix management environment
Has coached others in the proficient use of structured requirements outputs, including Use Cases, Business Rules, Business Requirements (Functional & Non-Functional), traceability matrices, User Stories & Epic Definition
Working for Vitality, you'll experience an exciting mix of creativity and innovation, within a framework of challenging objectives and a passion for delivering the best. We think work should be fun and sociable, and we want our people to get the most out of every day. Our people are chosen for their skills, knowledge, enthusiasm and attitude but above all, their belief that anything can be achieved.

As well as a highly competitive pay package, you’ll enjoy: complimentary breakfasts; regular onsite physical and mental wellness workshops; on-site health checks; annual flu jabs and access to our full range of partners and rewards. It’s what we call offering shared value, because a healthy, happy team is good for us, good for our members and good for you.

Job Description


Brand: Reading Scientific Services

Reading Scientific Services Ltd (RSSL) is a cutting-edge Contract Research Organisation (CRO), providing research, analysis and consultancy to the food and pharmaceutical sectors. Whether we are creating new products, validating medicines or solving investigations, we take pride in being a leader in our field, serving clients from across 60 countries.

In 2019, we’ve been recognised as Enlightened Employer, Women in Business and Thames Valley Tech finalists.

Enriched by our parent company Mondelēz International, our diverse team includes 23 nationalities from 300 members, creating a family feel as we strive towards our mission of “Science Enhancing Lives”.

About the team

Pharmaceutical Wet Chemistry is a pivotal team in RSSL: with exponentially increasing client demand, it’s our biggest area of expansion growing 30% from September 2018 to September 2019. Joining this team will allow you to do truly vital work analysing medicines so they can reach patients that need them. You’ll have opportunity to gain new technical and leadership skills as the laboratory continues going from strength to strength.

Purpose of the role

A Pharmaceutical Analyst executes hands-on wet chemistry analyses such as UV, FTIR, titrations and gravimetric techniques.

You’ll ensure routine and complex pharmaceutical projects are performed promptly and to GMP standards, performing practical bench-work and data checking for routine analyses of pharmaceutical raw materials using wet chemistry techniques in accordance with pharmacopoeia or client methods. As required you’ll work with clients to provide technical input into project discussions.

Responsibilities

Technical
Perform routine analysis using wet chemistry techniques
Provide technical direction to the business.
Supervise staff in routine activities and methods.
Ensure effective organisation, integrity of analytical data and provision of results.
Perform data checking and provide interpretation of results for routine testing.
What you will bring

Essential
Experience of using wet chemistry techniques in any setting (eg in academia or as a technician).
Chemistry (or related) degree or equivalent laboratory experience.
Communication skills to develop good working relationships with internal and external clients.
English fluency.
Preferred
Pharmaceutical industry knowledge.
Knowledge GMP systems.

Joining this team will allow you to do truly vital work analysing medicines so they can reach patients that need them. You’ll have opportunity to gain new technical and leadership skills as the laboratory continues going from strength to strength.

Job Title: Systems Business Analyst (12 Month Fixed-Term Contract)
Job Description:
Systems Business Analyst (12 Month Fixed-Term Contract) (m/f/d)
This role is offered as a 12 month fixed-term contract.
The role is based in the Great Lakes UK (SE) Branch.

Location
London , United Kingdom
We are looking for a System's Business Analyst to join our team to create a new data model and inter-related processes to support the Solvency II (SII) Pillar Three Quantitative reporting requirements.
This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a high level of experience in data migration and mapping as well as solvency technical expertise.
Opening Date for Applications: 28th October 2020
Closing Date for Applications: 25th November 2020
We recommend you apply for the role as soon as possible in case the role is closed early.
Your job
As a System's Business Analyst, you'll use related IT systems to create a new data model and inter-related processes to support the SII Pillar Three Quantitative reporting requirements (QRT’s for our UK entity impacted by Brexit). This will initially be based on a similar existing system reporting to the Germany regulator, then by mapping the associated changes required to satisfy the future state, you will be required to support the design, testing and implement this solution in an agile environment and assist the team to maintain change control. These improvements will improve business efficiency and productivity.
You'll need a high level of experience in data migration and mapping as well as solvency technical expertise within an insurance background.
Your role is to liaise between internal business stakeholders, including programmers developers and business stakeholders and developers, throughout the development process.
Your profile
Skillset & Experience
Essential
Very good data manipulating/transforming skills with ability to transform data from various sources into one agreed format (Excel, SQL)
Analyse/understand existing IT systems and business models with a view to implement changes relating to English regulators requirements for SII QRT’s’
Design and develop systems requirements for Third county branch reporting post Brexit
Work with business to enable the mapping/changing of source data needed to feed chart of accounts which in turn will feed the QRT’s
Implement, configure and test end to end solutions for Solo/Group QRT’s
Utilise best practice approach in developing the business change lifecycle relating to Solvency regulatory reporting
Assist with analysing existing IT systems, specify future state requirements and action agreed business cases.
Map and document interfaces between feeder and consolidation systems
Understand full software development lifecycles in an agile environment
Translate mapping requirements into designed specifications and test back to highly specified project briefs
Identify options for potential systems solutions, assessing them for both technical and business improvements
Work closely with accountants, actuaries, systems developers a variety of end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction
Chasing ,transforming, cleansing and consolidating SII data received from agents to satisfy Claims and Commissions related QRT’s
Plan and work flexibly to deadlines to support team on change control and system updates
Desirable
SAP ECON Consolidation configuration
Sound understanding links between various categories of Solvency II Pillar 3 QRT’s Balance Sheet, Capital Requirements, Long Term Guaranteed, Own Funds ,Risk concentration etc.
Investigating validation errors resulting from regulatory submissions
Good understanding of the solvency II balance sheet format and related categories feeding into it.
Basic knowledge of Capital requirements and Risk Margin
Any knowledge of DFEnS (digital front end systems) using SQL and JAVA would be a bonus
Understanding of the annotated templates published by EIOPA and the granular detail required to how complete them and understand the validations between them.
About us
The salary for this role is competitive. We benchmark all our salaries in accordance with the latest external market data to ensure employees are paid fairly. A gender pay gap audit is conducted and salaries are reviewed on an annual basis and we will appropriately adjust the salary to match your skills and experience, whilst ensuring we seek to pay the industry median.
We offer a generous, comprehensive and flexible benefits package to suit your lifestyle in addition to the basic salary. This includes a highly competitive non-contributory pension, exceptional life cover, 25 days’ holiday (with the ability to buy more), Aviva private medical coverage, and a contribution towards gym membership.
Should you have any queries regarding this role please contact:

Charlotte Parker

People & Talent Specialist

ChParker@munichre.com

Apply now! Apply for this Job!

We are recruiting for additional Business Analysts to join new agile development teams working for a Central Government customer. The programme of work is very high profile, and is focussed on developing a new digital platform of services to help keep the UK border secure. Due to Covid-19, these roles will initially be undertaken from home, but once lockdown is lifted, it is expected that there will be regular travel to client site in Croydon.

On this programme of work, the role of the Business Analysts is to work closely with the client to investigate business situations, and then identify and evaluate options for improvements to systems and operations. The business analyst should apply appropriate techniques (requirements management, process improvement, functional analysis, etc) to define, manage and support implementation of effective solutions to business issues.

Skills required:
Ability to perform stakeholder analysis, mapping influence, impact and commitment of each stakeholder
Leads the client engagement for specific areas of work
Take ownership of one or more areas of work including planning, identifying risks and regular reports to the project manager
Ability to plan and facilitate effective workshops
Applies Applied Intelligence standard approaches on client engagements with assistance / direction, and takes the lead in specific areas
Investigates operational requirements, problems, and opportunities, seeking effective business solutions through improvements in automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes
Effectively plan and manage the requirements process from capture through to change control
Assists in the analysis of stakeholder objectives, and the underlying issues arising from investigations into business requirements and problems, and identifies options for consideration
Identifies potential benefits, and available options for consideration
Works with clients/users in defining acceptance tests
Requirements Management:
Facilitates scoping and business priority-setting for change initiatives of medium size and complexity
Selects appropriate techniques for the elicitation of detailed requirements taking into account the nature of the required changes, established practice and the characteristics and culture of those providing the requirements
Discovers and analyses requirements for fitness for purpose as well as adherence to business objectives and consistency, challenging positively as appropriate
Obtains formal agreement by stakeholders and recipients to scope and requirements and establishes a base-line on which delivery of a solution can commence
Manages requests for and the application of changes to baselined requirements
Identifies the impact on business requirements of interim (e.g. migration) scenarios as well as the required end position
Drives the requirements elicitation process where necessary, identifying what stakeholder input is required
Takes responsibility for the investigation and application of changes to programme scope.
Assesses, analyses, develops, documents and implements changes based on requests for change
You must already hold Security Clearance (SC) to be considered for this role.

About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence

We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals.

At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Applied Intelligence, containing our Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make us a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. Job Title: Senior SAP Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics
Job Description:
About us
GAZPROM Germania GmbH is a subsidiary of the world’s largest natural gas producer, Gazprom. Since its establishment in 1990, GAZPROM Germania has developed into an internationally operating group of 44 companies in 15 countries in Europe and Asia. Its main business activities include the storage and trading of natural gas. It employs approximately 1,800 employees, around 200 of whom work at its Berlin headquarters. Together with its strategic partners, GAZPROM Germania Group helps ensure a reliable, environmentally-friendly, and sustainable energy supply for Europe.

Gazprom Marketing & Trading (GM&T) is an integral part of the GAZPROM Germania Group. Headquartered in London, GM&T operates to provide a global marketing reach, round the clock operational coverage and excellent customer service. Established in 1999, GM&T has grown from a single office in London into a truly global organisation, with around 1000 employees worldwide. With offices in Europe, Asia and the USA, GM&T trades energy commodities including gas, power, oil, LPG, helium, emissions, LNG and FX.

Our culture is defined by our people. Through living our values every day we continue to create a culture that enables us all to succeed. We work as one team with our customers, our parent company and each other in order to understand each other’s needs. With an unstoppable passion for excellence, growth and learning, we’re committed to creating an environment that fosters the development of knowledge, skills and experience, so that our people can thrive and prosper in their careers with us. We believe that we have the best team in the industry which makes us a trusted partner across international capital and energy markets. Our diverse employee base, with a wealth of expertise, knowledge and experience makes GM&T a truly exciting place to work. We encourage new ideas and initiatives as innovative thinking is central to how we do business. Most importantly, we are a growing and developing business where inspired individuals can make a difference and help shape our future.

Role objectives
The Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics (London) is required to support the annual operating plan of the Enterprise Performance Management and Analytics team. This role is a leading member of the EPM team and aligned to the Finance business stakeholders in London.
This role will advise the business how, within the context of business processes, requirements can best be met within the SAP environment. This role is a delivery role that is expected to work on projects, small enhancements, tactical solutions and BAU to enable the SAP Finance roadmap.
In addition, it is expected that the Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics will collaborate with the Corporate Services architect and EPM Capability Manager to identify and propose improvements in both business processes and the system, and work with the business stakeholders to convert improvement proposals into business requirements.

Duties & Responsibilities
The Senior Business and Systems Analyst – Finance Planning and Analytics will be involved in the delivery of Projects, Enhancements and Support to our SAP Business Intelligence, Planning and Consolidation systems.
Analyse the business requirements, business processes, business case and/or technical architectures and develop blueprint and/or designs as per best practises.
Elicit and Document Requirements and preparation of Functional Specification Documents, Process Design Documents, Technical Specification Documents, Test Script and User Manuals.
Participate in the development of prototypes and implementation of data model, reporting, analytics and planning system enhancements in SAP BW, SAP BPC, SAP BW-IP, BusinessObjects and SAP Analytics Cloud.
Working closely with the London Finance team to identify areas of improvement, propose and implement enhancements in an agile delivery environment.
Manage, guide and work with inhouse/onshore, near shore and offshore teams.
Work with Business analysts, end users and partners in multiple locations to deliver a usable solution.

Skills & Competencies
Modelling: Extensive knowledge of data warehouse concepts and experience in SAP BW Architecture on SQL Server, Extended Star-Schema, Multi-Dimensional Modelling, Data Flow Strategy and BW Objects.
Reporting: Use of BW tools i.e. Queries, Workbooks, BEx Analyzer, and Analysis for Office.
Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud would be an advantage.
ABAP: Good knowledge in Reading / Writing Routines, Enhancements (CMOD), Users Exit.
Training: Able to provide Training on the BW Reports to Expert Users and End Users.
Knowledge and hands-on experience implementing SAP planning solutions using SAP BW Integrated Planning or BPC (NW).

Job Title: Pharmaceutical Analyst - Wet Chemistry (12 month FTC)
Job Description:
Job Description
Brand: Reading Scientific Services

Reading Scientific Services Ltd (RSSL) is a cutting-edge Contract Research Organisation (CRO), providing research, analysis and consultancy to the food and pharmaceutical sectors. Whether we are creating new products, validating medicines or solving investigations, we take pride in being a leader in our field, serving clients from across 60 countries.

In 2019, we’ve been recognised as Enlightened Employer, Women in Business and Thames Valley Tech finalists.

Enriched by our parent company Mondelēz International, our diverse team includes 23 nationalities from 300 members, creating a family feel as we strive towards our mission of “Science Enhancing Lives”.

About the team

Pharmaceutical Wet Chemistry is a pivotal team in RSSL: with exponentially increasing client demand, it’s our biggest area of expansion growing 30% from September 2018 to September 2019. Joining this team will allow you to do truly vital work analysing medicines so they can reach patients that need them. You’ll have opportunity to gain new technical and leadership skills as the laboratory continues going from strength to strength.

Purpose of the role

A Pharmaceutical Analyst executes hands-on wet chemistry analyses such as UV, FTIR, titrations and gravimetric techniques.

You’ll ensure routine and complex pharmaceutical projects are performed promptly and to GMP standards, performing practical bench-work and data checking for routine analyses of pharmaceutical raw materials using wet chemistry techniques in accordance with pharmacopoeia or client methods. As required you’ll work with clients to provide technical input into project discussions.

Responsibilities

Technical
Perform routine analysis using wet chemistry techniques
Provide technical direction to the business.
Supervise staff in routine activities and methods.
Ensure effective organisation, integrity of analytical data and provision of results.
Perform data checking and provide interpretation of results for routine testing.
What you will bring

Essential
Experience of using wet chemistry techniques in any setting (eg in academia or as a technician).
Chemistry (or related) degree or equivalent laboratory experience.
Communication skills to develop good working relationships with internal and external clients.
English fluency.
Preferred
Pharmaceutical industry knowledge.
Knowledge GMP systems.
Pharmaceutical Wet Chemistry is a pivotal team in RSSL: with exponentially increasing client demand, it’s our biggest area of expansion growing 30% from September 2018 to September 2019. Joining this team will allow you to do truly vital work analysing medicines so they can reach patients that need them. You’ll have opportunity to gain new technical and leadership skills as the laboratory continues going from strength to strength.A Pharmaceutical Analyst executes hands-on wet chemistry analyses such as UV, FTIR, titrations and gravimetric techniques.

You’ll ensure routine and complex pharmaceutical projects are performed promptly and to GMP standards, performing practical bench-work and data checking for routine analyses of pharmaceutical raw materials using wet chemistry techniques in accordance with pharmacopoeia or client methods. As required you’ll work with clients to provide technical input into project discussions.

#RSSL
The responsibilities of this position are performed within the framework of a regional business model that is defined and managed by Mondelēz Europe GmbH, Switzerland.

No Relocation support available, however for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy
Business Unit Summary
Mondelēz International, Inc. empowers people to snack right in over 150 countries around the world. We are leading the future of snacking with mouth-watering iconic brands such as Oreo, belVita, LU and Ritz biscuits; Cadbury Dairy Milk, Green & Blacks, Milka and Toblerone chocolate; Philadelphia and Dairylea cheese; and Maynards Bassetts, Trebor and Trident gums. Our more than 80,000 colleagues around the world are key to the success of our business. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are. Join us on our journey to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.


Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
