Job Role
Are you someone with hands on experience of SQL and wanting to take the next step in your career? We're expanding our team and now is an excellent chance to grow and put those skills you’ve been developing to great use!
You will bring hands on experience of T-SQL/MySQL and SQL Server to be able to support and troubleshoot our bespoke inhouse IT applications. You'll play a key part to ensure our business applications continue to run smoothly. Being highly organised and logical in your approach, you also enjoy finding was to enhance or improve how things are done and you'll be given plenty opportunities to make suggestions for improvement here.
As an Application Support Analyst, you know how important it is that our end users understand how to use our applications in the most effective and efficient way. Being part of the team, you’ll get to demonstrate you have the passion to deliver an excellent service to our colleagues and the drive and knowledge to take ownership of problems to ensure they are resolved to completion.
Who are we?
Neilson Financial Services is a rapidly growing FinTech company that provides the GB market with innovative, customer-focused, life insurance products. We make a difference to people’s lives by giving them certainty about caring for others: we are there for them when they can’t be there for their loved ones
We are a life insurance provider who offers a wide range of first-class Life insurance products via multiple brands and corporate partnerships.
We believe in offering our customers straightforward life insurance. We aim to provide a comprehensive range of innovative products and deliver exemplary service levels to our customers and corporate partners, providing a consistently high quality, full integrated customer experience.
We have been awarded Feefo's top rating, the Trusted Merchant Gold Award, for our outstanding customer service. We will give you all the expertise and support so you can be outstanding in what you do.
What’s it like working for us?
At Neilson we do more, we try harder, we go further. We believe in investing in our people and using the latest technology to give us a competitive edge in our journey to becoming the leading global provider in direct life insurance.
Join our team to become a Neilsoner, and we will help you strive for excellence and be the best in everything that you do.

A passion for innovation and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.

Job Description:
Job Purpose

The role is for an experienced Business Analyst who specialises in Risk and Finance Change the Bank initiatives. The role will be to liaise with the Risk and Finance teams together with technology change teams and support the CRS (Credit Rating System) Project Manager to deliver the repatriation of CRS and SpreadPac (Financial Statement spreading tool) from Standard Bank South Africa in South Africa back to ICBCS in London and assist with the setup of the end-to-end credit rating capability.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to deal with colleagues and users at all levels of seniority

Assist with knowledge transfer from the relevant teams in South Africa to London
Assists in adherence to project deadlines and schedules
Communicates and applies project standards
Consistently delivers high-quality services
Preferred Qualifications and Experience

End-to-end hands on experience in the implementation of rating, PD, LGD models, IFRS9, credit data requirements and workflow systems
Experience in the definition and implementation of Credit Risk operating models
Experience in the design and implementation of Credit Risk processes
Demonstrable track record of working within Risk Change Projects
Understanding of risk and control
Ability to contribute on multiple project workstreams in parallel
Competencies:
Adheres to principles and values
Persuading and influencing
Applying expertise and technology
Delivering results and meeting customer expectations

Able to work with remote teams

Takes a "hands on" approach and is willing to help out with other tasks as appropriate

Proactive, anticipates issues rather than waiting for them to materialise and reacting

With OneWeb, You'll Get To:
Be part of the technology revolution in Space
Bring transformative connectivity to remote places for the first time
Support the launch and operations of our LEO satellite constellation
Work with razor-sharp colleagues in a company where people come first
Who You Are: You're passionate about satellite communications and are excited to be a self-starter who enjoys juggling the various facets of satellite operations. You're agile and love the nitty gritty. You read, learn, examine, and are full of ideas. You're sparked by a fast pace and new challenges. You want to make a real difference in the world by revolutionizing technology in Space.

What You'll Do:

The Flight Dynamics Mission Analyst will work in the Flight Dynamics (FD) Team to perform pre-mission and in-orbit operational analysis for OneWeb's constellation of over 650 satellites. The Mission Analyst will also assist in development of the Flight Dynamics System which performs all the FD related tasks for the constellation. The candidate should possess strong analytical and computing skills. Understanding of scientific and numerical computing limitations and issues in the simulation of physical systems is a necessity.

The candidate should provide support to operations during normal working hours. The candidate may periodically provide shift support during critical satellite operations and may periodically staff the on-call support rotation such that safe and efficient operations are ensured by the Spacecraft Operations Team on a 24/7 basis. The Flight Dynamics Mission Analyst plays an integral role in the successful operations of the OneWeb constellation.

Duties will include:
Perform full mission lifetime Flight Dynamics analyses from launch to mission to de-orbit including:
Maneuver Planning and Performance
Trajectory Analysis and Design
Orbit Determination
Constellation Analysis
Support development of the Flight Dynamics ground software
Support development of the Flight Dynamics Operational Cadence
Support Automation of Flight Dynamics processes
Support system readiness, planning, preparation, execution, and evaluation for all phases of spacecraft lifetime; from launch to mission to de-orbit
Requirements development and verification
Writing complex specifications, interface control documents, and engineering reports
Support mission CONOPS development
What It Takes:
MS in Aerospace Engineering
5-10 years of satellite astrodynamics analysis experience including orbit determination, maneuver planning, error analysis, and perturbation analysis
Experience with Matlab
Experience with orbit analysis tools, i.e. GMAT, OREKIT, STK, FreeFlyer
Demonstrated ability to work independently when necessary
High level of problem-solving capabilities
Ability to work in an environment with rapidly evolving system requirements
Excellent oral and written communication skills
What We'd Love:
Satellite mission operations experience
Experience with common computer development languages, i.e. C++, Java, Python
Where You'll Be: Satellite Operations Center in Tysons Corner, VA or London, UK.

* No 3rd party agencies

OneWeb is a global leader in connectivity from Space. We are building a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites with a network of global gateway stations and a range of user terminals to provide an affordable, fast, high-bandwidth and low-latency broadband communications services, connected to the IoT future and a pathway to 5G. Find out more at http://www.oneweb.world

OneWeb treats the protection of personal data submitted to it seriously. By submitting this application, you agree to the collection and retention of your personal data by OneWeb and acknowledge notice of, and understand the terms of OneWeb's Privacy Policy (as amended from time to time).

Wunderman Thompson Commerce is a new global eCommerce consultancy that applies strategy, technical know-how and outstanding design to make a big impact through eCommerce.

How? By creating outstanding websites and inspired shopper journeys. It's why we work with some of the most exciting brands around such as Tempur, DFS, Boots, Xerox, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Specialized and Ted Baker.

We're an inclusive group of more than 1350 thinkers and doers from WPP's leading commerce agencies: Salmon, POSSIBLE Commerce and Gorilla Group alongside two Amazon specialists - all under the world-renowned Wunderman brand. Our reputation is based on having the best the business - people who are inspired yet straight-talking, and who really want to understand not just our clients but their customers. We are passionate about innovation in everything we do, and proud of what our people achieve, empowering and respecting every one of them.

Together, we keep our clients and their customers inspired and ahead through digital, future-ready sites, solutions and services. When our clients win - we win.

With new, state-of-the-art offices in Watford, and two other cool agency offices in Central London, we've got 20 locations mapped across Europe, North America and Asia.

As our business grows internationally, we're seeking new people who share our values and work ethic. We especially want to encourage more women to join, and take a key role in shaping some of the best eCommerce sites and experiences in the world.

See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!


Who we are


At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day.

Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.


The role


As a Trading Support Analyst your primary objective will be to provide Tier 2 support for Iress trading products and initiatives primarily across order routing, connectivity and trading solutions. You will be accountable for seeking a successful outcome on behalf of the trading client, completing and managing tactical processes and initiatives required to resolve issues that are raised.


What you will be doing
As a Support Analyst, you will diagnose and troubleshoot trading related issues on behalf of clients either in UAT or production.
For issues that require additional support, you will triage and escalate to one of a number of teams either in the UK or abroad seeking further information to resolve the clients' issue
You will document the required changes and liaise with the relevant product and development teams seeking swift resolution via a hot fix process.
Diagnose and troubleshoot complex trading related issues reported by clients.
Provide analysis towards creating development items relating to client issues or new functionality required by clients.

What you will need
Prior experience with Iress products and solutions is not essential but would be desirable
Similarly, if you have any experience with any order management and trading systems this would be an advantage
An understanding of listed financial markets and products
You will have the ability to run SQL queries and scripts
Ability to prioritise, delegate, respond to and follow-up issues in a timely and appropriate manner
Knowledge of FIX protocol would be highly beneficial

Why work with us
Competitive remuneration
Global opportunities
Casual dress, flexible work policy
Access to learning and development programs
Health Benefits including Private Medical Insurance

3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives
Global 36-hour hackathon

25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays
Profit Share Plan
Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work

Are you a creative individual experienced in the financial modelling of energy assets? This is a fantastic opportunity to join a small but growing global company leading the way towards a cleaner, more efficient and secure energy future.

Highview Power’s patented long-duration, zero-emission CRYOBattery™ energy storage system utilises cryogenic technology and surplus electricity, at times of low demand/cost, to make liquid air. It stores this for conversion back into electricity, to be released into the grid at times of high demand/cost. This award-winning technology has been dubbed as "the missing link" to making renewable energy the resilient, reliable and cost-effective alternative to fossil fuels.

The Business Analyst will be integral to helping us secure our position as the leading supplier and developer of energy storage and grid-stability technology. The winning candidate will work in a multicultural London-based team, analysing the economics of prospective CRYOBattery™ projects. Working with our bright engineers and business developers, you’ll help convert an understanding of client/market needs into financial models that provide a clear picture of costs, prices and overall financial viability of our future projects.

We value our team members and are committed to creating a positive, inspiring and diverse work environment. We will provide the successful candidate with training and development opportunities, a competitive salary with share options and the chance to be a part of building a cleaner, sustainable future.

Key responsibilities
Build, run and maintain financial models that help business developers and senior management understand the available financial returns of prospective projects.
Understanding the electricity market in key countries, and the opportunity for Highview’s commercial-scale energy storage and grid-stability plants to make money from them. (There will also be occasional liaison with business developers and analysts in our offices in USA and Spain.)
Providing pricing support for proposals going to prospective clients via our business developers. This includes identifying and quantifying potential risks and recommending appropriate mitigations or price adjustments.
Owning knowledge base of financial/engineering assumptions that underpin our suite of financial models.
Providing ad-hoc analysis to other members of the analysis team, including the Commercial Director.
Analyse and identify project risks including impact of regulatory changes and economic environment on prospective projects.
Please note that this is not an exhaustive list of general tasks and duties, and that the job description may be subject to changes according to the requirements of the organisation. The job holder will be expected to complete all tasks within his/her level of skill and ability

Requirements

Essential qualifications & experience
Bachelor’s degree within a STEM discipline or proven
Deep knowledge in financial modelling or excellent track record in financial modelling e.g. Discounted Cash Flow, {Project Finance) within a company focussed on developing and financing energy or other infrastructure projects.
Great interpersonal skills and ability to work with people at all levels of the organisation
Ability to create presentations, spreadsheets and reports to a high standard.
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Deep knowledge of Microsoft Office suit (PowerPoint, Excel, Word); strong excel skills required
Able to manage workload effectively and deliver quality work on schedule
Desirable
Master’s degree.
Engineering qualification.
Experience within the electricity sector.
Foreign language skills.
Personal Qualities / Specific Requirements
Has a genuine interest in the environment, sustainability and renewable energy. Can summarise cryogenic storage.
Enjoys working in a fast-paced, challenging environment.
Attention to detail.
Questioning nature, not afraid to ask the silly question.
High level of integrity and diplomacy.
A highly motivated, reliable and responsible individual.
Behavioural Competencies
Client First - Acts as an ambassador for the company, is courteous and builds strong, professional client relationships. Relates well to all kinds of people, builds rapport easily and appropriately; and talks about clients in a positive way. Gathers information from customers to gauge their expectations and better understand their needs, and to identify issues or problems. Suggests appropriate alternative options and agrees the best way forward with the customer. Understands and values the importance of seeking feedback.
Change and Innovation - Looks for new and better ways to do things, generates new ideas and is resourceful in finding solutions or solving problems. Regularly participates and initiates discussions to find innovative solutions and encourages others to identify and welcome change.
Developing self - Takes a realistic view of own strengths and weaknesses. Approaches new experiences and situations as an opportunity to learn. Is open to feedback and accepts personal responsibility for actively improving own skills and effectiveness. Uses intranet and other company tools to build own knowledge of the company, it's people, services, policies and procedures.
Team working - Develops effective, supportive and collaborative relationships with colleagues. Actively involves other people, asking for ideas and opinions. Is a team player who is considerate towards others and contributes towards a positive team spirit. Adapts own behaviour to respond constructively to behaviours and feelings of colleagues.Puts own agenda to one side in order to achieve the team's tasks.
Planning & Organising - Identifies the key issues, effectively prioritises, plans ahead and manages expectations. Can meet deadlines and respond to tasks within a timescale. Applies structure to work, balancing everyday tasks and duties against projects and adhoc requests.
Making considered decisions – A first class problem solver. Analyzes available information and demonstrates a logical approach to assessing the situation using clear criteria before taking action. Is clear about allocating responsibility and accountability. Escalates high risk/cost matters appropriately with a proposed solution.
Resilience - Can work under pressure and deal with situations calmly. Sticks with the task even when it gets difficult, tedious or inconvenient. Takes responsibility for seeing things through. Has an ability to manage difficult or demanding people in an assertive yet professional manner. Puts in effort to understanding resistance or obstacles and sees possibilities even in negative situations.
Flexibility - Actively takes on whatever role or task is required to achieve the business goals. Approaches work with a ‘hands on’, ‘can do’ attitude. Prepared to roll up sleeves. No task is beneath them.
Effective Communication - Ability to build rapport with a diverse range of stakeholders. Listens to other's opinions and checks to ensure that needs and expectations have been understood. Both written and verbal communication is structured logically, delivered with confidence, clarity, tact and credibility; and is adapted appropriately to the situation.Keeps others informed of progress and provides updates when things do not go as expected.

Job Title: International Royalty Income Analyst - 12 Month FTC
Job Description:
International Royalty Income Analyst - 12 Month FTC
Job Description:
With its broad and diverse roster of new stars and legendary artists, Warner Music Group is home to a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, East West, Elektra, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Bros., Warner Classics and Warner Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers with a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide.
For more than four decades, WMG has been an industry-leading force in providing a world-class array of services designed to help artists and labels grow their careers and their businesses. Artist & Label Services is the umbrella for WEA (Warner-Elektra-Atlantic) – the pioneering WEA distribution and marketing network – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.
International Royalty Income Analyst, Warner Chappell Music - 12 Month FTC
A little bit about our team:
The International Royalty Income Team sits within the Administration department of Warner Chappell Music, reporting to the International Royalty Processing Manager. The team’s role of managing and reconciling the royalty processing of the European territories’ income is integral to the business. This involves working closely with the Royalties, Finance and Copyright teams in both the UK and in other European offices to ensure all income is processed and reconciled in a timely manner to meet our contractual obligations to our clients.
Why this could be your next big break:
We are Warner Chappell Music. Where songwriters are heard. As an International Royalty Income Analyst, alongside the 3 other Analysts in the team you will be working with excel spreadsheets, dealing with a variety of data file formats, getting this data into our Tango system, performing reconciliations to demonstrate accuracy, sharing in team meetings, frequently communicating with the European teams via email and Skype calls and reporting back to your manager and to the rest of the business. You will be proud of your responsibility for the accurate accounting of royalties to our songwriters.
Here you’ll get to:
You will receive monthly cash receipt details from our Affiliate offices, along with the accompanying royalty statements and (sometimes huge!) data files from societies and 3rd parties.
You will build effective working relationships with Heads of Admin of these European territories.
You will review and analyse the statement and data files received.
You will create excel files for processing where needed, manually calculating royalty income where required.
You will load and process the royalty income into our Tango system.
You will match the income to the correct works on Tango to guarantee money hits our songwriters’ royalty statements.
You will reconcile the income processed on a monthly and half yearly basis.
You will work with the team to reduce the value of income going into Suspense by conducting thorough research.
You will offer support to the International Royalty Processing Manager on issues that arise and projects as necessary.
About you:
You have brilliant interpersonal skills and are confident in communicating with your colleagues.
You have excellent mathematical and analytical skills.
You have excellent technical skills in excel and in data manipulation.
You have excellent organisational and time management skills.
You have a proactive, flexible attitude and a willingness to learn.
You have the drive to work as part of a successful team.
You have a passion for music.
It would be music to our ears if you also had:
Experience of working in a busy office environment.
A good understanding/have the experience of the workings of a Music Publisher or a Collection Society.
A background in Finance either through work experience or formal qualifications.
Why join us?
Here at Warner Music Group we’re all about our people. We are one global company made up exclusively of knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people.
It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music - at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart by embracing a philosophy of innovation – it’s part of our company's DNA.
Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the most influential forces in culture today.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.
We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, familial status, military or veteran status, or any other legal recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to Recruitment@wmg.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company
FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy
The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture
Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

Job Description:
Position - Business Analyst
Location - Uxbridge
Purpose of the Role:
As a Business Analyst, provide timely and useful sales plans, reporting, and business insight to support the commercial director in achieving the business’ goals. Support the development of reporting and commercial processes and software tools both to enable this and to ensure that standards are adhered to.
Main Responsibilities:
1. Timely delivery of all regular local, UK, and Group facing business sales and service reporting and ad hoc analysis as required:
month- and year-end financial, management, and strategic reports
actual performance vs., forecast, prior year, budget, and orders/pipeline
customer/product/time, volume, revenue, cost, actual margin. ROI
Engineer visits, distance traveled, parts used. Efficiency
using all systems available to the business, locally and from HQ, which the role-holder will be expected to become a power user of. Continually monitor to ensure accuracy & relevance.
2. Provide pro-active & responsive business insight to the commercial director and their senior team. Analyse and interpret actual sales, marketing, and service delivery performance vs. budget, prior year, and forecast. Make recommendations on actions to be taken to improve profitability, capture opportunities towards the achievement of strategic and commercial aims, or avoid risks to the same. Support development of the Strategic Plan.
3. Lead the sales and operational planning process within the business.
4. Research and build financial models to investigate and compare commercial options and make recommendations on how best to grow the business and develop profitability.
5. Support the service team in maintaining and improving the accuracy of the product installs & resource forecasts.
6. Own the application of working capital and impairment rules to inventory held.
7. Act as main UK point of contact for Group-Controlling questions in regard to product service and quality costs, and contract churn.
8. Responsible for the budgeting process of service resource, materials for maintenance and troubleshooting, costs of disposals and non-quality, including:
Ensuring relevant Excel templates are produced and available to the service teams and in line with Group requirements
Provision of reports to review, challenge, and adapt the numbers during the budgeting process.
9. Review the cost of sale deviations. Identify inventory risks from slow-moving, obsolete, or quarantined stock; and calculate the impairment required for these risks under IARE rules. Ensure Costs of Non-Quality are understood and recovered where possible.
10. Pro-actively propose process improvements to ensure work remains value-adding and in line with company strategies. Support business users in developing their own operational reports.
11. Any other ad hoc tasks or project work as instructed by the Commercial Business Partner, or the Commercial Director.
Professional Experience:
Experience working in an analytical role within a Finance/Controlling or operations environment, especially for an organisation with a field-service resource installing and maintaining an installed estate
Experience with reporting and forecasting systems, including MS Power BI stack
Comfortable both manipulating and joining data, and making assumptions where data is missing
Advanced Excel skills
Ability to question/challenge at all levels
Ability to convert technical information to meet the needs of internal customers
Experience in business and commercial analysis and reporting
Familiar with basic financial accounting and business scorecards
Desirable: Experience with SAP ERP, IFS, FSM

The challenge...

Vortexa combines deep domain expertise in the energy industry with advance AI technology to provide users with actionable information and insights in real-time.

As we continue our rapid growth, we are looking for a freight market analyst to join our Market Research team in London.This exciting opportunity will allow you to combine your understanding of commercial freight markets with insights from our intelligent analytics platform to develop and drive new analytical and research solutions.

You will work in close collaboration with analyst colleagues in London, Singapore and Houston to build a complete view of shipping market activity in oil and gas markets and identify the key implications for our commodities and shipping clients. This will include leading the development and maintenance of a robust library of examples on how Vortexa-derived insights influence or relate to key freight market developments.

Working to fulfil client requests on deadline, you will provide customers with analytical support, including through written materials. In addition, you will attend relevant industry events and take pride in building and maintaining a strong network of industry contacts.

Requirements

You have...
3+ years of relevant experience as a freight market analyst or researcher
A deep understanding of freight market trading, including fundamental market drivers, chartering strategy and pricing structures.
Excellent analysis and numeracy skills, with advanced Excel and data analysis proficiency.
A results-orientated outlook and are able to efficiently prioritise multiple tasks with limited supervision.
You ideally have...
Experience within the research team of a tanker shipbroker, owner, or charterer.
Knowledge of crude oil and refined products markets
Benefits

What we offer you...
A vibrant, diverse company pushing ourselves and the technology to deliver beyond the cutting edge
The opportunity to work with AI driven technology in a start-up environment with industry experts in commodity trading
An open, collaborative and supportive working culture built on merit, which celebrates creative thinking and ‘getting things done’
Competitive remuneration package
Private health care
Equity - we're all acting as business-savvy and responsible company owners, whilst having fun and enjoying the journey together along the way
Continuous training and development opportunities
Work Perks - discounted travel and cinema tickets, shopping and travel
Friday socials, games and monthly pizza (although currently this is 'Virtual Vortexa Friday' with updates, workshops and fun stuff!)
About Vortexa:

At Vortexa, our mission is to open, connect and optimize the energy world through pioneering technology an unmatche marketinformation. We work at the frontier of technology applied to the energy markets and together we are creating the future of our industry.

Working at Vortexa is fast paced yet extremely rewarding - we set big goals, encourage brave ideas and strive to innovate in everything we do. After all, the decisions we make today are set to impact one of the world’s biggest industries tomorrow. You can expect a stimulating environment with a collaborative spirit; all while maintaining creative independence and hands-on approach that only a start-up can offer.

All of our employees are shareholders, meaning that the entire team is equally committed to Vortexa’s vision. To support you on your journey, we offer private healthcare, monthly workshops led by our team of experts and socials every Friday to thank you for all the hard work put in during the week.

We are passionate about equality, diversity and inclusivity. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and guarantee all of our team members the same opportunities and rewards regardless of their gender, race, age, belief system and sexual orientation.

An exciting opportunity to join a large international bank's expanding Trade Surveillance Team. The role offers a wide variety of responsibilities from conducting investigations, project work, advisory to 1st LOD, writing risk assessments and more - not just processing alerts. The bank offers a great financial package, is renowned for its good culture and has a strong promotional track.
Main Purpose of the Role :
You will be part of the surveillance team initially. The main purpose of the role is to deliver monitoring and surveillance applying the risk framework and standards applicable from time to time. In addition to conducting day to day surveillance activities the role also requires you to support compliance projects and management reports.
As part your development and collaboration within CA&T you may also be asked to support wider initiatives and undertake other tasks and responsibilities in CA&T.
Key Responsibilities:
In this role, you will be responsible for conducting and supporting the surveillance and compliance assurance programme across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you. Your specific responsibilities will include:
Carry out testing and monitoring work with the aim of identifying any attempt by clients of members of staff of the firm to commit financial crime, market abuse, manipulation, or other breach of rules or regulations.
Complete the regular and ad-hoc tasks necessary to complete the reviews, monitoring, testing and/or surveillance and other work which makes up the department’s risk based testing programme.
Assist with the planning and implementation of bespoke or future BAU testing and monitoring programmes and update existing programmes.
Assist in the interpretation and analysis of technical business information or data (using basic to intermediate data and excel skills).
Assist in the creation and maintenance of documents and procedures to track all relevant surveillance processes.
Prepare relevant management information to stakeholders.
Assist with recommendations and enhancements to existing processes and develop new processes for identifying and monitoring Compliance and Conduct risk.
You will be expected to perform your responsibilities under the supervision of and reporting to a line manager. You will be expected to ensure that your line manager is fully aware at all times of your activities and to escalate any issues to the line manager or the Head of Department .
Skills and Experience:
Functional / Technical Competencies:
Basic to intermediate understanding of one or more of the following business or product areas - Equities, FX, Benchmarks (eg Libor and WMR), Fixed Income & Rates.
Basic to intermediate understanding of regulatory and compliance risk frameworks and risk based testing.
Experience of building relationships with the Front Office and escalation of issues.
Project support or management capabilitied gained from supporting smaller regulatory and systems related projects.
Basic to intermediate understanding and use of Excel and market data sources (eg Bloomberg).
Work Experience:
Circa 2 years+ of experience in the trade surveillance space.
